The top part shows the pulse sequence used to create the Bell pair, while the bottom part displays the experimentally measured Pauli vector components of the two qubits. The generated state is compared with the ideal Bell state (|00⟩ + |11⟩)/√2, demonstrating high fidelity.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Deterministic teleportation of a quantum gate between two logical qubits_images/Deterministic teleportation of a quantum gate between two logical qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000030_d235fb3eff33abe2dd3e1fba2296c632e9d00b2b84252947d24a84825f77a915.png
image_title: Extended Binomial QPT Data: Conditioned Results Without Feedforward
description: This image presents experimental results of quantum process tomography (QPT) for a CNOT gate, conditioned on different measurement outcomes ('00', '01', '10', and '11'). The plot shows the Pauli component expectation values for various Pauli operators (II, IX, XI, XX, IZ, ZX, ZI, ZZ). Each panel corresponds to a specific measurement outcome, illustrating how the process matrix varies depending on the outcome. The data highlights that without applying feedforward operations, the processes are modified by single-qubit operations, as indicated by differing signs between the outcomes. When all measurement results are combined ('All'), only certain Pauli operators remain invariant, reflecting the feedforward operations typically applied.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Deterministic teleportation of a quantum gate between two logical qubits_images/Deterministic teleportation of a quantum gate between two logical qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000031_a14f6f66d51400e8d80494e68f2abda742bd3043a02ed1b5a00ac2e1122df597.png
image_title: Extended Binomial QPT Data: Conditioned Results Without Feedforward
description: This image presents the results of extended binomial quantum process tomography (QPT) data. It shows the process matrix in the Pauli transfer representation (bottom) and a reconstructed state represented in the Pauli basis (top). The figure is focused on conditioned QPT results when feedforward operations are not applied. The first four panels ('00', '01', '10', and '11') represent processes conditioned on measurement outcomes, each with similar features but differing signs indicating modifications by single-qubit operations. When all measurement results are combined ('All'), most features are washed away, leaving only certain Pauli operators invariant: {II, IX, ZI, ZX}. This behavior is consistent with the state tomography results at the top, where each measurement outcome heralds a different Bell state, leading to an incoherent addition of states resulting in a completely mixed state.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Deterministic teleportation of a quantum gate between two logical qubits_images/Deterministic teleportation of a quantum gate between two logical qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000032_0d7648bd653598ab8183a7fe8b9b0241bfa2bf37b30267bed0b189c1ce1bb3ea.png
image_title: Extended Binomial QPT Data
description: This image presents extended binomial quantum process tomography (QPT) data, divided into two parts: (a) conditioned QPT results without feedforward operations and (b) conditioned QPT results with feedforward operations. Each panel shows the process matrix in the Pauli transfer representation (bottom) and a reconstructed state represented in the Pauli basis (top). The measurement outcomes ('00', '01', '10', '11', and 'All') are analyzed for both scenarios. Without feedforward, each measurement outcome modifies the process differently, while with feedforward, all outcomes indicate the same CNOT process. The color scale represents values from -1 to 1, illustrating the fidelity of the processes.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units_images/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_8cfb6111f277cdcbbabcfbc0d09996e1c0f4cada36fbb914d350b3f5cfaa3282.png
image_title: 量子处理器单元（QPU）与主机CPU的交互序列图
description: 该图片展示了一个序列图，描述了主机CPU与量子处理器单元（QPU）之间的交互过程。具体步骤包括：1. 主机CPU发送程序到QPU；2. QPU中的量子控制单元（QCU）解析程序；3. 将程序编译为指令集架构（ISA）；4. 发出指令；5. 将指令解析为门操作；6. 执行门操作；7. 接收读出结果；8. 解析读出结果；9. 返回解决方案给主机CPU。此图详细说明了QPU内部的QRAM模型如何通过门操作实现量子计算，并展示了QCU在解析和执行指令中的关键作用。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units_images/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_6711a03f6c89b6497ce844b74d0b6edb12ef19556b4c64881789cbdf98105e86.png
image_title: Asymmetric Multi-Processor Architecture for Integrating a Stand-Alone Quantum Computer with an HPC System
description: This diagram illustrates an asymmetric multi-processor architecture where a stand-alone quantum computer (QC) is integrated with a high-performance computing (HPC) system. The HPC side consists of multiple CPUs connected to a network interface, which communicates with the QC server. The QC system includes components such as a control and vacuum system, a cryogen pump, a server, and a shielded room housing a dilution refrigerator containing the quantum processing unit (QPU). This setup highlights the substantial infrastructure required for interfacing and controlling the QPU, emphasizing the physical hardware challenges in integrating quantum computing into existing HPC systems.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units_images/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_f3a25027c5d676b63b4dc9b926c83cc083cd84f43d173da8d89b5fb1ea501916.png
image_title: 量子计算服务器的客户端-服务器模型
description: 该图展示了量子计算（QC）服务器与高性能计算（HPC）系统的客户端-服务器模型。HPC系统中的多个CPU节点通过网络接口与QC服务器通信，QC服务器包含多个QPU，并且这些QPU之间可能通过量子互连进行交互。虚线表示量子互连，实线表示经典互连。这种架构体现了云量子计算的概念，允许用户以服务形式访问量子计算资源，尽管存在通信延迟的代价。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units_images/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_b344a459b2d462b40106e7ad1567949a57218a2d5ed32d32b0523b9582369878.png
image_title: HPC系统中的量子处理器单元（QPU）与经典CPU的集成架构
description: 该图展示了高性能计算（HPC）系统中，多个经典CPU节点通过共享资源模型与一个量子处理器单元（QPU）进行交互的架构。每个CPU节点通过经典互连与QPU相连，QPU作为共享资源管理来自多个CPU的请求。这种设计减少了通信延迟，但仍然存在瓶颈，尤其是在数据聚合和请求管理方面。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units_images/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_41eea6ad9ab0dcf14f1eaee063fffeef3ed8b7e76e18f74e29272212944da03b.png
image_title: 加速器模型：量子处理单元（QPU）与经典处理器（CPU）的紧密集成
description: 该图展示了高性能计算（HPC）系统中的一种加速器模型，其中多个经典处理器（CPU）与量子处理单元（QPU）紧密集成。每个CPU节点都直接连接到一个专用的QPU，类似于现代GPU加速器的集成方式。这种设计简化了QPU接口，并自然地匹配了许多现有程序数据访问模式，其中顶层内存管理由领域分解驱动，低级数据移动限制在单个节点内。此模型通过减少通信延迟和最大化计算加速，推动了量子并行性的应用，同时减少了对现有源代码的重构需求。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units_images/High-Performance Computing with Quantum Processing Units-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_95b88e21d8dc476bec8f1c4762bf7dbaefb8c0e760ec8459c0b27a9c3d15c7a6.png
image_title: 紧耦合的量子处理器单元（QPU）与高性能计算（HPC）系统集成模型
description: 该图展示了紧耦合的加速器模型，其中多个CPU节点分别与独立的量子处理器单元（QPU）紧密集成。每个CPU节点通过直接接口与对应的QPU相连，减少了通信延迟，从而最大化计算加速效果。这种设计类似于现代HPC系统中GPU加速器的集成方式，简化了QPU接口，并自然匹配现有程序数据访问模式，支持多量子算法的同时运行。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Hartree-Fock on a superconducting qubit quantum computer - science_images/Hartree-Fock on a superconducting qubit quantum computer - science-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_230ebf6e89886d29c8866163a8e2e6ceb3bb8ebb729da89b0bbd41d7079e3af9.png
image_title: Basis Rotation Circuit and Compilation for H12 Chain
description: This image illustrates the basis rotation circuit and its compilation for simulating a linear chain of 12 hydrogen atoms (H12). The left panel shows the initial orbitals obtained by diagonalizing the Hamiltonian, ignoring electron-electron interactions. The central panel depicts the basis rotation ansatz using Givens rotation gates, each represented by a gray box with a rotation angle θ. The right panel shows the decomposition of each Givens rotation gate into √iSWAP gates and single-qubit Rz gates. Additionally, the bottom part of the image provides details on the implementation of these gates and the layout of qubits on a subgrid of the Sycamore device, highlighting the linear topology required for the circuit.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Hartree-Fock on a superconducting qubit quantum computer - science_images/Hartree-Fock on a superconducting qubit quantum computer - science-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_aa0bd1148fac687a9976ab107b01d24a52efb99eab7f932f5db981e47d53e3ff.png
image_title: 氢链的静态和VQE性能
description:
该图展示了不同长度（6、8、10、12个原子）的氢链在不同键长下的能量曲线及其误差分析。图A至F分别对应6、8、10、12量子比特的情况，其中：
- 图A-F的主图显示了氢链的能量与键长的关系，能量单位为Hartree。
- 图B展示了不同处理方法（原始数据、粒子数选择、纯化、VQE）下的能量误差，对数尺度下显示了化学精度的达成情况。
- 图C展示了优化迭代次数与能量误差的关系，表明随着迭代增加，误差显著降低。
- 图D-F中的小插图详细比较了不同处理方法（如粒子数选择、纯化、VQE）对能量误差的影响，进一步验证了方法的有效性。
整体上，该图说明了通过VQE和其他误差缓解技术，可以实现高精度的分子能量计算，尤其是在6和8量子比特的情况下达到了化学精度。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Hartree-Fock on a superconducting qubit quantum computer - science_images/Hartree-Fock on a superconducting qubit quantum computer - science-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_0364d21e518656d5cbc8b81da7b3811177dc51b4f8181b1e3ceef14a6fc49b3b.png
image_title: Diazene Isomerization Energy Curves
description: This image depicts the energy curves for the isomerization of diazene between cis and trans configurations. The plot shows two reaction pathways: one for in-plane rotation (solid red curve) and another for out-of-plane rotation (transparent blue curve). Key features include transition states TS1 and TS2, marked with corresponding structures. Error bars are present at various points along the reaction coordinate, indicating the uncertainty in energy calculations. The solid black line represents the optimized 10-qubit energy, while the transparent gray line indicates the full 12-qubit system, demonstrating that freezing the lowest two levels does not significantly alter the model chemistry. The yellow arrows on TS1 and TS2 indicate the reaction coordinates for each pathway.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Hartree-Fock on a superconducting qubit quantum computer - science_images/Hartree-Fock on a superconducting qubit quantum computer - science-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_43c3c1b24ed956557029c54b29e986e1e41ed8183b01d976c1c469f665b4fb06.png
image_title: Science期刊标志
description: 图片显示了《Science》期刊的红色标志，这是科学出版领域的知名学术期刊。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_73e37d6c31841d10b839307b79e60b0d5a292c19d4b588ded50931ffbc81607a.png
image_title: 量子计算设备的本机门与软件可见门对比
description: 该图展示了不同量子计算技术（包括离子阱、超导约瑟夫森结）的本机门和软件可见门。左侧列出了Yb离子在电磁场中的本机门和软件可见门，中间列出了IBM使用的超导约瑟夫森结的本机门和软件可见门，右侧列出了Rigetti使用的超导约瑟夫森结的本机门和软件可见门。每种技术都有其特定的单量子比特门（1Q）和双量子比特门（2Q），以及它们如何通过软件接口暴露给用户。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_632f50813e65095ac76dccd6fd12dbc38943071c4d87144dc87b9562f80f5b62.png
image_title: IBM Q14 硬件支持的 2Q (CNOT) 门每日误差率变化
description: 该图展示了 IBM Q14 系统中四个硬件支持的 2Q（CNOT）门在不同日期的每日误差率变化。图中的 CNOT 门分别标记为 CNOT 6,8、CNOT 7,8、CNOT 9,8 和 CNOT 13,1，它们的误差率随时间波动显著。整体而言，2Q 误差率平均为 7.95%，但在不同 qubits 和日期之间存在高达 9 倍的变化。这反映了 NISQ 系统中误差率的不稳定性，以及对量子计算性能的影响。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_1143049a5b8939255e28575233c2646f6c0c3719388f7b79746eb6aa287ca166.png
image_title: TriQ 工具流架构图
description: 该图片展示了 TriQ 工具流的架构，用于将量子计算程序从高级语言（Scaffold）编译为优化后的可执行代码。输入包括应用程序（以 Scaffold 编写）、应用输入数据、设备特定输入（如量子比特拓扑和噪声数据）。流程首先通过 ScaffCC 编译器将程序转换为 LLVM IR，然后进行可靠性矩阵计算、量子比特映射、门与通信调度、原生门操作优化等步骤，最终生成针对不同供应商格式（如 IBM OpenQASM、Rigetti Quil 和 UMD TI ASM）的优化可执行代码。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_402cf63d50f4e859969c18d4bcd0b51505598c9bf7e290438afeb88c0cfd9f1c.png
image_title: 量子电路示例：单量子比特门与双量子比特门
description:
该图片展示了一个简单的量子电路，包含单量子比特门（1Q）和双量子比特门（2Q）。具体包括：
- 单量子比特门（Hadamard门H）应用于所有量子比特。
- 双量子比特门（CNOT门），其中控制量子比特为p1，目标量子比特为p3。
- 读出操作（Readout）在每个量子比特的最后执行。
此电路图清晰地展示了量子门的操作顺序和量子比特之间的相互作用，是理解量子算法和量子电路设计的基础。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_6f1cb6dd6c447e1d6f4244d2960581b3b5723533e0e5c5302eccf38c96baabf9.png
image_title: 8-qubit Device Topology
description: This image illustrates an example of an 8-qubit quantum device topology. The qubits are labeled from 0 to 7, and the edges between them represent possible 2Q (two-qubit) gates. Each edge is annotated with a reliability score, indicating the probability of successfully executing a 2Q gate between the connected qubits. This topology is used to demonstrate how qubits are interconnected in a quantum computing system, highlighting the importance of understanding the physical layout for optimizing quantum circuit execution.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_dd2bb03945ef05923f9adc3e9ad454345120b43d763884abdac5d412558ec24b.png
image_title: 2Q操作可靠性矩阵示例
description: 该图片展示了一个8-qubit设备的2Q操作可靠性矩阵。矩阵中的每个元素表示两个特定qubit之间执行2Q操作的可靠性，包括直接连接和通过通信路由间接连接的情况。例如，从qubit 1到qubit 3的2Q操作可靠性为0.58。此矩阵用于指导TriQ工具在不同硬件拓扑上进行qubit映射和通信编排，以优化量子程序的执行可靠性。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000006_2131e026ed9985517b6486a199ba8c5c1fd067d77b49974a949c85ee6c3a3026.png
image_title: Benchmark Programs Summary
description: This table summarizes the benchmarks used in the study, detailing the number of qubits, total gates, and two-qubit gates for each benchmark. The benchmarks include algorithms such as Bernstein-Vazirani (BV), Hidden Shift Algorithm (HS), Quantum Fourier Transform (QFT), adder, and multi-qubit quantum gates like Toffoli and Fredkin. Additionally, it includes sequences involving repeated invocations of Fredkin and Toffoli gates, as well as supremacy circuits with up to 72 qubits and 2032 two-qubit gates for scalability studies.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000007_f4cfcc5c098bd88ebf68faf0a39d9a9a3380a22f289e83a9db54d2894003aa8f.png
image_title: 单量子比特门优化的重要性
description: 该图展示了在不同量子计算机平台上，使用 TriQ-N 和 TriQ-1QOpt 编译器时，原生单量子比特操作（实际应用到量子比特上的 X 和 Y 脉冲）的数量。TriQ-1QOpt 通过分解和优化复合门，将操作计数减少了高达 4.6 倍。图中显示了 IBMQ14、Rigetti Agave 和 UMDTI 三种平台的结果，其中 HS6、BV6 和 BV8 标记为 'X'，因为这些基准测试由于 Agave 和 UMDTI 的规模限制而无法运行。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000008_2f06fa36964d8e35525f827e20ede60b9d496908cb50ee319ef748e7323a040b.png
image_title: 单量子比特门优化的重要性（IBMQ14）
description: 该图展示了在 IBMQ14 量子计算机上，使用 TriQ-N 和 TriQ-1QOpt 两种编译器对不同基准测试的测量成功率。TriQ-1QOpt 通过合并操作并最大化利用无错误的 Z 轴旋转，提供了高达 1.26 倍的成功率提升。图中显示，对于某些基准测试（如 BV8、HS6 和 BV6），由于 UMDTI 的规模限制，标记为 'X'。此外，图中高度为零的条形对应于失败的运行，即正确答案未在输出分布中占主导地位。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000009_4516ed3db1ed93ebfb7e913a5626efcd133002fd23f1ee2cb7610fc0e2605ff6.png
image_title: UMDTI: Importance of Single Qubit Gate Optimization
description: This bar chart illustrates the measured success rates for various benchmarks (BL4, BL6, BL8, HS2, HS4, HS6, Toffoli, Fredkin, Or, Pers, QFT, Adder) on the UMDTI quantum computer. The chart compares the performance of TriQ-N and TriQ-1QOpt, showing how single qubit gate optimization improves success rates. Bars with zero height indicate failed runs where the correct answer did not dominate in the output distribution. Benchmarks marked with 'X' (e.g., BL6, BL8, HS6) are excluded due to size restrictions on UMDTI.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000010_1e1f885e8c0d784763447ff543656c9adfeacc396a07a1b9ebb0752cb3959981.png
image_title: 2Q Gate Counts and Success Rates for IBMQ14 and Rigetti Agave
description:
This image compares the performance of different optimization techniques (TriQ-1QOpt and TriQ-1QOptC) on two quantum computing platforms: IBMQ14 and Rigetti Agave. It includes three subplots:

(a) 2Q Gate Counts for IBMQ14: This bar chart shows the number of 2Q gates required for various benchmarks using TriQ-1QOpt and TriQ-1QOptC. The results highlight the reduction in 2Q gate counts achieved by TriQ-1QOptC.

(b) 2Q Gate Counts for Rigetti Agave: Similar to subplot (a), this chart displays the 2Q gate counts for Rigetti Agave, comparing TriQ-1QOpt and TriQ-1QOptC. It demonstrates the impact of communication optimization on reducing 2Q operations.

(c) Success Rates for IBMQ14: This bar chart illustrates the measured success rates for IBMQ14 across various benchmarks using TriQ-1QOpt and TriQ-1QOptC. The success rate improvements are attributed to the reductions in 2Q gate counts and better qubit placement strategies.

The image emphasizes the importance of communication optimization and its role in improving both gate counts and success rates on real quantum hardware.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000011_71f47f3584c9c2ec0739e70b148590bb9148ef60a1251a4f30a62eaf5981caf5.png
image_title: 不同编译器和量子系统上的2Q门计数与成功率对比
description: 该图片展示了在IBM Q14、Rigetti Agave和Rigetti Aspen1等量子系统上，使用Qiskit、TriQ-1QOptC、TriQ-1QOptCN以及Quil等不同编译器对多个基准测试（如BV4、HS5、Toffoli、Fredkin等）的2Q门计数和成功率的对比。此外，还特别分析了UMDTI系统上Toffoli和Fredkin序列的成功率随门数量增加的变化趋势。图中显示，TriQ-1QOptCN在大多数情况下表现出更高的成功率，并显著减少了2Q门的数量，尤其是在噪声适应性优化方面表现突出。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights_images/Full-Stack, Real-System Quantum Computer Studies-Architecture Comparisons and Design Insights-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000012_2032a17debd1ae6e9d98f183b08240a75ce78e467df5bf4d78dfe0e43ecb0eea.png
image_title: 不同量子系统在12个基准测试上的成功率对比
description: 该图展示了在七个不同的量子计算系统（包括IBM的IBMQ5、IBMQ14、IBMQ16，Rigetti的Agave、Aspen1、Aspen3，以及UMDTI）上运行12个基准测试的成功率。每个基准测试的结果以柱状图的形式呈现，不同颜色代表不同的系统。图表显示了各系统在不同基准测试中的表现差异，受到错误率、量子比特连接性和应用程序-机器拓扑匹配的影响。部分基准测试由于无法映射到某些机器而标记为'X'，表示失败的运行。此图旨在分析硬件设计选择对基准性能的影响，而非挑选最优技术或供应商。

image_title: Letter Header
description: The image shows the word 'LETTER' in bold, uppercase blue letters, indicating the beginning of a formal letter or communication. This is likely part of the header for a scientific correspondence or publication.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_8e727d82b5049fb32985ab1d85120a5597444bd1f4b924a726a9cdf10da343b2.png
image_title: 超导量子处理器的设备和实验协议
description: 该图片展示了超导量子处理器的光学显微镜图像（顶部）及其对应的示意图（底部）。处理器由五个固定频率的约瑟夫森结基转子量子比特组成，每个量子比特通过共面波导谐振器进行控制和读取。此外，还有两个共面波导谐振器提供量子比特之间的连接。图中还标注了使用的量子比特（Q0、Q1、Q2、Q3）和门操作（CR0-1、CR1-2、CR3-2），这些是实验中所用的关键组件。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_8102d17dba919b2177c1082d03557c7a1535de0186d40ab7abe8ee2fdcdb1a22.png
image_title: 量子处理器的设备和实验协议
description: 该图片展示了用于噪声抑制实验的超导量子处理器及其实验协议。图a是处理器的光学显微镜图像（顶部）和示意图（底部），显示了五个超导量子比特（Q0、Q1、Q2、Q3、Q4）以及它们之间的耦合门（CR0-1、CR1-2、CR3-2）。图b描绘了量子比特操作序列，包括单量子比特门和两量子比特门的脉冲模式，其中蓝色矩形表示控制脉冲，红色菱形表示测量点。图c展示了不同噪声放大因子下的期望值变化，说明了通过噪声放大技术如何逼近零噪声极限，以获得更精确的期望值估计。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_38b974c6891ab37f7c663b9ad289ef762a33f5a41410eecc160b4746fd2b13fd.png
image_title: Error Mitigation of Random Single-Qubit and Two-Qubit Circuits
description: The image illustrates the application of error mitigation techniques to random single-qubit and two-qubit circuits. It consists of three panels: (a) shows the expectation value of the ground-state projector for identity-equivalent single-qubit Clifford sequences with different stretch factors (c = 1, 2, 3, 4) and their corresponding Richardson extrapolations to first, second, and third order. (b) depicts trajectories on a Bloch sphere for stretch factors c = 1, 2, 3, along with the first-order Richardson extrapolation, representing the evolution of quantum states under noisy conditions. (c) demonstrates the decay of ZZ parity for random two-qubit Clifford sequences and its mitigation using first-order Richardson extrapolation to the zero-noise limit. The figure highlights how error mitigation improves the accuracy of quantum computations by reducing the effects of noise.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_8e727d82b5049fb32985ab1d85120a5597444bd1f4b924a726a9cdf10da343b2.png
image_title: Error-mitigated variational optimization of interacting spin Hamiltonians
description: This image illustrates the error-mitigated variational optimization process applied to an anti-ferromagnetic four-qubit Heisenberg model in a magnetic field. It demonstrates the energy minimization for a specific ratio (B/J = 1) using a depth d = 5 hardware-efficient trial circuit. The figure includes histograms of outcomes from 100 numerical experiments, showing the distribution of results obtained through bootstrapping of experimental datasets. The color density plots represent the frequencies of these outcomes, with the color bar quantifying the frequency scale. The inset depicts the structure of the trial circuit used, which involves interleaved sequences of arbitrary single-qubit rotations and entanglers that connect all qubits. Post-rotations are applied to sample the expectation values of Pauli operators in the target Hamiltonian. This optimization process highlights the improvements in accuracy achieved by mitigating errors, even on noisy quantum processors.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000006_4aba3f3571644091843b01485cffee3b64985b17a5e1aabff5031bdeeb960408.png
image_title: Error-Mitigated Variational Optimization of Interacting Spin Hamiltonians
description: This figure illustrates the error-mitigated variational optimization process applied to an anti-ferromagnetic four-qubit Heisenberg model in a magnetic field. It includes multiple subplots (a, b, c, d) that demonstrate the effects of circuit depth (d), stretch factors (c), and entanglers on the energy minimization and error mitigation. Subplot (a) shows the convergence of energy with trial steps for different circuit depths and stretch factors. Subplot (b) highlights the improvement in ε1 with increasing entanglers for various stretch factors. Subplot (c) demonstrates the reduction in ε2 as the number of entanglers increases, indicating improved convergence towards the ground-state wavefunction. Subplot (d) maps the energy for a range of J/B values, showing the effectiveness of error mitigation across different parameter settings. The results emphasize the benefits of error mitigation techniques in enhancing the accuracy of variational eigensolvers on noisy quantum processors.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000007_a65204825d94fe2dbc0b1a3eb54dcae3e3ead5204aab728780ba50d41292bc6f.png
image_title: Error-Mitigated Variational Optimization of Molecular Systems
description: This figure illustrates the error-mitigated variational optimization of molecular systems using a noisy quantum processor. The plot shows the energy (in Hartree units) as a function of interatomic distance (in Ångströms). Different curves represent results with varying stretch factors (c = 1, 1.25, 1.5, 2), demonstrating the impact of error mitigation on the accuracy of the calculations. The 'Exact' curve represents the theoretical ground state energy, while the 'Mitigated' data points show the improved agreement with theory after applying error mitigation techniques. The inset depicts a schematic of the qubit connectivity and the circuit depth used in the simulation.

image_title: Error-Mitigated Variational Optimization of Molecular Systems
description: The image depicts the energy minimization process for a molecular system using an error-mitigated variational optimization approach. It shows the energy (in Hartree) as a function of interatomic distance (in Ångströms). The plot includes multiple data points representing different stretch factors (c = 1, 1.1, 1.25, 1.5), with the exact solution and mitigated results plotted for comparison. The inset illustrates the quantum circuit used for the trial state preparation, involving qubits Q0 to Q4 and specific gates like CNOT and single-qubit rotations. The bottom part of the figure highlights the Li-H molecule being studied, emphasizing the application of the method to molecular systems.

image_title: Gate Characterization: Single-Qubit and Two-Qubit Errors
description: This image presents data on the error per gate (EPG) for single-qubit (1Q) and two-qubit (2Q) gates across a range of stretch factors, as determined by randomized benchmarking (RB). The error bars represent the standard deviation of the exponential fits to the RB decay curves for each stretch factor. This analysis helps quantify the impact of stretch factors on gate fidelity in noisy quantum processors.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000014_c673ecc6fe62c70adee95f3004370d196e992511419c199482d3b4c60991f326.png
image_title: Gate Characterization: Error per Gate (EPG) vs. Stretch Factor
description: This image presents the error per gate (EPG) for single-qubit (1Q) and two-qubit (2Q) gates as a function of the stretch factor 'c'. The left panel (a) shows the EPG for four qubits (Q0, Q1, Q2, Q3) under varying stretch factors, while the right panel (b) displays the EPG for three two-qubit gates (CR_{0-1}, CR_{1-2}, CR_{3-2}). Error bars represent the standard deviation of exponential fits to randomized benchmarking decay curves. This analysis helps characterize the performance of quantum gates under different operational conditions.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000015_3d54c7b1aee20b288c673832b957e43586edc75a8d34aaf2b4b5a2bed480f46e.png
image_title: Error Mitigation in Quantum Computing: Nonlinear Cross-Resonance Drive
description: This image illustrates the time evolution of the expectation value ⟨IZ⟩ under a simplistic cross-resonance (CR) drive with a nonlinear interaction term. The CR drive is characterized by a Hamiltonian with terms JZX = -0.0159JΩ + 1.0541 × 10^-6JΩ^3, where JΩ represents the drive amplitude. The system also includes fixed amplitude damping and dephasing channels. The plot shows how the expectation value changes over time for different calibrated drive amplitudes corresponding to π/2 gate times Tgate values. This analysis demonstrates the impact of error mitigation techniques on quantum gate operations in the presence of noise.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000016_5f0b26890ceb0892881c72988acf11399f2e333a93e5e0f9112ead8649baab9b.png
image_title: Coherence and Relaxation Time Fluctuations in Superconducting Qubits
description: This image presents data on the fluctuations of coherence and relaxation times (T1 and T2) in superconducting qubits. Panel (a) shows repeated measurements of T1 and echo T2 over time, indicating significant fluctuations larger than the error bars from exponential fits. Panels (b) and (c) depict the decay curves for T1 and echo T2, respectively, with different stretch factors (c=1 and c=2), illustrating how these parameters affect the decay dynamics. The error bars represent the standard deviation of the exponential fits to each instance of the decay curves.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000017_1c4007a0c35abc1b009d92ef6d0f0dc690b65d558c5e61f4fd430f3a0bc1d7d4.png
image_title: Nonlinear Cross-Resonance Drive Characterization
description: This image illustrates the amplitude dependence of interaction terms in a cross-resonance (CR) drive, specifically CR3-2. The plot shows how the interaction strengths vary with the drive amplitude, highlighting nonlinearities in the strong drive limit. The dominant interactions are ZX and IX, as indicated by the data points and error bars representing the standard deviation of the interaction strengths estimated from Hamiltonian tomography fits. The y-axis is labeled in arbitrary units (a.u.).

image_title: 非线性交叉共振驱动的哈密顿量层析
description: 该图展示了在不同交叉共振（CR）驱动幅度下，交互项的振幅依赖性。主要的交互项是ZX和IX，且在强驱动极限下表现出明显的非线性。误差棒表示从哈密顿量层析拟合中估计的交互强度的标准偏差。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000019_e8cfb142924e111dd0d06679492648cb1b382d06420fbfe38813d5ac32bc8ed3.png
image_title: Cross-Resonance Drive Interaction Strengths
description: This graph illustrates the amplitude dependence of interaction strengths for various terms in a cross-resonance (CR) drive, including IX, IY, IZ, ZX, ZY, and ZZ. The x-axis represents the amplitude Ω in arbitrary units (a.u.), while the y-axis shows the interaction strength in MHz. Error bars indicate the standard deviation of the interaction strengths estimated from Hamiltonian tomography fits. Notably, the ZX interaction dominates at higher amplitudes, showing nonlinear behavior in the strong drive limit, while other interactions remain relatively small or negligible.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000020_3d54c7b1aee20b288c673832b957e43586edc75a8d34aaf2b4b5a2bed480f46e.png
image_title: Error Mitigation with Nonlinear CR Drive: Time Evolution of ⟨IZ⟩
description: This image illustrates the time evolution of the expectation value ⟨IZ⟩ under a nonlinear cross-resonance (CR) drive. The CR drive is characterized by a specific Hamiltonian term JZX = -0.0159JΩ + 1.0541 × 10^-6 JΩ^3, along with fixed amplitude damping and dephasing channels. The plot shows how the system evolves over time for different drive amplitudes calibrated to ZX π/2 gate times Tgate values, providing insights into error mitigation strategies in quantum processors.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature_images/Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor - nature-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000021_6c43279ba2d6ce426c9ed2e2816a3a080025b8a9bdcaf4fa8a1411319fa38e53.png
image_title: Time Evolution of ⟨IZ⟩ under Nonlinear Cross-Resonance Drive
description: This image shows the time evolution of the expectation value ⟨IZ⟩ under a nonlinear cross-resonance (CR) drive for different gate times (T_gate). The plot is divided into three panels (a, b, c), each corresponding to different values of T_gate: 2/J, 3/J, and 6/J, respectively. The curves represent the dynamics of ⟨IZ⟩ as a function of time T, with various methods applied to mitigate errors: 'c=1', 'c=2', and '1st order Richardson'. The oscillatory behavior indicates the interaction between qubits, with the amplitude and frequency of oscillations varying depending on the gate time and error mitigation method used.

image_title: 单光子量子比特的编码与操作
description: 该图展示了如何使用单光子的偏振态来编码量子比特，并通过线性光学元件实现基本的量子逻辑门操作。图A显示了水平和垂直偏振光子的表示；图B展示了Poincaré球（或Bloch球）上的单量子比特状态表示；图C描述了Hadamard门和任意旋转门的操作，利用双折射波片实现；图D展示了通过偏振分束器（PBS）将偏振编码转换为路径编码的过程，其中|0⟩和|1⟩分别代表上行和下行路径中的光子。

image_title: Optical Controlled-NOT Gate
description: This image illustrates the concept of an optical controlled-NOT (CNOT) gate, a fundamental logic gate in quantum computing. Part A shows a schematic of how a CNOT gate can be realized using beamsplitters (BS) and a non-linear phase shift. The control qubit determines whether a phase shift is applied to the target qubit. Part B depicts the equivalent quantum circuit representation, where Hadamard (H) gates are used alongside a phase shift (π) to implement the CNOT operation. This diagram highlights the challenges in realizing entangling logic gates in optical quantum computing due to the requirement for strong optical non-linearity.

image_title: Optical CNOT Gate via Teleportation
description: This image illustrates the implementation of an optical controlled-NOT (CNOT) gate using teleportation techniques. It is divided into three parts: (A) shows a cartoon of a measurement-assisted nondeterministic CNOT gate, where control and target qubits (encoded in polarization) interact with auxiliary photons through a network of beam splitters (BS). (B) depicts the quantum interference of two photons at a beam splitter, highlighting the probabilistic nature of the gate operation. (C) explains the linear optical network used for single-photon detection, which is essential for implementing the CNOT gate via teleportation. The diagram emphasizes the use of Bell measurements and entangled states to achieve the desired logic operation, showcasing the complexity and probabilistic nature of optical quantum computing.

image_title: Cluster State Quantum Computing
description: This image illustrates the concept of cluster state quantum computing. It shows a grid of qubits where blue qubits represent those in a cluster state, with bonds between them indicating entanglement. Green qubits are being added to the cluster, while grey qubits have been measured and are no longer entangled. The process involves measuring qubits from left to right, with the measurement outcomes determining the basis for subsequent measurements. This approach is particularly practical for photons, as measurements can begin while the cluster is still being grown.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information_images/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_004fd953c82f217265d70ddeea91224cb4046eb3f091e207dc62fb07e92fa67c.png
image_title: 量子系统模拟的误差缓解示意图
description: 该图片展示了在近期内部量子计算机上进行长时间误差缓解的开放量子系统模拟。图中可能包含电路图或算法流程，用于说明如何在存在硬件错误的情况下，通过深电路（包含多达两千个纠缠门）实现对开放量子系统的稳健模拟。具体地，图片可能涉及两个电子系统与无限热浴耦合的模拟，包括自由电子在驱动电场中的耗散行为以及两个相互作用电子在单轨道磁性场中的热化过程（Hubbard原子）。这些模拟结果表明，即使在长时间内，使用IBM量子计算机进行的模拟也没有显示出保真度下降的迹象，证明了开放量子系统模拟算法在嘈杂硬件上的优越性能。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information_images/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_264d3ae91cedc090e4d285f259cce50c0fe30d4490eb871d8cdb2cf68f414691.png
image_title: 量子系统模拟的长时误差缓解
description: 图片展示了在近期内量子计算机上进行开放量子系统模拟的实验结果，特别关注于长时间尺度下的误差缓解技术。图中可能包含模拟数据、电路深度或保真度随时间变化的曲线，以及与经典计算方法对比的结果，以证明量子算法在处理开放量子系统问题上的优越性。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information_images/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_7ad32406c6af337caad9756edc23209d68a5505d80e1146d0f8b399df0850e39.png
image_title: 电子密度随时间的演化
description: 该图展示了在量子计算机上模拟开放量子系统时，电子密度随时间演化的结果。图中包含多个子图：(a) 显示了使用 ibmq_mumbai 进行 1000 步时间演化，每步 Trotter 步骤中使用一个重置门的结果。不同阴影的蓝色代表不同的量子比特集，而黑色实线表示理想电路的结果。(b) 展示了在 ibmq_boeblingen 上进行 400 步时间演化，每步 Trotter 步骤中使用一到四个重置门的结果。(c) 是经过后处理的数据，包括外推至零重置时间极限并校正后的结果，与理想结果高度一致。整体上，该图表明驱动耗散电路在近期内量子计算机上的稳定性，并展示了测量误差校正后的数据精度。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information_images/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_1fd95f8a709194afa2f9c4230e7da8b77f4019c3a56483e66804c9ed550da1a1.png
image_title: DC Current vs. Driving Field Strength
description: This figure compares the DC current response to an external driving field strength (Ω) for three different methods: the Lindblad master equation (black circles), the ideal circuit (red squares), and measured data from a quantum computer (blue triangles). The inset shows the transient evolution of the current over time (t/τ), highlighting the convergence to steady-state values. The main plot demonstrates how the DC current varies with increasing driving field strength, showing good agreement between the theoretical predictions and experimental results across different regimes.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information_images/Long-time error-mitigating simulation of open quantum systems on near term quantum computers - npj quantum information-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_c83310654cdbb15c4e930da529b18e0c0eb08f675964a63c434c946531dcef44.png
image_title: Thermalized Hubbard Model Simulation Results
description: This image presents the results of simulating a thermalized Hubbard model on near-term quantum computers. It includes multiple panels showing comparisons between ideal circuit predictions and quantum computer (QC) data over time steps. Panels (c)-(f) display plots of thermal populations for different states, comparing ideal circuits with QC data. Panels (g)-(i) show 3D density matrices at various time steps, illustrating the overlap between ideal and QC data. The simulation demonstrates the robustness of the algorithm to noise, as errors in early time steps are largely corrected in subsequent steps, achieving steady-state accuracy.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_027b8e1463ed2fedea808af260a91ea1a4d33eb1ff7d68b3bd6bf891a8dd31ab.png
image_title: Trapped Ion System with Applied Currents and Trap Geometry
description: The image illustrates a trapped ion system used for quantum control. Part (A) shows the spectrum of applied currents, including a strong current at approximately 5 MHz to create a magnetic field gradient near the ions' motional frequency (~6.9 MHz), and two weaker currents symmetrically detuned from the qubit frequency (~1326 GHz) to generate entangling interactions. The frequencies are marked with dashed arrows indicating the motional mode and qubit frequencies. Part (B) provides a 3D perspective view of the central region of a surface electrode ion trap, showing two 25Mg+ ions trapped approximately 30 µm above the trap surface. The trap includes qubit control electrodes (green, numbered 1-3) driven by MHz and GHz currents to create magnetic fields and gradients, while oscillating and static voltages on trapping electrodes (purple and gray) confine the ions. The inset highlights how static electric fields can rotate the ion crystal slightly relative to the qubit control electrodes, enabling differential ac Zeeman shifts.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_7b9398b5ea8f6e6dbea9d8d6061d7987d32463ad2b2b83e5086b16b284c6951e.png
image_title: 单离子量子比特相干性与固有动态解耦（IDD）
description: 该图展示了在有无固有动态解耦（IDD）的情况下，单离子量子比特的自旋回波对比度随自旋回波持续时间的变化。图中，紫色圆点表示应用了调谐至IDD点的微波场时的自旋回波对比度，而橙色菱形则表示未应用微波场的情况。随着自旋回波持续时间的增加，两种情况下的对比度均有所下降，但应用IDD时的对比度保持得更好，表明IDD有助于延长量子比特的相干时间。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_11d04f58ac509b546af859bc59199f360d9229eede05130b782a30c0200da6a2.png
image_title: Bell State Infidelity vs. Qubit Frequency Offset
description: This figure shows the relationship between Bell state infidelity and qubit frequency offset. The x-axis represents the qubit frequency offset in kHz, while the y-axis represents the Bell state infidelity on a logarithmic scale. Data points are plotted with error bars, indicating that for offsets up to ±200 kHz, the Bell state infidelity remains below 10^-2, demonstrating the robustness of the entangling operation to such frequency offsets or differences between qubit frequencies.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_0b7938b2c498ce2ddf078db027ea69b1e2cd84699f9f9fa3535cc17813c98a8c.png
image_title: Bell State Parity and Fidelity Comparison
description: This figure presents two panels comparing the parity of Bell states and their fidelities. Panel A shows the parity oscillations for symmetric and antisymmetric Bell states as a function of the parity phase (2π). The symmetric Bell state exhibits sinusoidal parity oscillations, while the antisymmetric Bell state maintains a constant parity close to -1. Panel B compares the corrected Bell state fidelities achieved using different techniques, including laser-based methods and laser-free techniques with MHz and GHz gradients. The data points represent various experimental results from the literature and this work, highlighting the fidelity and operation durations for creating high-fidelity Bell states in trapped ion qubits.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_7f7ab603c143f03c04dd86ffd608017d742e5079aa19c9a1c5ecf0eec2d78900.png
image_title: 量子控制驱动电子电路示意图
description: 该图片展示了用于量子比特控制的驱动电子电路的两个部分。图A描述了微波信号生成链路，包括DDS（直接数字合成器）、低通滤波器（LPF）、频率倍增器（FD）和IQ调制器，最终输出功率约为100 mW，并通过混合耦合器传输。图B展示了射频控制信号生成电路，包括DAC、低通滤波器（LPF）、带通滤波器（BPF）和放大器，输出功率约为2 W。这些信号通过双工器与微波信号结合后，传递到量子比特陷阱电极，用于控制离子的位置和状态。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_e3da1ac2b2f6cf0534861f09de25c2f6d2d2d6cd6742a990062faa3e1d8a7b65.png
image_title: Entanglement Pulse Sequence for Two Trapped Ions
description: The image illustrates the pulse sequences used to generate entangled states in a trapped ion quantum system. Part A shows the sequence for the entangling interaction, where the gradient field oscillating at frequency ωg (green) and two microwave fields symmetrically detuned by δ from the ac Zeeman shifted qubit frequency ˜ω0 (red and blue) are ramped up and down eight times over a total duration of 740 µs. Additional π/2 and π pulses (gray) are applied at ω0 to correct for qubit frequency offsets and drifts, ensuring robustness against miscalibrations. Part B depicts the pulse sequence for single ion addressing, using a spin-echo Ramsey sequence with the gradient oscillating at ωg in only the first arm, lasting 70 µs. The phases of the global qubit rotation pulses must be calibrated relative to the entangling interaction to create the desired state |Ψ−⟩.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000006_6f5dbb94659e1c8b4b0c73a9e1808b30a73a7635353ce1fb590da02e62d10c45.png
image_title: Bootstrap Analysis of Symmetric and Antisymmetric Entangled State Fidelities
description: The image presents two histograms (A and B) showing the results of a bootstrap analysis for symmetric and antisymmetric entangled state fidelities, respectively. Each histogram displays the distribution of bootstrapped fidelities, with key statistics provided in the legend: original data fidelity, median, mean, and the 68% confidence interval. The x-axis represents the fidelity values, while the y-axis shows the number of bootstraps. For the symmetric state (A), the original data fidelity is 1.0017, with a median of 1.0006 and a mean of 1.0004. The 68% confidence interval is [0.9983, 1.0025]. For the antisymmetric state (B), the original data fidelity is 0.9977, with a median and mean both at 0.9976, and the 68% confidence interval is [0.9964, 0.9987]. The histograms illustrate the statistical uncertainty and distribution of fidelities after correction for initialization errors.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000007_f94b44ed6bff5639b1e2634b7b67875757d39235d77384b60ee8f9f204e62281.png
image_title: Symmetric State Fidelity Analysis with Trigger Selection
description: This figure illustrates the analysis of symmetric state fidelities using a 'trigger' method to select datasets. The x-axis represents the symmetric state trigger fidelity, while the y-axis shows the symmetric state analysis fidelity. Each data point corresponds to a dataset, and the error bars indicate the 68% confidence interval determined by nonparametric bootstrapping. A dashed line with a slope of 1 is included for reference. The red square denotes the dataset with the highest trigger value, which is reported in the main text. This process avoids selection bias by using independent trigger data to select the best dataset for analysis.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000008_3e68585d8754557e419702628969d680f150b4ea82ff1f8dce1f30a0ac6c070a.png
image_title: Antisymmetric State Fidelity Analysis
description: This figure presents a scatter plot comparing the 'trigger' fidelity and 'analysis' fidelity for antisymmetric entangled states. Each data point represents a dataset, with error bars indicating the 68% confidence interval determined by nonparametric bootstrapping. The red square denotes the dataset with the highest trigger value, which is reported in the main text. A dashed line with a slope of 1 is included for reference, illustrating the ideal scenario where the analysis fidelity matches the trigger fidelity. This analysis helps avoid selection bias in determining which datasets to report as having the best underlying Bell state fidelity.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits_images/High-fidelity laser-free universal control of two trapped ions qubits-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000009_3b18891a3f218564b58ac2cd6e4869a7082d2c6322b53ca799da52df23b6042c.png
image_title: Symmetric State Fidelity Bias
description: This plot shows the bias in estimated fidelity for symmetric entangled states as a function of simulated fidelity. The x-axis represents the simulated symmetric state fidelity, ranging from approximately 0.99 to 1.00. The y-axis represents the bias in estimated fidelity, which is negative, indicating that the estimated fidelity is consistently lower than the simulated fidelity. The data points are plotted with error bars, showing the variability in the bias estimates. As the simulated fidelity approaches 1, the magnitude of the negative bias increases, suggesting that the estimation method underestimates the fidelity more significantly for higher fidelities.
