url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz_images/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_35f4531a1eaa472915602b0a2653295e9b02544c0ec0f95fb6c7efb61c580259.png
image_title: 量子电路用于测量能量梯度的虚部
description: 该图片展示了一个量子电路，用于测量计算能量梯度所需的虚部。电路包括一个初始态 |Φ₀⟩，通过一系列参数化单位矩阵 exp(it_j P^j_k) 和 Pauli 矩阵操作进行演化，最终通过 Hadamard (H) 门和 Rx(π/2) 门将结果映射到 Y 基础上进行测量。此电路设计用于评估 ∂E/∂t_j 的部分导数，其中 E 是能量期望值，t_j 是参数向量中的一个元素。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz_images/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_6c7e9adb3a34b7f0fcafb9814e881feec7803446d39d944a2ae1482c7d1e78f4.png
image_title: H4模型系统几何结构描述
description: 该图片展示了用于研究的H4模型系统的三种不同几何结构：矩形（R）、梯形（T）和线性（L）。每种几何结构通过特定变量定义其形状和尺寸。矩形结构由参数r表示，梯形结构由角度θ表示，而线性结构同样由参数r表示。所有结构中的距离d保持固定为2.0 Å。这些几何结构被用来扫描势能面（PES），以评估波函数的纠缠程度及其对算法性能的影响。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz_images/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_a6b3af20549bc6701e6b759ea31b5f2b5b5bf91222e746add26894d9b4f2b3af.png
image_title: 不同初始化方法和优化算法在H4系统中的性能比较
description: 该图展示了在H4系统中，使用四种优化算法（L-BFGS-B、COBYLA、Powell和Nelder-Mead）以及三种不同的参数初始化方法（随机初始化、设为零和MP2振幅初始化）时的平均性能。图分为三个子图，分别对应于沿a) 梯形路径、b) 线性路径和c) 平行路径的计算结果。左侧面板显示了收敛所需的函数评估次数，右侧面板显示了最终能量与FCI解之间的误差。误差棒表示一个标准偏差，且能量图的范围被截断至35 kcal/mol以方便比较。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz_images/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_647bf1e74bde3e03db1c15e3a8e1fdc7e94eaf7004ddb5c962f61b4e568273ae.png
image_title: Wavefunction Error Comparison Along the Linear Path
description: This figure compares the error in the wavefunctions obtained using different optimization methods (COBYLA and L-BFGS-B) along the linear path of the H4 system. The UCCSD wavefunctions are computed using the exact UCC unitary (Eq. (20), red dots) and the trotterized version (Eq. (25)) with one trotter step (blue triangles up) and two trotter steps (green triangles down). The error in the wavefunction is quantified as 1 - |〈Ψ_UCCSD | Ψ_FCI〉|, where Ψ_UCCSD represents the UCCSD wavefunction and Ψ_FCI represents the full configuration interaction (FCI) wavefunction. The x-axis represents the interatomic distance r (in Å), while the y-axis shows the logarithmic scale of the wavefunction error. The plot highlights how the choice of optimization method and the number of trotter steps affect the accuracy of the wavefunction compared to the FCI solution.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz_images/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000006_7e290b05dff212e1833516117f103cf6441cc6aa1ab070dca314a7e0c5b3bef3.png
image_title: 不同阈值下参数数量的对数与系统大小的关系
description: 该图展示了在使用不同阈值（d）筛选双激发算符时，UCCSD方法中参数数量的对数与系统大小（ηN，即基组函数数与电子数的乘积）的对数之间的关系。图分为两部分：a) 使用STO-6G基组，b) 使用3-21G基组。每条曲线代表一个特定的阈值（从10^-2到10^-5），以及所有参数（标记为“All”）。图中的斜率和相关系数显示了参数数量随系统大小变化的趋势，表明通过预筛选可以显著减少参数数量，从而降低VQE电路的深度。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz_images/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000007_85396c8436c45fa731dd9b3749245f16ef7a55d8feff6e6e727b5c0737c4b067.png
image_title: 不同步长下数值梯度与解析梯度的平均误差
description: 该图展示了在估计梯度时，平均测量次数对数值梯度和解析梯度误差的影响。图中比较了不同步长（δ）下的数值梯度（包括 δ = 0.5、0.1、0.01 和 0.001）与解析梯度的平均误差（Δg）。横轴表示每次梯度评估的平均测量次数，纵轴表示平均梯度误差的对数尺度。结果显示，随着测量次数的增加，所有方法的误差均逐渐减小，但数值梯度在高测量次数下达到其精度极限，不再显著改善。解析梯度在整个范围内表现出较低且稳定的误差，表明其在实验实现中可能比数值梯度更高效。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz_images/Strategies for quantum computing molecular energies using the unitary coupled cluster ansatz-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000008_972dad75a9339e6bc4f53ae2834d2eed7735cbb5369f08978058159af2d95394.png
image_title: 控制误差对梯度估计的影响
description: 该图展示了在量子电路中，控制误差（∆Θ）对数值梯度和解析梯度的平均梯度误差（∆g）的影响。图中，横轴表示控制误差 ∆Θ，纵轴表示平均梯度误差 ∆g。红色虚线和蓝色实线分别代表数值梯度（δ = 0.01）和解析梯度的误差变化趋势。两条线均显示了 ∆g 随 ∆Θ 增加而呈线性增长的趋势，其中数值梯度的斜率为 m = 0.99 ± 0.01，截距为 b = -0.12；解析梯度的斜率为 m = 1.00 ± 0.01，截距为 b = -0.23。这表明，在实验实现中，控制误差对数值梯度和解析梯度的误差都有显著影响，且解析梯度可能在实际应用中具有更低的采样成本和更好的鲁棒性。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network_images/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_f8c3f8d5983c62cdc1ae9e8418f83bb741d659e4b44e56988f268f6275cde182.png
image_title: Perceptron Mechanism in Neural Computing
description: This image illustrates the perceptron mechanism in neural computing, divided into three sections: (a) a biological perceptron showing how pre-synaptic neurons transmit signals through synapses to post-synaptic dendrites, which are summed up in the cell body and propagated along the axon; (b) an artificial perceptron based on binary neurons, where input neurons (x1, x2, x3) with synaptic weights (w1y, w2y, w3y) determine the output signal y; and (c) a Hopfield Neural Network, represented by an energy landscape with network firing states converging to stable attractors. The figure highlights the transformation of biological principles into computational models for associative memory and pattern classification.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network_images/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_474a6f279a53e859476c5e0c7e83284329d4276ec7bc020d8f262517f18dd374.png
image_title: Dissipative Quantum Computing
description: This image illustrates the concept of dissipative quantum computing, contrasting it with coherent quantum computing. It shows a system interacting with an environment, where qubits are prepared, evolve through quantum gates, and are measured. The diagram highlights that in dissipative quantum computing, the system is not only manipulated by unitary quantum gates but also interacts with its environment, leading to nonunitary evolution. This interaction introduces effects such as decoherence and dissipation, which are leveraged in dissipative quantum computing to engineer desired quantum state transformations.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network_images/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_b755fdd816a7fc7881032613e1519ed809d193d3a27f57e122bcd5c67c68a719.png
image_title: Quron: A Quantum Representation of Neural States
description: The image illustrates the concept of a 'quron,' which is a quantum representation of a neuron's state. It shows how a quron can exist in a superposition of two states: 'rest' (|0⟩) and 'active' (|1⟩), with the condition that the sum of their squared amplitudes equals one, ensuring probability conservation. This representation allows a neural network to be in a superposition of firing patterns, a key feature exploited in quantum neural network models.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network_images/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_9923a7c4543d06f8e1130425344cab79cdbdfc51c8d48344eb38338ac09a41f5.png
image_title: 量子神经网络相关文献的发表与引用趋势
description: 该图片展示了自1994年以来，包含关键词“Quantum Neural Network”的学术文章的发表数量（左侧图表）和这些文章的引用次数（右侧图表）。左侧图表显示了每年发表的文章数量随时间的变化，而右侧图表则反映了这些文章的累积引用情况。整体趋势表明，尽管每年发表的文章数量相对稳定，但对量子神经网络的兴趣在逐年增长，表现为引用次数的显著增加。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network_images/The quest for a Quantum Neural Network-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_3751f2b15474297a6928ec215518e85404fa0307062f83cf67bc5cdc06aab1ec.png
image_title: 不同开发量子神经网络的方法
description: 该图片展示了四种不同的方法来开发量子神经网络。图a表示通过量子测量解释非线性阶跃函数，用薛定谔的猫象征量子测量过程。图b展示了许多贡献者尝试构建带有受神经计算启发的门或特性的量子电路。图c探讨了将感知器的核心机制翻译成对应的量子版本而不丢失神经网络丰富动态性的挑战。图d介绍了一种有趣的分支，理解由四个共享两个电子的原子组成的相互作用量子点作为量子神经网络。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms_images/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_57f6df7a57f6292af6ee6d483177efe4c566491836e8344515c5adeac31b92f6.png
image_title: 线性路径与最优路径的比较
description: 该图展示了标准线性路径（标记为 'Linear'，红色虚线）与变分最优路径（标记为 'Optimal'，黑色实线）的对比。最优路径在接近避免交叉点时自然减缓了演化速度，但在其他地方仅略微偏离标准线性路径。这表明最优路径通过调整演化速率，在不依赖先验谱信息的情况下，能够更有效地准备目标态。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms_images/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_46558e3c0e0950c835d9fcb601cdc66ae1d3cd556bb5371c7ab5b4deba56604e.png
image_title: 量子态与目标态重叠的比较
description: 该图展示了不同演化时间（τ）下，标准线性路径（Lin）和变分最优样条路径（Opt）在参数值 s 的变化过程中，系统态 |Ψ(s)⟩ 与目标态 |Ψ_f⟩ 的平方重叠。图中显示了多种情况：标准线性路径分别对应不同的总演化时间 τ（10、100、250、500），而变分最优样条路径对应较短的总演化时间 τ=50。结果显示，变分最优样条路径能够在显著缩短演化时间的情况下，达到与标准线性路径相似的性能，表明其在减少量子演化时间方面具有优势。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms_images/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_fa240b519073bf3ac24663580b46ee22fe9b7c1ad5d127ac524172d15f8a5d3a.png
image_title: 变分可抑制误差示意图
description: 该图展示了一个卡通示意图，用于解释变分可抑制误差的概念。图中使用了能量轮廓线来表示状态空间，虚线代表将状态移离变分最小值的误差，而实线则表示可以通过调整参数向量返回到最小值的路径。垂直轴位于参数流形内，而水平轴则不在，这通过水平轴上的交叉标记来指示。通过添加额外的算符（用对角虚线表示），可以实现这些误差的变分抑制。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms_images/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_f956ae97bdd74a39e4f210fc32b743210d8c58ec92a5a932a5cc6ecd9a2d21ad.png
image_title: 不同优化方法的最终能量精度对比
description: 该图展示了在不同测量精度下，四种优化方法（MULTIMIN、GLCLUSTER、LGO 和 NELDER-MEAD）对优化波函数最终能量的准确性与已知精确解的偏差。横轴表示测量精度的对数（Log10(1/ε)），纵轴表示最终能量与精确解偏差的对数（Log10(E - E_exact)）。图中每个点代表20次重复实验的平均值，误差棒表示1个标准差。结果显示，TOMLAB系列方法（MULTIMIN、GLCLUSTER、LGO）在所有测量精度水平上均表现出显著优于NELDER-MEAD方法的性能，特别是在高精度要求下，其收敛到更高准确度的能量，并且所需的函数评估次数远少于NELDER-MEAD方法。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms_images/The theory of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_38da856a63525a1d14ee86d27b0770b501398574b9e56e9f1df449fdd761e7ed.png
image_title: 不同优化方法的函数评估次数对比
description: 该图展示了在不同精度要求下，四种优化方法（MULTIMIN、GLCLUSTER、LGO 和 NELDER-MEAD）所需的函数评估次数对数（Log10(Function Evals）与精度倒数对数（Log10(1/ε)）的关系。图中显示，TOMLAB 系列方法（如 MULTIMIN、GLCLUSTER 和 LGO）相较于传统的 Nelder-Mead 方法，在达到相同精度时显著减少了函数评估次数，有时甚至减少了三个数量级。这表明 TOMLAB 方法在优化效率上具有明显优势，尤其是在高精度需求下。

image_title: 量子-经典混合量子蒙特卡罗算法的示意图
description: 该图展示了量子-经典混合量子蒙特卡罗（QC-QMC）算法的工作原理，分为三个部分：(a) 虚拟时间演化过程，显示了波函数随虚拟时间τ的指数收敛到基态；(b) 费米子符号问题的说明，包括无约束和受约束的QMC计算，以及使用量子和经典约束来控制符号问题的方法；(c) QC-QMC算法的概述，描述了如何在经典计算机上进行虚时演化，并通过查询量子处理器来估计波函数重叠，从而更新权重和门参数。

image_title: H4分子的量子态准备与能量测量
description: 该图展示了在8-qubit实验中，用于H4分子的量子态准备和阴影层析（shadow tomography）的电路布局。图(a)显示了GHZ态准备、完美配对态（perfect pairing state）、离线单粒子旋转以及阴影层析的电路结构。图(b)和(c)分别展示了不同测量次数下，量子试验波函数（Q. trial）和QC-AFQMC方法计算得到的原子化能随测量次数的变化趋势，以及与理想结果和化学精度的对比。

description: 该图展示了在不同量子和经典计算方法下，N2 分子和金刚石结构的能量误差分析。图 (a) 上半部分显示了12-qubit N2 的电路布局，下半部分是N2 在三重ζ基组（cc-pVTZ）下的势能面，其中相对能量在特定键长处归零。插图显示了总能量相对于精确结果的误差，虚线表示化学精度（1 kcal/mol）。图 (b) 上半部分展示了16-qubit 金刚石的电路布局，下半部分是金刚石在双ζ基组（DZVP-GTH）下的总能量误差随晶格常数变化的曲线。虚线同样表示化学精度。结果显示，QC-AFQMC 方法在处理较大系统时表现出色，尽管未完全达到化学精度，但显著优于传统AFQMC 和 CCSD(T) 方法。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Understanding quantum machine learning also requires rethinking generalization_images/Understanding quantum machine learning also requires rethinking generalization-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_30066dab7cbf13b22be58a83daa0a9e5980a3356168c65d90c2c8ddea7fd0234.png
image_title: Quantum Machine Learning Generalization Framework
description: This image illustrates the framework for understanding generalization in quantum machine learning (QML). It is divided into two parts: (a) Empirical experiments and (b) Uniform generalization bounds. In part (a), labeled quantum data undergoes a randomization process, leading to both original and corrupted data distributions. These distributions are used to train parameterized quantum circuits (PQCs), resulting in hypotheses for both original and corrupted data. The empirical results show that while the original hypothesis achieves small training and test errors, indicating good generalization, the corrupted hypothesis exhibits large test errors, highlighting poor generalization. Part (b) discusses uniform generalization bounds in QML literature, which assign identical upper bounds to all functions within a family without considering individual characteristics. This leads to loose bounds when applied to current-scale QML models, as demonstrated by the empirical findings.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Understanding quantum machine learning also requires rethinking generalization_images/Understanding quantum machine learning also requires rethinking generalization-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_a8068aac9453dcaf76e9896917381dcc25ec80f94aff6a30e1d39fe7d3c5e8ee.png
image_title: 广义簇哈密顿量的相图
description: 该图片展示了广义簇哈密顿量的地面态相图，其中包含四个不同的相：(I) 对称保护拓扑相、(II) 铁磁相、(III) 反铁磁相和 (IV) 平凡相。相图以耦合强度 $j_1$ 和 $j_2$ 为坐标轴，不同区域通过颜色和图案区分，表示不同量子相的存在。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Understanding quantum machine learning also requires rethinking generalization_images/Understanding quantum machine learning also requires rethinking generalization-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_0e22d8e5f3844c1d51850c37cfd4baee4028c1e01afcf7211af59c6bd1f35347.png
image_title: 量子卷积神经网络（QCNN）在标签腐败情况下的测试误差与训练时间分析
description: 该图展示了量子卷积神经网络（QCNN）在不同训练集大小（N = 4, 6, 8）和标签腐败程度（r）下的测试误差变化。主图显示了测试误差随标签腐败比例 r 的增加而逐渐上升，最终接近随机猜测的水平（约0.75）。当 r 接近1时，测试误差达到最高值，表明完全随机化的标签导致模型性能退化至随机猜测水平。图中还包含一个插图，专注于 N = 6 的情况，详细展示了训练误差随训练时间的变化以及不同腐败比例（r = 0, 1/3, 2/3, 1）下的收敛速度。插图中的阴影区域表示五次独立实验重复的方差，揭示了在完全随机化数据（r = 1）的情况下，QCNN 的训练收敛速度反而更快，这表明模型能够有效记忆随机数据。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Understanding quantum machine learning also requires rethinking generalization_images/Understanding quantum machine learning also requires rethinking generalization-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_7ba3d5d28c13793ef29e755f3c8b5935e203eaf7e23864fa55b5b1c27e223fa0.png
image_title: 随机标签、随机状态与真实数据的泛化差距
description: 该图展示了量子卷积神经网络（QCNN）在不同训练集大小下，针对随机标签、随机状态和真实数据的泛化差距。横轴表示训练集大小 N，纵轴表示泛化差距 gen(f)。图中显示了三种情况：蓝色曲线代表随机标签，橙色曲线代表随机状态，绿色曲线代表真实数据。随着训练集大小的增加，所有情况下的泛化差距均有所下降，但随机标签和随机状态的泛化差距在较大训练集时仍显著高于真实数据。阴影区域表示不同实验重复中的标准差，表明结果的稳定性。此外，随机标签和随机状态的泛化差距表现出相似的趋势，但在高度上略有差异，这可能归因于四类数据相对频率的不同。

image_title: KF-QSE 和 OPG-ADMM 算法的归一化距离对比
description: 该图展示了 KF-QSE 和 OPG-ADMM 两种在线量子态重构算法在不同采样次数下的归一化距离（D(ρ*, ρ)）变化。横轴表示采样次数，纵轴表示归一化距离。图中显示，随着采样次数的增加，两种算法的归一化距离均逐渐减小，但 KF-QSE 的收敛速度明显快于 OPG-ADMM。然而，由于 KF-QSE 存在误差项 Err_T，其归一化距离无法进一步降低，导致精度无法持续提高。相比之下，OPG-ADMM 虽然收敛速度较慢，但通过增加采样次数可以实现更高的精度。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_c308d4e5483a906cc8f37f85b79f027ee44b0f6f90e3ba1048b87490afdd434b.png
image_title: Decoupling and Compensation of Coherent Errors
description: This image illustrates various techniques for decoupling and compensating coherent errors in quantum systems. Panel (a) shows a simple X2 dynamical decoupling pulse sequence that removes Z errors by altering the sign of accumulated phase during evolution. Panel (b) demonstrates how staggered dynamical decoupling pulses are necessary to suppress two-qubit ZZ errors, ensuring periods of evolution accumulate opposite phases that cancel out unwanted interactions. Panel (c) explains how coherent single qubit Z errors can be removed by absorbing their inverse in neighboring gates, decomposing any single qubit gate into Rz rotations and √X gates. Panel (d) depicts the Cartan decomposition of a two-qubit gate U, showing how a two-qubit ZZ error can be compensated by an Rzz rotation, with careful consideration of gate sequences and potential changes in correction signs when moving errors past twirling layers.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_1e6136b15f45df67b1197969dd70bfad94d0fbf3767b5d3a385830de8da4d990.png
image_title: Pauli Twirling in Layered Quantum Circuits
description: The image illustrates the process of Pauli twirling in a layered quantum circuit. It shows how an arbitrary two-qubit gate (U) is surrounded by random single-qubit Pauli gates (V, W, X, Y, Z) before and after its application. These Pauli gates are then recombined with the original single-qubit gates to simplify error characterization and mitigation without altering the logical operation of the circuit. The final result demonstrates that the overall logical operation remains unchanged despite the addition of twirling gates.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_d204042e251fba6f628fced1f29b8c72de94beee0bddcdf8f2e1b353f50590f5.png
image_title: Context-Aware Suppression of Coherent Errors Using Compensation or Dynamical Decoupling (DD)
description:
This figure illustrates various scenarios for suppressing coherent errors in quantum circuits using compensation techniques and dynamical decoupling (DD). It includes multiple sub-figures demonstrating different cases where coherent errors can be identified and mitigated. The main components are: 
- **(a)** Depiction of several cases (I, II, III, IV) where coherent errors occur and can be suppressed.
- **(b)** Ramsey experiments on one and two qubits to characterize errors and their suppression, showing oscillations in fidelity due to coherent noise.
- **(c)** Idling neighboring qubits suffering from single-qubit Z and two-qubit ZZ errors, which can be removed by absorption into a two-qubit gate, DD, or a combination thereof.
- **(d)** Control spectator qubits experiencing coherent Z errors that can be absorbed into single-qubit gate layers.
- **(e)** Target spectator qubits also suffering from coherent Z errors, similarly absorbed into single-qubit gates.
- **(f)** When control qubits of two ECR gates are aligned, two-qubit ZZ errors reappear, requiring error compensation via another two-qubit gate since DD cannot be applied without altering the gate operation.
Each panel shows circuit diagrams with noisy circuits, error compensation strategies, and DD sequences, along with corresponding fidelity plots demonstrating the effectiveness of these methods.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_ecdf0a6256a05606aa045101e68729f4dfced14196f595e13b7953250e969a86.png
image_title: Characterization of Coherent Errors and Suppression Techniques
description: This figure illustrates the characterization of coherent errors in quantum systems and the effectiveness of various suppression techniques. Panel (a) shows Ramsey experiments on ibm nazca, where the fidelity F oscillates due to coherent noise, with a dashed line indicating the frequency of always-on coupling. Panel (b) demonstrates the impact of charge-parity fluctuations causing slow Z errors, leading to beatings in the oscillations. Panel (c) compares different dynamical decoupling (DD) sequences—aligned, staggered, and Walsh—for suppressing next-nearest-neighbor (NNN) ZZ interactions, showing how these sequences reduce error accumulation over time. The inset in panel (c) highlights the concept of frequency collisions that can enhance NNN crosstalk.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_dced2a0e1efa77a5a1297a75c2b92ff1fdafb9b537f69c880253919f7134b225.png
image_title: Context-Aware Dynamical Decoupling Algorithm
description: This image illustrates the process of context-aware dynamical decoupling (CA-DD) in quantum circuits. It shows a qubit connectivity graph with next-nearest-neighbor crosstalk, along with a 4-layer circuit interleaved with twirls. Idle qubits are colored according to the algorithm's rules, and Walsh-Hadamard sequences are inserted based on these colors to suppress correlated Z and ZZ errors within the given context. The figure also depicts the location of pulses in the first 7 Walsh-Hadamard sequences, each corresponding to a different color after graph node coloring, ensuring balanced suppression of Z and ZZ errors.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_8bfe73cf7e9bcb3e6cefcb02373725a7d584a9740389c5c08f13ebff4fe7cad9.png
image_title: 量子电路中的上下文感知动态解耦示例
description: 该图片展示了量子电路中上下文感知动态解耦（Context-aware dynamical decoupling）的示例。图(a)显示了一个具有6个量子比特（Q0至Q5）的量子电路，其中包含多个门操作（如C和T门），以及用于表示控制和目标量子比特的标记（ctrl spec. 和 tgt spec.）。图(b)则详细说明了不同颜色对应的Walsh-Hadamard序列脉冲位置，每个序列对应一种颜色，用于抑制Z、ZZ和ZZZ等相关的错误。通过这种上下文感知的方法，可以在特定的电路层中插入适当的解耦序列，以最小化相干和非相干噪声的影响。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000006_41330960c6a4e42dac9af6c66b9a59333d6918edc709cd9f0c723ced6b0b1bfe.png
image_title: Algorithm for Context-Aware Error Compensation
description: This image presents an algorithm designed to identify, accumulate, and compensate coherent crosstalk errors in quantum circuits. The algorithm processes a scheduled circuit layer by layer, tracking error accumulations on individual qubits (Z) and pairs of qubits (ZZ). It calculates compensation angles based on the ZZ rates and durations of each layer, updating a dictionary that maps qubits and qubit pairs to their accumulated error compensations. The algorithm also handles cases where twirl layers are encountered, adjusting compensation angles as needed. If a compensation cannot be commuted through a layer, it is either absorbed into existing gates or explicitly inserted as a gate into the circuit. Finally, pulse stretching is used to implement ZZ rotations natively, reducing gate errors compared to using two CNOTs.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000007_907568506d64a45e89330b4958f56d43f544d35a944df57f495dc7f5b99430fc.png
image_title: Floquet Ising Evolution with Error Compensation
description: This image illustrates the Floquet time-evolution of an Ising-type model at the Clifford point, demonstrating the impact of error compensation techniques. Panel (a) shows the circuit structure for the Floquet Ising model, consisting of d steps with two layers of two-qubit gates and a layer of single-qubit X gates. Panel (b) highlights the twirled two-qubit gate layers, where idling periods introduce additional Z errors at the boundary qubits. Panel (c) presents experimental results from IBM Nazca, comparing the performance of error suppression methods: no suppression, context-aware dynamical decoupling (CA-DD), and context-aware error compensation (CA-EC). The red circles in panels (a) and (b) indicate the boundary qubits where error compensation or decoupling is applied, showing significant improvement in results compared to the case without error suppression.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000008_ebb9682907ad61325a3ffe07ee576208913e50e68cd80d8732c2ff44a42573fc.png
image_title: Heisenberg Model with Error Suppression Techniques
description:
This image illustrates the implementation and performance of error suppression techniques in a Heisenberg model simulation on a quantum computer. It is divided into four panels:
(a) A ring architecture on a heavy hex lattice, showing the arrangement of qubits and interaction layers within a time step.
(b) A mapping of the Heisenberg ring onto a 12-qubit circuit with periodic boundary conditions. The schematic shows one time step, with colored edges indicating two-qubit interactions and grey gates representing canonical two-qubit operations (U_can). Red dots indicate errors (ZZ and Z) that are compensated or decoupled.
(c) Experimental results comparing different error suppression techniques (CA-EC, CA-DD, DD, and no suppression) on ibm nazca. The plot shows the expectation value ⟨Z_2⟩ as a function of depth d, demonstrating how context-aware error compensation (CA-EC and CA-DD) recovers oscillatory features of the dynamics compared to no suppression or regular DD.
(d) Estimated error mitigation overhead for the techniques shown in panel (c). CA-EC and CA-DD significantly reduce the overhead compared to no suppression and DD, respectively.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000009_844e5bbf021d3fd7ae2546eceab423c97f76d74bc7208796d2afb90db00dc6d7.png
image_title: Benchmarking Layer Fidelities
description: This image illustrates the benchmarking of layer fidelities in a quantum circuit. It consists of three parts: (a) shows the layout of a 10-qubit layer on IBM Nazca, with 3 ECR gates and 4 idle qubits; (b) depicts the twirled layer with coherent errors highlighted in red; and (c) presents a bar chart comparing the layer fidelity improvements achieved by different error suppression methods. The methods compared are 'None' (baseline), 'DD' (Dynamical Decoupling), 'CA-DD' (Context-Aware Dynamical Decoupling), and 'CA-EC' (Context-Aware Error Compensation). The results show significant improvements in layer fidelity when using CA-DD and CA-EC, with CA-EC performing particularly well due to its ability to address correlated ZZ errors between control qubits.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000010_b2b2ef6203c9e11f72a367f03fded82729ca1014cd9fee380c8d46cb6bc6f697.png
image_title: Error Compensation for Dynamic Circuits
description: This figure illustrates the process of error compensation in dynamic quantum circuits. (a) Shows a quantum circuit for preparing a Bell state using mid-circuit measurement on an auxiliary qubit and a conditional X gate on one of the data qubits. Errors during measurement and feedforward are highlighted in red. The final stage measures the Bell fidelity by applying a CNOT and a Hadamard gate. (b) Demonstrates how errors are compensated by appending the inverse of accumulated ZZ and Z rotations to the conditional operation. An additional Z rotation is applied to the middle qubit when the intermediate measurement results in 1. (c) Plots the fidelity (F) with varying estimates of the idle time (τ). The optimal τ corresponds to the best estimate of the measurement and feedforward time, resulting in a significant increase in fidelity by more than 8×.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling_images/Suppressing Correlated Noise in Quantum Computers via Context-Aware Compiling-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000011_1f3902775b18d6a1b4515e3a939ad6b764379405fe6803971191434edfbc76e7.png
image_title: Combined Compiling Strategy for Error Suppression
description: This figure illustrates the performance of different error suppression strategies in a quantum circuit with six qubits. (a) Shows a Floquet time-evolution circuit where the final measurement is P_{00} on two qubits, which should ideally remain at 1 across all time steps d. (b) Demonstrates the fidelity results when applying various suppression methods: 'None' (no error mitigation), 'DD' (Dynamical Decoupling), 'CA-EC' (Context-Aware Error Compensation), 'CA-DD' (Context-Aware Dynamical Decoupling), and 'CA-EC+DD' (combined strategy). The combined strategy outperforms individual methods, maintaining higher fidelity over multiple time steps. Experiments were conducted on the ibm penguino1 quantum processor.

image_title: 空白图形
description: 图片显示一个简单的空白正方形，没有其他可见的元素或内容。

image_title: 量子CONGEST模型中的算法框架示意图
description: 该图片展示了在量子CONGEST模型中，分布式量子查询的框架示意图。图中可能包含节点、边以及算法执行过程中的关键步骤，如BFS（广度优先搜索）和循环检测等。此外，图片可能涉及算法的并行执行、最小值查找过程以及如何通过量子技术加速图的girth计算。

image_title: 量子算法中的幅度放大迭代示意图
description: 该图片展示了量子算法中幅度放大迭代的过程，涉及两个反射操作：通过状态 |ψ⟩ 的空间和通过 'Good' 部分 |φ₁⟩|1⟩ 的空间。图中可能包括了对这些反射的实现步骤，例如使用 Z 门进行反射，以及如何通过网络节点协作完成反射过程。此外，图片可能还展示了如何通过分布式方式检查全零状态，并在领导节点上应用 Z 门以完成反射。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_93f442460ab826e8edd683f0c576298fa2774e6eedba527d12d67bb55cf40040.png
image_title: 量子神经网络模型架构
description: 该图展示了量子神经网络的模型架构，包括三个主要部分：特征映射（feature map）、变分模型（variational model）和测量（measurement）。输入数据 $x$ 首先通过特征映射 $\mathcal{U}_x$ 编码到量子态 $|\psi_x\rangle$ 中。接着，变分模型 $\mathcal{G}_\theta$ 对量子态进行参数化操作，生成新的量子态 $|g_\theta(x)\rangle$。最后，通过测量操作提取输出 $y$，其中测量结果为量子态在 $\sigma_z$ 基础上的测量值，并计算输出比特串的奇偶性以实现二分类任务。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_2ddcf65695bb82b08762e16b58f2b2d26a88cead3e095488c7ae7767f539c5ae.png
image_title: Fisher Information Spectrum Comparison
description: This image compares the Fisher information spectrum for three different models: a classical neural network, an easy quantum model, and a quantum neural network. The x-axis represents the eigenvalue size (binned into 5 intervals), while the y-axis shows the normalised counts of eigenvalues within each bin. The classical neural network exhibits a highly degenerate Fisher information matrix with most eigenvalues concentrated near zero and a few very large eigenvalues. The easy quantum model also has many eigenvalues close to zero but with less extreme large eigenvalues compared to the classical model. In contrast, the quantum neural network displays a more uniform distribution of eigenvalues across the spectrum, indicating better capacity and trainability.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_cebbb70753c493ba48f6dbf5589b14e095686ee405482bfb708a2a6c4eb3cabc.png
image_title: 规范化有效维度随数据量的变化
description: 该图展示了三种模型（量子神经网络、简易量子模型和经典前馈神经网络）的规范化有效维度随数据量变化的趋势。横轴表示数据量，纵轴表示规范化有效维度（d_eff/d）。量子神经网络（绿色曲线）在广泛的有限数据范围内始终具有最高的有效维度，其次是简易量子模型（蓝色曲线），而经典模型（红色曲线）的有效维度在整个研究的数据范围内从未达到量子模型的水平。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_0e9f91dabc9c1d9365767fa24a02d32f658c9156de7e5d059970d5b6d4bf56b0.png
image_title: 训练损失对比
description: 该图展示了三种模型（经典神经网络、简单量子模型和量子神经网络）在不同训练迭代次数下的平均训练损失值，以及它们的标准差范围。此外，还包含了在真实量子硬件（ibmq montreal 后端）上的训练结果。图中显示，量子神经网络在所有模型中表现出最低的平均训练损失，并且损失收敛速度最快，标准差最小。相比之下，经典神经网络虽然在某些迭代中达到较低的损失值，但其标准差显著较大。整体上，量子神经网络在训练性能上优于其他两种模型，特别是在真实量子硬件上的表现甚至优于模拟结果。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_448383684f1bbdaee101c04957339d92e7774a8a159c6f9752b938168e096d1a.png
image_title: 量子神经网络的特征映射电路
description: 该图片展示了一个量子神经网络中的特征映射电路。电路首先对每个量子比特应用Hadamard门（H），然后通过RZ门将归一化后的数据特征值编码到量子态中。接下来，使用CNOT门和RZZ门实现更高阶的数据编码，涉及每对量子比特之间的相互作用。整个特征映射重复一次以达到深度为2的结构。此电路设计旨在提高模型的容量和可训练性，避免出现‘贫瘠高原’现象。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_1bee4e1d70937db342fbb69914f1f872cc382cbf37f3a327f3b5eb35eab2e807.png
image_title: 量子变分电路示意图
description: 该图片展示了一个量子变分电路的结构，用于说明量子神经网络中的变分形式。电路包含 S 个量子比特，首先对每个量子比特应用参数化的 RY 门（旋转角度为 θ_i）。接着，在电路中每对量子比特之间应用 CNOT 门以实现纠缠。最后，再次对每个量子比特应用另一组参数化的 RY 门。整个电路的深度为 1，共有 2S 个可训练参数。如果增加深度，可以重复纠缠层和第二组 RY 门。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000006_15277561a6edd73480a07fd7ad4c535f970bb5e116559cb591738b27d2b24bfa.png
image_title: Generalisation behaviour of the effective dimension
description: The plot shows the normalised effective dimension of a neural network trained on confusion sets with increasing percentages of randomised labels. The x-axis represents the percentage of randomised labels, while the y-axis represents the normalised effective dimension. The curve demonstrates an increase in the effective dimension as the data becomes more random, indicating the model's ability to capture generalisation behaviour. The shaded region around the curve represents one standard deviation above and below the mean, averaged over 10 different training runs.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000007_49a04bdadb2ad3a40d97a3965593b536feb7e7b8384eddbfc2a58e7044a2276f.png
image_title: 不同分辨率下的模型几何表示
description: 图片展示了在不同数据量（即不同分辨率）下，一个模型的几何结构如何被感知。低分辨率时，模型看起来像一个二维的圆盘；中等分辨率时，模型表现为一条螺旋线，显示出一维特征；高分辨率时，模型的真实二维结构得以显现。这说明有效维度并不总是随着数据量的增加而单调递增，而是反映了模型在不同分辨率下的表现形式。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000008_bcc178371e9c5cd6972da6f50c24fae75a1864ef673a4708dad6ccdc60eec528.png
image_title: 不同输入尺寸和参数数量下的归一化有效维度
description: 该图展示了在不同数据样本数量（n）下，随着输入尺寸（s_in）和可训练参数数量（d）的变化，归一化有效维度的敏感性分析。图中包含六个子图，分别对应不同的数据样本数量（n=1e4, n=1e7, n=1e13），以及不同的输入尺寸和参数数量组合（如 s_in=4, d=8；s_in=6, d=12；s_in=8, d=16；s_in=10, d=20 等）。每个子图中的曲线表示不同模型配置下的归一化有效维度随参数样本数量的变化趋势。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000009_a8290a62ed6d2895a7b01e1f1c33ffafb00bd092540f98ac4f966057c4ee68e4.png
image_title: Fisher Information Spectrum for Different Model Types
description: This image presents a comparative analysis of the Fisher information spectrum for three different model types: classical neural network, easy quantum model, and quantum neural network. The histograms are plotted over increasing input sizes (s_in), with rows A, B, and C corresponding to s_in = 6, 8, and 10, respectively. Each row contains three subplots (A1, A2, A3; B1, B2, B3; C1, C2, C3) representing the classical neural network, easy quantum model, and quantum neural network, respectively. The x-axis represents normalized counts, while the y-axis shows the frequency of eigenvalues. Key observations include: the classical neural network exhibits a majority of eigenvalues near zero with a few large eigenvalues, the easy quantum model shows a somewhat uniform spectrum that deteriorates with larger input sizes, and the quantum neural network maintains a more uniform spectrum across increasing input sizes and parameter dimensions, indicating potential advantages in avoiding unfavorable properties like barren plateaus.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/The power of quantum neural networks_images/The power of quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000010_f70d6339561126b847b14d57773efc2873816118c1f6875de7af7c0dd1ab3b48.png
image_title: Quantum Neural Network Circuit on Quantum Hardware
description: This image depicts a quantum circuit implemented on quantum hardware, specifically designed for training a quantum neural network. The circuit begins with Hadamard gates applied to four qubits, followed by data encoding using RZ-gates where the Z-rotations depend on the feature values of the input data. Entangling layers with CNOT gates and additional RZ-gates encoding products of feature values are then applied. The data encoding process is repeated to create a depth-2 feature map. Finally, parameterized RY-gates are applied to each qubit, followed by linear entanglement and another layer of parameterized RY-gates. The circuit contains a total of 8 trainable parameters, as indicated in the text.

image_title: Variational Quantum Algorithm (VQA) Schematic
description: This image illustrates the architecture of a Variational Quantum Algorithm (VQA). It shows a hybrid quantum-classical loop where a quantum computer is used to estimate the cost function or its gradients, while a classical optimizer updates the parameters θ to minimize the cost function C(θ). The process involves input states ρ_k, a parameterized quantum circuit (ansatz), and a set of functions {f_k} that define the cost. The classical optimizer navigates the cost landscape to find the optimal parameters, which are then fed back into the quantum computer for further iterations until convergence.

image_title: 量子电路中的参数化单元分解示意图
description: 该图片展示了量子电路中一个参数化的单元操作 U(θ) 的分解过程。U(θ) 被表示为多个连续应用的子单元操作 U_l(θ_l) 的乘积，其中每个子单元操作 U_l(θ_l) 又可以进一步分解为一系列参数化和非参数化的量子门。图中上方展示了整体的单元操作 U(θ)，下方则详细展示了其中一个子单元操作 U_l(θ_l) 的具体结构，包括参数化门和非参数化门的组合。

image_title: Variational Quantum Algorithms (VQAs) Applications
description: This image illustrates the various applications of Variational Quantum Algorithms (VQAs). The central node, labeled 'Variational Quantum Algorithms,' is connected to multiple application areas, including Dynamical Simulations, Error Correction, Compilation, Machine Learning (with subcategories like Classifiers and Generative Models), New Frontiers (such as Quantum Information, Quantum Metrology, and Quantum Foundations), Mathematical Applications (like Systems of Equations, Factoring, and Principal Components), and Combinatorial Optimization. Specific applications highlighted include Quantum Chemistry for Finding Ground States and Condensed Matter studies. The diagram visually represents how VQAs can be applied across diverse fields, emphasizing their versatility and potential impact.

image_title: Barren Plateau Phenomenon
description: The image illustrates the barren plateau phenomenon in variational quantum algorithms. Panel (a) shows the variance of the partial derivative of the cost function with respect to a parameter θ₁, plotted against the number of qubits (n). The y-axis is on a logarithmic scale, and the variance decreases exponentially as the number of qubits increases, indicating the presence of a barren plateau. Panel (b) visualizes the landscape of a global cost function exhibiting a barren plateau for different numbers of qubits (n = 24 and n = 4). As the number of qubits increases, the landscape becomes flatter, and the volume of parameters leading to small cost values shrinks exponentially, highlighting the difficulty in training deep unstructured parametrized quantum circuits.

image_title: Qubit Trajectories on the Bloch Sphere with Zero-Noise Extrapolation (ZNE)
description: The image illustrates qubit trajectories on the Bloch sphere using the Zero-Noise Extrapolation (ZNE) technique. Part (a) shows two trajectories: a red curve representing a rotation with higher noise and a green curve with lower noise. Part (b) demonstrates how ZNE can estimate the trajectory in the absence of noise (blue curve) by extrapolating data from the noisy trajectories. This method improves the accuracy of noisy quantum computations by mitigating errors through classical post-processing.

image_title: 根二叉系统发育网络及其展示的树
description: 该图片展示了三个不同的图形，分别标记为 (a)、(b) 和 (c)。图 (a) 是一个根二叉系统发育网络（rooted binary phylogenetic network），包含一个网状顶点和四个叶节点（标记为 a、b、c、d）。图 (b) 和 (c) 分别是两个根二叉系统发育树（rooted binary phylogenetic trees），它们由图 (a) 的系统发育网络通过删除顶点和边并抑制特定顶点后得到。这些树也展示了相同的叶节点 a、b、c、d。此图用于说明系统发育网络如何展示系统发育树的概念。

image_title: Lemma 14, Case 1 Setup
description: This image illustrates the setup described in Case 1 of the proof for Lemma 14. It shows two directed paths representing \(\mathcal{I}(x, u_i)\) and \(\mathcal{I}(x, u_j)\), corresponding to vertices \(u_i\) and \(u_j\) in graph \(\mathcal{T}\). The tree vertex \(v_{i'}\) has one child in \(\mathcal{I}(x, u_i)\) and the other child in \(\mathcal{I}(x, u_j)\). This configuration is used to demonstrate a contradiction when assuming there exist at least two edges connecting vertices from \(\mathcal{I}(x, u_i)\) to \(\mathcal{I}(x, u_j)\).

image_title: 图示：树顶点的子路径关系
description:
该图片展示了两个有向路径之间的关系，具体描述如下：
- 图中包含两条有向路径，分别表示为 \(\mathcal{P}(x, u_i)\) 和 \(\mathcal{P}(x, u_j)\)，其中 \(u_i\) 和 \(u_j\) 是树 \(\mathcal{T}\) 中的顶点。
- 路径 \(\mathcal{P}(x, u_i)\) 包含顶点 \(v_c'\) 和 \(v_d'\)，路径 \(\mathcal{P}(x, u_j)\) 包含顶点 \(v_c\) 和 \(v_d\)。
- 顶点 \(v_c'\) 是一个树顶点，其一个子节点在 \(\mathcal{P}(x, u_i)\) 中，另一个子节点在 \(\mathcal{P}(x, u_j)\) 中。
- 这种结构对应于证明中的 Case 1，说明了当存在至少两条边连接两个路径时的矛盾情况。
- 图中标注了路径的起点和终点，以及关键顶点之间的关系。

image_title: 图示：树结构中的路径与顶点关系
description: 该图片展示了一个树结构的示意图，其中包含两条路径和一些关键顶点。具体来说，图片中有两个主要路径，分别标记为 $d(\mathbf{x}, u_i)$ 和 $d(\mathbf{x}, u_l)$，表示从根节点到特定顶点的距离。路径上的顶点通过有向边连接，展示了树的层次结构。特别地，顶点 $v_c$ 是一个分叉点，其子节点 $v_d$ 和 $v_{d'}$ 分别属于不同的路径分支。虚线可能表示某种特殊关系或条件，例如在证明中提到的特定约束或假设。此图用于说明树结构中顶点和路径的关系，以及如何根据这些关系推导出某些数学结论。

image_title: 图4：一个基于集合 \mathcal{B} 的系统发育网络 \mathcal{N} 和两个系统发育树 \mathcal{T}_1 和 \mathcal{T}_2
description: 该图片展示了三个不同的结构，分别标记为 (a)、(b) 和 (c)。(a) 部分展示了一个系统发育网络 \mathcal{N}，其中包含多个节点和边，节点上标有数字以表示其在矩阵中的位置。(b) 和 (c) 部分则分别展示了两个系统发育树 \mathcal{T}_1 和 \mathcal{T}_2，它们也具有类似的节点编号，并且每个叶子节点都标注了字母（如 a、b、c、d），代表特定的元素或分类单元。这些结构用于说明如何通过 QUBO 形式化解决树包含问题，以及如何使用量子退火器来评估系统发育网络是否显示给定的树。

image_title: 甲胺分子结构图
description: 图片展示了一个甲胺（CH₃NH₂）分子的结构，其中氮原子（N）被高亮显示为绿色。该分子由一个氨基（-NH₂）和一个甲基（-CH₃）组成，氨基中的氢原子与氮原子相连，而甲基中的碳原子通过单键与氮原子相连。

image_title: 分子结构图：(CH3)2NH
description: 该图片展示了一个化学分子的结构，具体为(CH3)2NH（二甲胺）。分子由两个甲基（-CH3）和一个氨基（-NH2）组成，其中氮原子（N）与两个氢原子（H）以及两个甲基相连。每个碳原子（C）通过单键连接到三个氢原子（H），形成典型的烷烃结构。

image_title: Formamide分子结构
description: 图片展示了一个化学分子的结构，具体为Formamide（HCONH₂）。分子中包含一个碳原子（C）、一个氧原子（O）、一个氮原子（N）和两个氢原子（H）。碳原子与氧原子通过双键连接，同时碳原子还与一个氢原子单键连接。氮原子则通过单键与另一个氢原子相连，并且与碳原子形成一个单键。

image_title: 乙醛分子结构图
description: 图片展示了一个乙醛（CH₃CHO）分子的化学结构，其中包含一个甲基（-CH₃）、一个碳原子与氧原子形成的羰基（C=O），以及一个氢原子直接连接到羰基碳上。该结构图清晰地表示了乙醛分子的原子组成和键合方式。

image_title: 乙醇分子结构图
description: 图片展示了一个乙醇（CH3CH2OH）分子的结构，其中氧原子被标记为绿色。该分子由一个乙基（CH3CH2-）和一个羟基（-OH）组成，体现了分子中碳、氢和氧原子的连接方式。

image_title: Acetonitrile (CH3CN) Molecular Structure
description: This image depicts the molecular structure of acetonitrile (CH3CN), showing a carbon atom bonded to three hydrogen atoms and a nitrogen atom. The structure highlights the single bond between carbon and nitrogen, as well as the single bonds between carbon and hydrogen atoms. This molecule is part of the study on embedding calculations for small molecules using projection-based embedding methods.

image_title: CH2F分子结构图
description: 该图片展示了一个CH2F（氟甲烷）分子的结构，其中碳原子与两个氢原子和一个氟原子相连。氟原子用绿色表示，以突出其在分子中的位置。

image_title: 水分子的结构示意图
description: 图片展示了一个水分子（H₂O）的结构，其中氧原子用绿色表示，两个氢原子分别连接在氧原子上。此图用于说明水分子的几何结构及其在研究OH键断裂时的活性区域选择问题。

image_title: 水分子 (H₂O) 的结构示意图
description: 图片展示了一个水分子的结构，其中氧原子（O）与两个氢原子（H）通过共价键相连。该图用于说明在不同分子几何构型下，OH键的伸展对分子能量的影响，特别是在强相关性区域中的表现。

image_title: Small Molecule Ground State Energies and Hamiltonian Properties
description: This image presents results for the ground state energies, number of qubits in the Hamiltonian, and the number of terms in the Jordan-Wigner encoded qubit Hamiltonian for several small molecules. The molecules include N-methylmethanamine, acetaldehyde, acetonitrile, ethanamine, ethanol, fluoroethane, and formamide. The data is compared using three methods: Huzinaga localization, μ-shift localization, and the full system calculation. The ground state energies are shown as differences from the whole system CCSD(T) energy, while the number of qubits and terms in the Hamiltonian are presented for each method. This figure highlights the efficiency and accuracy improvements achieved through embedding calculations with different localization techniques.

image_title: H2O Bond Dissociation Energy and Hamiltonian Complexity
description: The image presents a comparison of potential energy curves for the bond dissociation of an OH bond in water (H2O) using different embedding methods. The top panel shows the logarithmic error (base 10) with respect to the exact Full Configuration Interaction (FCI) energy, while the bottom panel displays the number of terms in the Jordan-Wigner encoded qubit Hamiltonian for each method. The methods compared include Huzinaga embedding, µ-shift embedding, and global Density Functional Theory (DFT), with variations based on whether the active region includes the changing or fixed OH bond. The x-axis represents the bond length in Ångströms, and the results highlight the accuracy and complexity of each approach as the bond is stretched.

image_title: 量子电路示意图
description: 该图片展示了一个量子电路，用于实现纯态分解的优化。电路包括两个输入：一个在系统空间 \(\mathcal{H}\) 的初始状态 \(|0\rangle^{\otimes h}\)，以及一个在辅助空间 \(\mathcal{W}\) 的初始状态 \(|0\rangle^{\otimes d}\)。首先，通过一个准备模块生成纯态 \(|\psi\rangle\)，然后应用一个参数化的单位ary操作 \(U\) 到辅助空间上。最后，对辅助空间进行测量，以获取目标密度矩阵的纯态分解。此电路设计基于净化定理，用于实验性地重构纯态 \(|\varphi_i\rangle\) 和对应的概率 \(q_i\)，从而计算目标量 \(\sum_{i=1}^d q_i \mu(\varphi_i)\)。

image_title: Training Landscape of T_f(ρ; θ, φ)
description: This image depicts the training landscape of the function T_f(ρ; θ, φ), where ρ is the maximally mixed state and θ, φ ∈ [0, 2π]. The landscape is represented as a 3D surface plot with θ and φ as the horizontal axes and T_f(ρ; θ, φ) as the vertical axis. The color gradient indicates the value of T_f, showing variations across different parameter values. This visualization helps in understanding the behavior of the cost function during optimization processes, particularly in variational quantum algorithms.

image_title: 量子电路：直接测量两量子比特态的纠缠度
description: 该图片展示了一个量子电路，用于直接测量两个量子比特态的纠缠度（concurrence）。电路中包含两个量子比特对，每个对分别处于状态 |ψ⟩。电路的关键部分包括一个受控操作和一个单位矩阵 R，其定义为 R = (1/√2) * [[1, 1], [-1, 1]]。通过应用这些操作到状态 |ψ⟩ ⊗ |ψ⟩，可以计算出特定输出态的概率幅值，从而间接测量纠缠度 C(ψ)²。

image_title: 量子电路：直接测量纯态集合的纠缠度
description: 该图片展示了一个量子电路，用于通过直接测量纯态集合的纠缠度来近似计算两量子比特系统的形成纠缠熵。电路分为两个主要部分，每部分准备一个纯态 |ψ⟩ 并应用参数化操作 U(θ̂)。随后，通过一系列量子门（包括 R 和 Y 门）以及测量操作，实现对纯态集合的纠缠度的直接测量。此电路设计用于高效地计算两量子比特系统的形成纠缠熵。

image_title: 算法收敛性：S(ρ; θ, φ) 的误差随迭代次数的变化
description: 该图展示了在计算 S(ρ; θ, φ) 时，算法的误差随迭代次数的变化情况。横轴表示迭代次数，纵轴表示误差（以对数尺度显示）。曲线显示了误差从初始值逐渐减小并最终趋于稳定的过程，表明算法在迭代过程中逐步收敛。

image_title: 量子交换测试电路
description: 该图片展示了一个用于量子交换测试的电路。电路中包含一个初始态 |0⟩，经过 Hadamard 变换 (H) 后与两个输入态 |φ⟩ 和 |ψ⟩ 进行控制操作（CNOT）。最终，通过测量顶部线路的状态来估计 |⟨φ|ψ⟩|^2 的值，误差为 ε。此电路是计算 Tsallis 熵和近似 Tsallis 纠缠熵的关键组成部分。

image_title: 量子电路用于逼近Tsallis纠缠熵
description: 该图片展示了一个量子电路，用于逼近Tsallis纠缠熵。电路包含两个部分，每个部分准备了密度矩阵ρ的纯化态|ψ⟩，并应用了参数化的操作U(θ)到辅助子系统W上。随后，通过测量辅助子系统W的状态，可以得到关于A和B子系统的相关信息。最终，通过附加上一个交换测试（swap test）电路，可以估计不同纯化态之间的重叠，从而逼近Tsallis纠缠熵。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks_images/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_f104e69698072fcc2f614e8495c2f973ab74dae149ccde05689560eb2432b350.png
image_title: Quantum Neural Networks: Mathematical Spaces and Loss Landscape
description: This image illustrates the mathematical spaces involved in Quantum Neural Networks (QNNs) and their connection to the loss function landscape. It shows a sequence of transformations from parameter space (ℝ^M) to unitary space (U(d)), then to state space (ℋ), and finally to the loss function landscape (ℒ(θ)). The diagram highlights how variations in parameters θ influence the unitary operators U(θ), which in turn affect the quantum states and ultimately determine the loss function values. Key components include the set of generators G, the Lie Algebra, and the resulting dynamics in the loss function landscape, emphasizing the role of overparametrization in improving trainability.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks_images/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_a959f35f1be80387750fa178f2bf1c8742fb1c38238d3071a2abdd1ab093d2d1.png
image_title: Overparametrization Threshold for VQE Implementation
description: This figure illustrates the overparametrization threshold for the Variational Quantum Eigensolver (VQE) implementation. It includes two subplots: a) The success probability of convergence to the global optimum within an error of 10^-7 is plotted against the number of parameters, showing a phase transition at the onset of overparametrization. b) The ranks of the Quantum Fisher Information Matrix (QFIM) and Hessian are plotted versus the number of qubits, demonstrating their dependence on system size and boundary conditions. The vertical black lines in subplot (a) indicate the dimension of the DLA (Dimension of Lie Algebra), while dashed lines in subplot (b) show the functional dependence of the computed ranks.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks_images/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_4294556f87cbf9841742062055b2d86183acb1f5880f8706679fa41d23c0bbaa.png
image_title: Unitary Compilation: Success Probability and Rank Analysis
description: This figure presents results related to the unitary compilation task, where a parametrized quantum circuit is trained to match a target unitary. Panel (a) shows the success probability of convergence to the global optimum as a function of the number of parameters for different qubit sizes (4, 6, 8, and 10 qubits). The success probability increases sharply as the number of parameters surpasses a certain threshold, indicating the onset of overparametrization. Panel (b) plots the rank of the Quantum Fisher Information Matrix (QFIM) and Hessian versus the number of qubits, demonstrating how these ranks scale with system size. The dashed lines indicate the functional dependence of the computed ranks, providing insights into the relationship between the number of parameters and the quality of solutions obtained.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks_images/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_379459cab7c8a4bcc1ff1728be77e7af3188fb084af9eb03a2700c0328e734aa.png
image_title: 量子自编码器实现
description:
该图展示了量子自编码器的实现结果，具体包括：
- 图a：损失函数值随迭代次数的变化，针对不同数量的量子比特（n=2, 3, 4, 5）和不同层数的硬件高效变分电路（L层）。每个点是通过50个随机初始化问题实例的平均值得到的。
- 图b：成功概率（即收敛到全局最优解的比例，误差小于10^-7）与参数数量的关系。垂直线表示DLA的维度。
- 图c：QFIM和Hessian的秩随量子比特数的变化。QFIM在全局最优解和景观中的随机点处评估，而Hessian仅在全局最优解处评估。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks_images/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000006_b5050f921fd64a0c3444af5c5cc4c3909857ab5026fa5e85fa8666b579a0daa5.png
image_title: 量子自动编码器的损失函数收敛
description: 该图展示了在量子自动编码器任务中，使用不同层数（5层和35层）的硬件高效变分电路时，损失函数值随迭代次数的变化。横轴表示迭代次数，纵轴表示损失函数值（对数尺度）。结果显示，随着迭代次数的增加，损失函数迅速下降并趋于稳定，表明模型能够快速收敛到全局最优解。特别是，35层的深层网络在较少迭代次数内达到极低的损失值，显示出过参数化带来的优化优势。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks_images/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000007_fb1042fbecbdedec08f5c6a5ecb47e8a337187fe5f8f6c1a3e4f69d41202c1bb.png
image_title: 量子神经网络的数值模拟中的QNN Ansatz
description: 该图片展示了两种用于量子神经网络（QNN）数值模拟的Ansatz结构。图a）展示了Hamiltonian Variational Ansatz（HVA），用于变分量子本征求解任务，其中显示了n=4个量子比特的一层电路结构，包括ZZ(β)门和Rx(γ)门。图b）展示了硬件高效Ansatz，用于单位元编译和自动编码任务，其中显示了n=5个量子比特的一层电路结构，包含单量子比特旋转（Ry和Rx）以及交替对量子比特上的CZ门。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks_images/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000008_49c6e5556c7b48faa4d3853a7be8c1d04f2d06b436da4523300ce20d36b560bb.png
image_title: QFIM 和 Hessian 的特征值谱（n=6，L=10 和 L=12）
description:
该图展示了量子 Fisher 信息矩阵 (QFIM) 和 Hessian 矩阵的特征值谱，针对 n=6 个量子比特的情况。具体包括：
- 对于 L=10 层的 Hamiltonian 变分近似（HVA），在全局最优解处和随机点上的 QFIM 特征值。
- 对于 L=12 层的 HVA，在全局最优解处和随机点上的 Hessian 特征值。
- 图中显示了不同层深度下的特征值分布，以及与 dim(g_S^open) 的对比。
- 特征值谱表明存在明显的非连续性，零特征值与非零特征值之间有显著的间隙，这有助于明确矩阵的秩。
- 随机点的 Hessian 谱进一步揭示了景观的高度非凸性，包含正负特征值。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks_images/Theory of overparametrization in quantum neural networks-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000009_5e7a704841415caccbcdfb44ffb4bb327200cc6c835665196b46498fb666524d.png
image_title: QFIM Rank vs. Number of Parameters for VQE Implementations
description: This plot shows the average Quantum Fisher Information Matrix (QFIM) rank versus the number of parameters for Variational Quantum Eigensolver (VQE) implementations with Hamiltonian variational ansatz and open boundary conditions. The data is presented for systems with 4 and 6 qubits. The horizontal dashed lines indicate the maximal ranks that the QFIMs achieve, while the tilted dashed line represents the linear relationship where the QFIM rank equals the number of parameters. Vertical black lines correspond to the respective dimensions of the parameter space (dim(g_S)), marked for n = 4 (leftmost) and n = 6 (rightmost). The plot demonstrates that the QFIM rank saturates at a critical number of parameters (M_c), beyond which adding more parameters does not increase the rank but only introduces null eigenvalues.

image_title: 单资产情况下直接积分与Fourier方法的相对精度对数
description: 该图展示了在单资产期权定价中，直接积分方法（Eq. (13)）与Fourier方法（Eq. (19)）的相对精度对数随网格点数量N的变化。横轴表示网格点数量N，纵轴表示直接积分方法相对于Fourier方法的相对误差对数，即\(\ln(\epsilon_{\text{direct}} / \epsilon_{\text{Fourier}})\)，其中\(\epsilon_{\kappa} = |V_{\kappa} - V_{\text{exact}}| / V_{\text{exact}}\)，\(\kappa = \{\text{direct}, \text{Fourier}\}\)。图中显示，随着N的增加，直接积分方法的相对误差迅速增大，而Fourier方法表现出显著更高的精度和更快的收敛速度，尤其是在高网格点数量下。

image_title: Plaquette Stabilizer Generator
description: This image illustrates a plaquette stabilizer generator in a surface code. The blue circles represent qubits, and the Pauli Z operators are applied to the qubits on the boundary of the plaquette. This configuration demonstrates how a plaquette stabilizer is constructed as a tensor product of Pauli Z operators acting on the qubits that lie on the plaquette's boundary.

image_title: Vertex Stabilizer Generator
description: This image illustrates a vertex stabilizer generator in the context of surface codes. It shows a vertex surrounded by qubits, with Pauli X operators acting on the qubits adjacent to the vertex. The red lines represent the connections between the vertex and its neighboring qubits, indicating the tensor product of Pauli X operators that form the vertex stabilizer generator.

image_title: Surface Code with Mixed Boundaries
description: This image illustrates a surface code defined on a square lattice with mixed boundaries. The lattice is surrounded by two pairs of different boundaries, and each edge of the lattice is associated with a qubit. The structure shows how the stabilizer generators are arranged, with plaquette stabilizers forming closed loops around the lattice edges and vertex stabilizers acting on qubits adjacent to vertices. This configuration is characteristic of surface codes designed for fault-tolerant quantum computing.

image_title: Surface Code with a Hole
description: This image illustrates a surface code constructed on a lattice where a plaquette stabilizer generator in the middle of the lattice is removed, creating a hole. The lattice is depicted with qubits at each intersection, and the hole is shown as a shaded region. This type of surface code is designed to handle errors by incorporating defects into the lattice structure.

image_title: Z错误的张量积表示及其对应的综合节点
description: 图片展示了在表面码中，一个由Pauli Z错误构成的张量积（用蓝色线条表示），以及与之对应的综合节点（用蓝色圆圈表示）。这些节点是由于Pauli X操作符与Pauli Z操作符反交换而产生的。图中的灰色区域可能代表了错误的位置或影响范围，而蓝色线条和圆圈则清晰地标明了Z错误的分布及其对应的综合节点位置。

image_title: Surface Code with a Hole
description: This image illustrates a surface code constructed on a lattice with a hole. The lattice is depicted with edges representing qubits, and the hole is formed by removing a plaquette stabilizer generator in the middle of the lattice. The primal lattice is shown with solid lines, while the dual lattice is indicated by dashed lines. This configuration demonstrates how surface codes can be adapted to include defects or holes, which affects the code distance and error correction properties.

image_title: 量子表面码的QMLD解码结果（独立噪声模型）
description: 该图展示了在独立噪声模型下，量子最大似然解码（QMLD）的结果。图中包含多个小圆圈表示综合征节点，红色线条代表X型错误的校正字符串，蓝色线条代表Z型错误的校正字符串。具体来说，图中有4个X操作和4个Z操作，总权重为8。此图是用于对比不同噪声模型下解码结果的基础示例。

image_title: 图4(b): 基于去极化噪声模型的量子最大似然解码结果
description: 该图片展示了在去极化噪声模型下，量子表面码的最大似然解码（QMLD）结果。图中包含多个小圆圈表示综合征节点，红色和蓝色线条分别代表X型和Z型错误校正字符串。具体而言，图中显示了6个X型操作和4个Z型操作，从去极化噪声模型的角度来看，这等价于4个Y型操作和2个X型操作，总权重为6。与图4(a)相比，此解码结果在去极化噪声模型下更优，因为其总权重更低。

image_title: 图 5：重新加权的对偶晶格
description: 该图展示了在量子表面码解码过程中，通过重新加权对偶晶格上的边来优化错误模式的示例。具体而言，图中显示了两个综合节点（用小圆圈表示）之间的最短路径，在重新加权后的对偶晶格上，路径 P2 被选为最优路径，而非原始路径 P1。这表明重新加权可以找到导致额外总权重最小的校正字符串，从而改进解码结果。

image_title: Modified Decoding Process Example
description: This image illustrates an example of the modified decoding process for quantum surface codes over depolarizing channels. It shows a sequence of steps involving primal and dual lattices, where syndrome nodes are represented by red and blue dots. The figure demonstrates how reweighting the edges on the dual lattice affects the matching paths (B_i and R_i) between syndrome nodes. The total weights (T_0, T_1, T_2) are calculated for different iterations, showing how the algorithm iteratively refines the correction patterns to minimize the total weight. This example highlights the iterative nature of the decoding algorithm and its ability to improve the decoding result through multiple iterations.

image_title: Z型错误的解码示例
description: 该图片展示了在特定综合边界的情况下，Z型错误的解码过程。图中使用红色线条表示X型错误，蓝色线条表示Z型错误。此图说明了当Z型错误被解码为图中所示模式时，算法可能无法给出具有最小总权重的校正模式，从而表明IRMWPM解码器在去极化信道上不保证最大似然解码结果。

image_title: 不同迭代策略下的表面码解码性能
description: 该图展示了在混合边界表面码中，使用不同迭代策略时的逻辑错误率与量子比特错误率的关系。图中有四个子图，分别对应不同的代码距离（d=4, d=8, d=17, d=26）。每张子图中，蓝色线条表示未进行权重调整的MWPM解码，绿色线条表示仅重新权重一次的解码，红色线条表示达到停止准则的解码。随着量子比特错误率的增加，逻辑错误率也随之上升，但采用更多迭代策略（如重新权重或达到停止准则）可以显著降低逻辑错误率，特别是在较大的代码距离下效果更为明显。

image_title: 不同代码距离下额外迭代次数的分布
description: 该图展示了在混合边界表面码中，对于不同代码距离（d=4、d=8、d=17、d=26），额外迭代次数的概率分布。每个子图显示了额外迭代次数为0、1、2或大于2时的概率百分比。随着代码距离的增加，需要更多额外迭代次数的概率逐渐降低，表明较小的代码距离通常需要较少的额外迭代来达到收敛。

image_title: 不同解码器在混合边界表面码上的解码性能
description: 该图展示了MWPM解码器和IRMWPM解码器在混合边界表面码上的逻辑错误率随量子比特错误率变化的曲线。图中包含三条曲线，分别对应不同的代码距离（d=8、d=17、d=26）。逻辑错误率随着量子比特错误率的增加而上升，但IRMWPM解码器相较于MWPM解码器表现出更低的逻辑错误率，表明其性能更优。

image_title: 不同解码器在带洞表面码上的解码性能
description: 该图展示了MWPM解码器和IRMWPM解码器在带洞表面码上的逻辑错误率随量子比特错误率变化的性能。图中，蓝色圆点表示MWPM解码器的结果，红色方块表示IRMWPM解码器的结果。横轴为量子比特错误率，纵轴为逻辑错误率（对数尺度）。随着量子比特错误率的增加，两种解码器的逻辑错误率均上升，但IRMWPM解码器的表现优于MWPM解码器，特别是在较高的量子比特错误率下，显示出更高的阈值性能。

image_title: 不同代码距离下表面码的逻辑错误率与量子比特错误率的关系

image_title: Barren Plateau Phenomenon in Quantum Neural Networks
description: The image illustrates the barren plateau phenomenon in quantum neural networks (QNNs) under two settings: (a) noise-free and (b) noise-induced. In part (a), as the number of qubits increases, the loss landscape becomes flatter, leading to vanishing gradients and making training difficult. In part (b), deeper circuits also result in a flattened loss landscape, exacerbating the problem. This visualization highlights how increasing qubit count or circuit depth can lead to challenges in training QNNs due to the barren plateau effect.

image_title: Hybrid Quantum-Classical ML Model Architecture
description: This image illustrates the architecture of a hybrid quantum-classical machine learning model. The inputs are first processed through a fully connected classical multi-layered perceptron (MLP). The outputs from the classical MLP are then fed into the embedding layer of a quantum circuit. Depending on the specific setting, some measurements from this quantum circuit are taken and passed into another fully connected classical layer. The output of this final layer can be compared with the label for training or evaluation purposes. This architecture combines the strengths of both classical and quantum computing to potentially offer computational speed and improved solution quality.

image_title: Hybrid Quantum-Classical Neural Network Architecture
description: This image illustrates a hybrid quantum-classical neural network architecture. The inputs are first processed through a fully connected classical multi-layered perceptron (MLP). The outputs of the classical MLP are then fed into the embedding of a quantum circuit, represented by quantum gates labeled as $U^1(\theta)$, $S(x)$, and $U^2(\theta)$. Measurements from the quantum circuit are taken and passed into another fully connected classical layer. The final output can be compared with the label for training or evaluation. This architecture combines the strengths of classical and quantum computing to potentially offer computational speed and improved solution quality, especially in high-dimensional data scenarios.

image_title: Max Cut Problem Graph
description: This image illustrates a graph used to represent the max cut problem. The vertices of the graph are partitioned into two sets, and the goal is to maximize the number of edges that connect vertices from one set to the other. This abstract representation helps in visualizing how the max cut problem seeks to divide the graph's vertices optimally.

description: The image depicts the max cut problem in graph theory. It shows a general graph on the left with vertices connected by edges. The goal is to partition the vertices into two sets such that the number of edges connecting the two sets (the cut) is maximized. On the right, the graph is divided into two subsets, represented by different shades of green, illustrating one possible solution to the max cut problem.

image_title: Machine Learning in Quantum Technologies
description: The image illustrates the application of machine learning across various domains in quantum technologies. It features a robot-like figure symbolizing artificial intelligence, with arrows pointing to different areas where machine learning is applied. These areas include fundamental and applied physics (with subcategories for quantum computing and quantum communication), random walks problems (specifically quantum walks with decoherence), quantum tomography, and photonic quantum computing. Each category is labeled with corresponding section numbers from the text, indicating its relevance within the broader discussion on how machine learning enhances quantum technologies.

image_title: Reinforcement Learning Algorithm for Designing Quantum Experiments
description: This image illustrates a reinforcement learning algorithm used to design quantum experiments. It is divided into two parts: (a) shows the interaction between an agent and an optical table environment, where the agent learns to place optical elements to achieve desired photonic states. The environment includes an analyzer that provides rewards based on the success of the setup. (b) depicts the projective simulation model as a two-layered network of clips, representing the current state of the optical setup and available actions (e.g., beam splitters, mirrors, holograms, Dove prisms). The connectives between layers define the memory and probabilities of actions in different states, allowing the agent to learn and prioritize actions over time.

image_title: 量子通信协议设计的强化学习算法
description: 该图展示了基于投影模拟（Projective Simulation）和分层组合记忆（ECM）的强化学习算法，用于设计长距离量子通信协议。算法根据量子通信环境的状态选择操作，以修改环境状态。图中列出了四个目标：(a) 量子隐形传态协议，(b) 纠缠纯化协议，(c) 量子中继器协议，以及 (d) 长距离量子通信中的量子中继器协议。

image_title: 量子通信协议设计的强化学习算法
description: 该图展示了基于投影模拟（Projective Simulation, PS）和分层组合记忆（Episodic and Compositional Memory, ECM）的强化学习算法，用于设计长距离量子通信协议。PS代理根据量子通信环境的状态选择动作，目标包括：(a) 量子隐形传态协议、(b) 纠缠纯化协议、(c) 量子中继器协议以及 (d) 长距离量子通信中的量子中继器协议。代理通过感知环境状态并基于项目模拟决策过程选择动作，以优化协议设计。

image_title: 随机行走图示意图
description: 该图片展示了两种不同类型的图结构，用于说明随机行走（包括经典和量子随机行走）的场景。图 (a) 是一个连通的随机图，图 (b) 是一个循环图。在每个图中，绿色节点表示初始节点 i，蓝色节点表示目标节点 t，红色节点表示吸收节点 s，γ 表示目标节点 t 和吸收节点 s 之间的耦合参数。这些图用于解释量子粒子与经典粒子在不同图结构上的传播行为，特别是量子粒子由于干涉现象会‘弥漫’到所有顶点，而吸收节点 s 的引入有助于定位量子粒子。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Quantum machine learning  from physics to software engineering - advances in physics-x_images/Quantum machine learning  from physics to software engineering - advances in physics-x-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000044_42cdc64de4e71e948f86a35974e2de20d72dd26281012fd221cfba70cd0b472e.png
image_title: CQCNN 架构示意图
description: 该图片展示了 CQCNN（卷积量子神经网络）的架构，用于预测量子行走（QW）在图上的加速效果。架构包括一个二维输入层，接收由邻接矩阵 A 表示的图作为输入。输入层连接到多个卷积层，这些卷积层使用特定的滤波器（如 '边到边' 和 '边到顶点' 滤波器）来提取图的特征，并降低输入维度。卷积层之后是全连接层，最终输出两个神经元，分别对应经典和量子两类。训练过程中，CQCNN 使用交叉熵损失函数进行优化，通过梯度下降算法学习如何区分经典和量子类别的图。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Quantum machine learning  from physics to software engineering - advances in physics-x_images/Quantum machine learning  from physics to software engineering - advances in physics-x-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000045_62e280e6d6fe8ed386e5a8b82d759a2cf0158081025e09781be99b37a57a7a3d.png
image_title: CQCNN架构及其训练与测试流程
description: 该图展示了混合量子经典卷积神经网络（CQCNN）的架构及其在预测量子优势中的应用。图分为三个部分：(a) 显示了CQCNN的结构，包括输入层、卷积层和全连接层，以及如何通过邻接矩阵处理标记图；(b) 描述了CQCNN的训练过程，其中使用图样本进行预测，并根据损失值进行反馈调整；(c) 展示了CQCNN的测试过程，评估其在预测量子优势时的准确性、精确度和召回率等指标。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Quantum machine learning  from physics to software engineering - advances in physics-x_images/Quantum machine learning  from physics to software engineering - advances in physics-x-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000047_158b8ed779d020c1effc749c7764cc287ac2f478c0b4503a7d1ece418a65442f.png
image_title: CQCNN Learning Performance and Correctly Classified Graphs
description: The image consists of three panels (a), (b), and (c). Panel (a) shows the learning performance of CQCNN for random graphs with varying numbers of vertices (n = 15, 20, 25). The performance metrics include recall and precision for both 'classical' and 'quantum' classes. Recall is represented by squares, and precision by circles. Panel (b) depicts a correctly classified graph from the test set where the classical particle is faster, marked with initial and target vertices in yellow and red, respectively. Panel (c) shows another correctly classified graph where the quantum particle is faster, also marked similarly. This figure illustrates the effectiveness of CQCNN in classifying random graphs based on their classical or quantum characteristics.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Quantum machine learning  from physics to software engineering - advances in physics-x_images/Quantum machine learning  from physics to software engineering - advances in physics-x-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000050_6b2fb23f84ab5728cad118233511827d94544fcfb71bb4486c029a19da954dd8.png
image_title: Machine Learning Enhanced Quantum State Tomography with CNN
description: This image illustrates the process of using a convolutional neural network (CNN) for enhanced quantum state tomography. The sequence begins with quadrature data obtained from quantum homodyne measurements, which are fed into multiple convolutional layers. Shortcuts and average pooling are incorporated in the architecture to address gradient vanishing issues and ensure equal weighting of all tomography data. After flattening and normalization, the predicted matrices are inverted to reconstruct the density matrices in truncation. This approach leverages the generalizability of CNNs to extract density matrices from time-series data efficiently, achieving high fidelity results suitable for applications like gravitational wave detectors and quantum photonic computing.

image_title: 量子机器学习生态系统示意图
description: 该图片展示了量子机器学习（QML）生态系统的概念图，强调了其在下一个十年中的重要性和应用前景。生态系统涉及量子计算、人工智能和机器学习的交叉领域，旨在通过量子技术突破经典信息处理的限制，实现高效的信息传输、处理和智能识别。图片可能包含多个组件，如量子算法、量子神经网络、量子测量和优化等，以及它们如何协同工作以推动量子实验的自动化和分布式智能系统的发展。

image_title: 量子机器学习的生态系统示意图
description: 该图片展示了量子机器学习（QML）生态系统的当前发展状态及其未来十年的需求。图中强调了量子计算与人工智能方法之间的相互作用，特别是在NISQ时代量子计算机的有限能力下，使用各种变分算法（如变分特征解算器和量子近似优化算法）。此外，图片还涉及量子神经网络（QNN）的概念，这些模型的参数通过经典方式更新，并可用于量子-经典训练算法中的变分电路。整体上，图片突出了量子-经典混合信息处理方法，结合了经典机器学习算法和量子设备，以实现更高效的随机游走加速等应用。

image_title: 量子随机游走示意图
description: 图片展示了一个简单的图形，可能代表一个量子随机游走的示例。图中包含一个圆形和一个箭头，暗示了在特定图结构上的移动或状态变化过程，这与上下文中讨论的量子-经典混合计算、卷积神经网络以及随机游走加速相关。

image_title: 量子机器学习中的符号表示
description: 图片展示了一个包含数学或物理符号的图标，可能与量子机器学习相关。图标中包含一个类似积分符号的图形，暗示了在量子计算或量子算法中的数学运算或概念。

image_title: CsV₃Sb₅的晶格结构与能量景观
description: 该图片展示了CsV₃Sb₅在不同状态下的原子结构和能量景观。图(a)显示了CsV₃Sb₅的原始晶胞，其中Cs、Sb和V原子分别用绿色、棕色和红色表示，并标注了晶胞的坐标轴方向。图(b)描绘了CsV₃Sb₅的能量景观，包括原始结构（Pristine）和电荷密度波（CDW）结构的能量分布，以及它们之间的过渡态（CDW'）。图(c)展示了典型的声子软化行为，随着温度降低到CDW相变温度T_CDW以下，特定声子模式的频率逐渐变为虚数，但在CsV₃Sb₅中并未观察到这种现象。图(d)和(e)分别展示了原始结构和CDW结构的二维顶视图，其中V原子形成Kagome晶格，周围被Sb原子包围，而Cs原子位于V-Sb层之间。

image_title: CsV3Sb5的自由能景观演化与CDW结构能量层级
description: 该图展示了CsV3Sb5在不同温度下的自由能景观演化以及各种可能的电荷密度波（CDW）结构的能量层级。具体包括：(a) 温度高于CDW相变温度（T > T_CDW）时，原始结构为全局能量最低点；(b) 接近相变温度（T ≈ T_CDW）时，低对称性的CDW结构开始出现，其自由能与原始结构相当；(c) 温度低于相变温度（T < T_CDW）时，多种CDW结构成为局部能量最低点，其中2××2 TrH结构最为稳定。图(d)、(e) 和 (f) 分别展示了原始结构和两种典型的CDW结构。图(g) 列出了不同CDW结构相对于原始结构的能量差，单位为meV/公式单元（meV/f.u.），并表明2××2 TrH结构是最稳定的结构，具有稳定的声子色散。

image_title: 不同材料的声子色散与零点运动分析
description: 该图片展示了两种材料（NbSe₂ 和 CsV₃Sb₅）在考虑和不考虑零点运动情况下的声子色散曲线，以及它们的零点运动集合的能量景观。图 (a) 和 (b) 分别显示了 NbSe₂ 和 CsV₃Sb₅ 的声子频率随波矢的变化，其中蓝色曲线代表未考虑零点运动的情况，红色曲线代表考虑零点运动的情况。图 (c) 和 (d) 则分别描绘了 NbSe₂ 和 CsV₃Sb₅ 的零点运动集合的能量分布，横轴表示相对于原始结构的距离，纵轴表示能量或集合计数。这些结果表明，在考虑零点运动后，CsV₃Sb₅ 的声子色散表现出动态稳定性，而 NbSe₂ 在某些区域出现虚频，显示出声子软化现象。

image_title: CsV3Sb5中不同温度下的相干声子谱
description: 该图片展示了CsV3Sb5材料在不同温度下，三种主要声子模式（γ、β、α）的频率和线宽变化。图(a)列出了不同结构（2××21 TrH、2××22 TrH 和 pristine）对应的声子模式频率。图(b)是相干声子谱，显示了频率随温度的变化，其中蓝色区域表示声子强度分布。图(c)、(d) 和 (e) 分别描绘了γ、β 和 α 模式的全宽半最大值（FWHM）与温度的关系，揭示了低温下线宽饱和的趋势，这可能与量子涨落引起的能量势垒模糊化有关。

image_title: 双势阱势能的谐振子与有效谐振子近似
description: 该图展示了在固体状态下的双势阱势能（DWP）的谐振子和有效谐振子近似。蓝色实线表示一个强非谐性的、对称的双势阱势能，红色实线表示基于SCHA和SCP理论的有效谐振子势能。对应的最低能量本征态分别用蓝色虚线和红色虚线表示。实际势能中的谐振子项由黑色实线表示。此图用于说明如何通过有效谐振子模型近似描述非谐性势能，并分析其低能态的特征。

image_title: 双势阱中最低的20个非谐态
description: 该图展示了对称和不对称双势阱（DWP）中最低的20个非谐态的分析。图A和C分别显示了对称和不对称DWP的20个最低非谐态的振动能级以及对应波函数的平方模，其中对称DWP的参数为a = -30和c = 5，不对称DWP的参数为a = -30、b = 10和c = 10。图B和D则展示了这些非谐态能量随基函数数量M的变化情况，通过计算log10[|Es(M) - Es(M→∞)|]来评估收敛性。观察到随着M增加，计算的非谐态能量逐渐收敛，且低能态比高能态收敛更快；对称势阱的收敛速度也快于不对称势阱。

image_title: Thiourea Phase Transitions and Spectral Analysis
description:
This image presents a comprehensive analysis of the crystal structure, vibrational properties, and infrared spectra of thiourea in both ferroelectric (P2_1ma) and paraelectric (Pnma) phases. The figure is divided into multiple panels:
- **Panel A**: Crystal structure of the low-temperature ferroelectric P2_1ma phase viewed down the b-axis.
- **Panel B**: Crystal structure of the high-temperature paraelectric Pnma phase viewed down the b-axis.
- **Panel C**: Double-well potential (DWP) derived from DFT calculations for the Pnma phase, along with solutions to the associated nuclear Schrödinger equation. Arrows indicate active infrared transitions at different temperatures (0 K, 200 K, 250 K, 300 K), with intensities proportional to their thickness.
- **Panel D**: Simulated infrared spectrum of the paraelectric phase at four temperatures (0 K, 200 K, 250 K, 300 K), showing broadening and peak shifts as temperature increases.
- **Panel E**: Infrared spectrum of the low-temperature ferroelectric phase (78 K) compared with a harmonic approximation (HA) simulation.
- **Panel F**: Infrared spectrum of the high-temperature paraelectric phase at three temperatures (200 K, 250 K, 300 K), comparing experimental data with HA and anharmonic simulations. The anharmonic simulation matches well with the experimental data, highlighting the role of 'hot bands' in spectral broadening.

image_title: Hybrid Quantum-Classical Optimization Loop
description: This diagram illustrates the optimization loop in hybrid quantum-classical variational algorithms. It shows the interaction between a classical computer and a quantum computer. The classical computer performs parameter optimization, sending new parameters to the quantum computer. The quantum computer executes a parameterized circuit and evaluates the cost function, which is then fed back to the classical computer for further optimization. This iterative process continues until optimal parameters are found.

image_title: Intel Quantum Computing Stack Layered Architecture
description: This image illustrates the layered architecture of the Intel Quantum Computing stack, showcasing a modular design with well-defined interfaces between each layer. The stack includes an LLVM-based quantum compiler toolchain, quantum runtime, qubit control processor, control electronics, and qubit devices (such as a quantum dot qubit chip or simulator). The application is represented as a hybrid quantum-classical unified C++ source file, which is compiled and executed through this layered system. The modular design allows for flexibility and extensibility, enabling support for multiple components in each layer and easy replacement of any component in the future.

image_title: Intel量子编译器工具链的混合编译工作流
description: 该图展示了Intel量子编译器工具链如何处理混合量子-经典应用程序的编译过程。输入是一个包含经典函数和量子内核的单一C++源文件，通过编译器驱动程序进行处理。量子逻辑从统一的源代码中提取，并传递给量子设备编译器进行分析和优化，生成一个集成头文件，提供量子内核信息（如函数名、符号、函数长度和宏指令）供运行时库使用。经典主机编译器接收量子集成头文件，将量子逻辑与经典逻辑合并，并链接到量子运行时库。最终生成一个包含所有必要信息的ELFQ格式可执行二进制文件，用于运行混合量子-经典应用程序。

image_title: Hybrid Execution Flow Between Host CPU and Quantum Device
description: This diagram illustrates the execution flow for running hybrid quantum-classical applications with dynamic parameters. The process begins with the host CPU generating initial parameters in a quantum basic block (QBB) and issuing it to the quantum device. The quantum device executes the QBB, and the host CPU waits in a loop until the execution is complete. After receiving the results, the host CPU updates the dynamic parameters and issues the next QBB to the quantum device. This cycle continues iteratively, with the host CPU updating parameters and the quantum device executing QBBs, until the final results are computed by the host CPU. The timeline shows the alternating phases of classical processing on the CPU and quantum execution on the quantum device.

image_title: 动态参数更新流程图
description: 该图片展示了在运行时动态更新量子指令参数的流程。经典程序（位于左上角）在执行过程中计算动态参数的值，并通过一个数组将这些值传递给QRT库。QRT库拦截使用动态参数的指令，并向量子设备发出带有显式参数值的指令。这种机制避免了在每次迭代中重新编译整个电路，从而显著提高了性能。

image_title: Quantum Device Compilation Workflow
description: This diagram illustrates the workflow for compiling a hybrid quantum-classical program using an LLVM-based compiler toolchain. The process begins with a source file containing both classical and quantum logic (.cpp). The frontend translates this source code into an intermediate representation (IR). Subsequent steps include extracting quantum-specific logic, optimizing the quantum instructions, generating machine code through the backend (CodeGen), and producing an integration header file (.h) that can be merged back into the classical code. This workflow ensures efficient compilation and execution of variational hybrid quantum-classical algorithms.

image_title: Quantum Runtime Interaction Diagram
description: This diagram illustrates the interaction between a classical computer and a quantum compute system managed by the Quantum Runtime (QRT). The classical computer executes a binary executable in ELFQ format, which interacts with the QRT to initialize, schedule quantum kernels, and measure results from the quantum compute. The flow shows how the classical compute communicates with the quantum runtime to execute quantum operations.

image_title: TFD State Generation Quantum Circuit
description: This image depicts a quantum circuit for the generation of thermofield double (TFD) states. The circuit is divided into six stages: (I) preparing infinite temperature TFD state, (II) Intra-system RX operation with angle γ1, (III) Intra-system ZZ operation with angle γ2, (IV) Inter-system XX operation with angle α1, (V) Inter-system ZZ operation with angle α2, and (VI) multi-qubit measurements to verify TFD generation. The subsystems A and B each contain L qubits, and the circuit includes various quantum gates such as Pauli X, Z, and controlled operations to achieve the desired entanglement and mixture between the two subsystems.

image_title: 不同量子比特数下的热态精度
description: 该图展示了在不同量子比特数（4Q、6Q、8Q、10Q、12Q、14Q、16Q）下，生成的热态与理想热态之间的精度随逆温度 β 的变化。横轴表示逆温度 β（即 T 的倒数），纵轴表示热态精度。随着量子比特数的增加，热态精度的变化趋势有所不同，特别是在低温度区域（高 β 值）。图中使用了不同的颜色和标记来区分不同量子比特数的结果，显示了系统规模对热态生成精度的影响。
