url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_b61c8b759132c59ed4e1d7cfcb790eac99fb8584698a93d4082fa89c4fd5fd7f.png
image_title: 实验验证的变差距离（VD）上限
description: 该图展示了在不同量子比特数量下，使用 Accreditation Protocol (AP) 对 GHZ 和 QFT 电路的输出进行实验验证时，变差距离（VD）的上限。图中横轴表示量子比特的数量，纵轴表示 VD 的上限值。GHZ 电路的结果标记为蓝色圆点，QFT 电路的结果标记为橙色菱形点。每个数据点上方的数字表示目标电路的深度。GHZ 电路的数据来自 ibmq johannesburg，而 QFT 电路的数据来自 ibmq paris。误差棒表示估计的置信水平超过 95%，具体参数设置为 θ = 13% 和 α = 95%（对于 GHZ 电路），以及 θ = 9% 和 α = 95%（对于 QFT 电路）。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_7856432ade04b79a22c3e160752fb3379416e7e280f77b97067c08f208219259.png
image_title: 六量子比特随机电路的变差距离实验结果
description: 该图展示了在巴黎量子计算机上运行的六量子比特随机电路的变差距离（VD）随电路深度变化的实验结果。横轴表示电路深度，纵轴表示变差距离。每个数据点代表不同深度的电路的变差距离估计值，误差棒表示置信区间。图中显示了随着电路深度增加，变差距离的变化趋势，反映了噪声对量子计算输出的影响。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_46bc4036dd63e7c8f78152990ae46fdc50745519bbd1c1f371b113ae6930a666.png
image_title: 量子电路结构示意图
description: 该图片展示了量子电路的结构，包括多个量子比特（qubits）和一系列量子门操作。图中显示了六个量子比特（标记为 |0⟩ 到 |6⟩），每个量子比特上执行了一系列一维量子门（U_{i,j}），其中 i 表示量子比特编号，j 表示门的顺序。此外，图中还包含控制-Z (cZ) 门，用于实现量子比特之间的相互作用。这种结构是实验中用于生成 Greenberger-Horne-Zeilinger (GHZ) 状态或执行量子傅里叶变换 (QFT) 的典型电路布局。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_68460043a66b716849a6c87c255d6bedfebb7aee57894f0c4dfba590008802c7.png
image_title: Trap Circuit for GHZ and QFT Circuits
description: This image illustrates a trap circuit designed to accompany the target circuits used in the experimental accreditation protocol. The trap circuit is obtained by replacing one-qubit gates in the target circuit with one-qubit Clifford gates, ensuring that neighboring cycles of one-qubit gates can be recompiled into a single cycle. This results in a trap circuit with the same depth as the target circuit. The specific structure shown here corresponds to the trap circuit for GHZ and QFT circuits, which are important primitives in quantum computation.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_92b4426502eea58d964fbb05e4af7583495b472f97669427dbe79f195b2932cf.png
image_title: IBM Quantum Device Layout: ibmq-johannesburg
description: This image depicts the layout of the qubits on the IBM Quantum device named 'ibmq-johannesburg'. The qubits are arranged in a grid-like structure, with each qubit labeled by a number from 0 to 19. The connections between qubits indicate which pairs can interact via two-qubit gates (e.g., cZ gates). This layout is crucial for understanding the connectivity and constraints when designing quantum circuits for execution on this specific quantum computer.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_d237111938fbf5f2ea07d9c733faca9d3d07a16887c35980b3c5d3c535c21da4.png
image_title: IBM Quantum Device Connectivity: ibmq_paris
description: This image depicts the connectivity graph of the IBM Quantum device named 'ibmq_paris'. The nodes represent qubits, and the edges indicate which qubits are connected to each other. This connectivity map is crucial for understanding the physical layout of the quantum processor and how qubits interact during circuit execution.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000006_37a4813425bc1248b4da0fb976be0a78efc68b6c0771bd382035c3963d079043.png
image_title: 最大GHZ电路示意图
description: 该图片展示了一个量子电路，具体为一个生成最大GHZ态的电路。电路包含多个量子比特（qubits），每个量子比特上都应用了Hadamard门（H），并在某些比特对之间应用了受控-Z门（cZ）。该电路设计用于生成多量子比特的GHZ态，其中所有量子比特处于纠缠状态。图中标注了各个量子比特的位置，并展示了门操作的顺序和连接关系。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000007_84eccc8c4a3f1f8a7e70656525337558ded9f019c9ba4e0c80df054b93ff23db.png
image_title: 量子傅里叶变换电路示例
description: 该图片展示了量子傅里叶变换（QFT）电路的实例，其中包含多个量子比特（qubits），每个量子比特从初始状态 |0⟩ 开始，经过一系列量子门操作。具体地，图中显示了四个量子比特（标记为 qubit_4、qubit_7、qubit_10 和 qubit_12），它们分别通过 Hadamard (H) 门和不同角度的旋转门（如 π/2、π/4 和 π/8）进行初始化和操作。此外，电路中还包含了控制操作和测量门（Z），用于实现 QFT 的功能。此电路是上下文中提到的最大规模的 QFT 示例，用于说明量子计算中的特定算法结构。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000008_21d4c2867117cd2559e088376ea6f520fbace3a4a0eced35f14d5d42b9124560.png
image_title: 量子电路的六量子比特深度九伪随机电路
description: 该图片展示了一个六量子比特的深度为九的伪随机量子电路。电路由多个量子门组成，包括单量子比特门和双量子比特门（如cZ门）。每个量子比特通过一系列交替的单量子比特门和双量子比特门操作，最终在Pauli-Z基下进行测量。此电路设计用于实验中验证噪声量子计算机输出的准确性，特别是针对生成六量子比特GHZ态的目标电路。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000009_053e1ed9d973f08404746dcdce7418c35c51e9736f1de5ab75eeff8a583627f9.png
image_title: 实验中不同任务的 VD 和 p_inc 值
description: 该图展示了在不同任务（Job）中，量子电路输出的验证度量（VD，红色点）和错误率指标（p_inc，蓝色点）的变化。每个任务包含450个陷阱电路和450个目标电路实例。图中的误差棒表示置信水平超过95%的范围，具体设置为 θ/2 = 6.5% 和 α ≥ 95%。VD 表示理想分布与实验分布之间的差异，而 p_inc 则是返回错误输出的陷阱电路的比例。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000010_5723e45b1e7c5341ba3a4c5611163db30299d462c385f115277a4189530ca7cc.png
image_title: 量子电路示意图：六量子比特GHZ态的制备与测量
description: 该图片展示了一个量子电路，用于制备和测量六量子比特的GHZ态。电路中包含多个一量子比特门（如Hadamard门H、S门及其共轭转置）以及两量子比特门（如cZ门）。红色高亮部分表示在实验中检测到的错误模式，具体为单周期错误影响单一量子比特的情况。此图有助于理解如何通过陷阱电路检测特定类型的量子计算错误，并评估其对目标电路输出的影响。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers_images/experimental accreditation of outputs of noisy quantum computers-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000011_dfef446417f036a0e7b36ed0b0c095aca0f28e731d235a551fb225e70ac98ce5.png
image_title: 多周期错误模式的陷阱电路示例
description: 该图片展示了受多周期错误影响的陷阱电路。电路中的某些门和测量操作被高亮显示为红色，表示它们是错误的来源。这种多周期错误模式在量子计算中可能导致特定类型的噪声，其检测概率大于50%。图片中的电路结构包括多个量子比特（qubits）和各种量子门（如Hadamard门、S门及其逆门），以及Z测量门。这些电路设计用于检测和分析量子计算机中的噪声源，特别是在涉及多个量子比特和复杂操作序列的情况下。

image_title: Universidad Politécnica de Madrid Logo
description: The logo of the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid, featuring a circular emblem with text and symbols representing the institution. The emblem includes a sun, a book, and other decorative elements, symbolizing knowledge and education. Below the emblem, the word 'POLITÉCNICA' is prominently displayed.

image_title: 句子语法结构图示：'Mary likes words.'
description: 该图片展示了一个简单的句子语法结构图示，句子为 'Mary likes words.'。图中使用了符号表示法来描述句子的语法类型。具体来说，'Mary' 和 'words' 被标记为名词（N），而 'likes' 被标记为名词-动词-名词（NSN）结构，这反映了句子的基本语法构成。这种表示方法有助于理解句子的语义组合和结构分析。

image_title: 句子结构与最近邻问题的转换示例
description: 该图片展示了如何将一个句子的结构（如 'kids play football'）转化为一个等价的最近邻问题。左侧部分表示原始句子的语法结构，其中 'play' 是谓语动词，连接名词 'kids' 和 'football'。右侧部分则展示了通过改写，将原问题转化为寻找 'play' 在 {'sports', 'politics'} 中的最近邻，从而简化了计算过程。这体现了在量子自然语言处理中，如何利用语法结构和词汇关系来优化算法效率。

image_title: 数据编码到量子寄存器的详细步骤
description: 该图片展示了将数据编码到量子寄存器（qubit register）的详细过程。图中列出了从初始状态到最终编码模式的多个步骤，包括初始状态 |ψ₀⟩、编码模式 |ψ₁⟩、以及通过一系列量子门操作（如CX和CS门）逐步构建的中间态 |ψ₂⟩、|ψ₃⟩、|ψ₄⟩、|ψ₅⟩、|ψ₆⟩ 和 |ψ₇⟩。每个步骤都对应于特定的量子态变换，最终目标是将数据以特定的方式编码到量子寄存器中，以便进行后续的量子计算或处理。

image_title: Hamming Distance Distribution for Sentences
description: This image illustrates the probability distribution of outcomes for different sentences, represented as bitstrings, in a quantum natural language processing (QNLP) context. The x-axis lists various sentences encoded as bitstrings, while the y-axis shows the outcome probabilities. Three categories are highlighted: 'meaning space' (blue), 'encoding ADULT_STAND_INSIDE' (orange), and 'encoding CHILD_MOVE_INSIDE' (green). Each category's bars indicate the likelihood of measuring specific states, with higher bars suggesting closer matches to the target sentence. This visualization helps identify the closest sentence within the dataset based on Hamming distance, demonstrating how quantum superposition and measurement can be used to compare sentences in QNLP.

image_title: Quantum Circuit for Encoding Syntactic Relations
description: This image depicts a quantum circuit designed to encode syntactic relations in natural language processing. The circuit includes quantum gates such as the Hadamard gate (H) and controlled operations, with specific parameters like 'sqrt(2)' indicating scaling factors. The circuit structure suggests it is used to represent linguistic structures, potentially focusing on intransitive verbs or similar syntactic elements. The presence of measurement gates indicates that the output of the circuit can be interpreted to reflect syntactic relationships.

image_title: Quantum Circuit for Encoding Syntactic Relations
description: This image depicts a quantum circuit designed to encode syntactic relations in natural language processing. The circuit includes a Hadamard gate (H) applied to one qubit and an Rx gate with a phase of 0.5 applied to another qubit. The circuit structure suggests it is used to represent linguistic structures, such as intransitive verbs, within the DisCoCat framework. The presence of controlled operations indicates the encoding of relationships between elements in the sentence.

image_title: 量子电路表示无宾语动词的语法关系
description: 该图片展示了一个简单的量子电路，用于表示一个无宾语动词（如 'is rich'）的语法关系。电路包含一个唯一的输出，其中包含一个 Rx 门，其相位设置为 0.5。这个电路设计用于编码特定的语法结构，体现了量子自然语言处理中如何使用量子电路来表示和处理句子的语法成分。

image_title: Quantum Circuit Encoding Syntactic Tree for 'Alice who loves Bob is rich'
description: This image depicts a quantum circuit designed to encode the syntactic structure of the sentence 'Alice who loves Bob is rich'. The circuit includes various quantum gates and qubit operations, illustrating how the syntactic relationships between words are represented in a quantum computing framework. The circuit is structured to reflect the hierarchical nature of the sentence's grammar, with specific gates and connections corresponding to the pregroup types and their interactions.

image_title: 量子自然语言处理中的成本函数收敛图
description: 该图展示了在不同参数设置下，使用SPSA（Simultaneous Perturbation Stochastic Approximation）迭代优化算法时，成本函数L(θ)的演变情况。具体而言，图中显示了在不同量子处理器（如montreal和toronto）以及模拟器（sim）上，随着SPSA迭代次数的增加，成本函数逐渐收敛至接近0的趋势。图例中分别标注了不同的qubit分配（qn）和电路深度（d）的组合，例如：montreal处理器在qn=1、d=2时的成本函数曲线，以及toronto处理器在qn=1、d=3时的成本函数曲线。这些结果表明，通过增加电路深度或调整qubit分配，可以有效降低成本函数，从而提高模型的性能。

image_title: SPSA 迭代次数与损失函数 L(θ) 的演变
description: 该图展示了在不同深度 d 的量子电路下，使用 SPSA（Simultaneous Perturbation Stochastic Approximation）优化算法时，损失函数 L(θ) 随迭代次数的变化情况。上图显示了当预组类型 n 被分配 1 个量子比特时，损失函数随 SPSA 迭代次数的演变；下图则展示了当预组类型 n 被分配 2 个量子比特时的情况。随着迭代次数的增加，损失函数逐渐收敛到较低值，表明模型在优化过程中逐步改进。此外，图中还标注了不同深度 d 下的最终损失值，以及对应的 ⟨ε_u⟩ 和 ⟨ε_w⟩ 值，用于评估模型的性能和稳定性。

image_title: 语法树示例：'dogs chase cats and don't purr'
description: 该图片展示了一个语法树，用于表示句子 'dogs chase cats and don't purr' 的结构。语法树中的节点分别对应句子中的单词，包括名词（dogs, cats）、动词（chase, purr）以及逻辑连接词（and, don't）。这棵树展示了如何通过上下文自由语法（CFG）将逻辑连接词纳入句法分析中，为后续的量子自然语言处理模型提供基础。

image_title: 量子电路示意图
description: 该图片展示了一个复杂的量子电路图，包含多个量子门和量子比特的连接。电路中使用了多种量子操作符，如Hadamard门（H）、CNOT门（控制非门）以及其他自定义门（标记为R）。电路结构复杂，涉及多个量子比特的交互，可能用于模拟或处理特定的量子计算任务。

image_title: 分子属性预测的机器学习方法概述
description: 该图展示了从分子数据集预测分子属性的任务及其两种实现方法。a部分说明了任务流程：通过预处理QM9数据库中的分子数据，提取分子的Coulomb矩阵并计算其特征值（eigenspectrum），作为预测分子属性的特征映射。b部分对比了传统解析方法和机器学习方法：上半部分表示传统的量子化学方法，依赖于近似求解薛定谔方程，通常耗时较长；下半部分展示了提出的基于光子芯片的机器学习方法，通过选择分子表示中的合适输入，神经网络能够快速预测分子属性，如焓、自由能和内能。这种方法利用光子芯片进行训练和预测，证明了光子芯片在准确性和效率方面的潜力。

image_title: Molecular Property Prediction Using Photonic Chip-Based Machine Learning
description: This image illustrates the process of predicting molecular properties using a photonic chip-based machine learning approach. It shows how molecular eigenspectrums, obtained from pre-processing datasets like QM9, are used as feature maps for prediction. The diagram highlights two methods: the traditional quantum chemistry method (upper portion) and the proposed machine learning method on a photonic chip (lower portion). The latter uses neural networks to predict molecular properties by finding complex relationships between chosen inputs, demonstrating faster computation compared to traditional methods.

image_title: Optical Neural Network Chip Architecture for Molecular Property Prediction
description: This image illustrates the architecture and processing flow of an interferometer-based optical neural network chip designed for predicting molecular properties. The diagram includes five key components: (i) a molecular representation, (ii) the unsorted Coulomb matrix of the molecule, (iii) the eigenspectrum computed from the Coulomb matrix, (iv) a 2-by-2 optical gate (the fundamental component of the optical neural network chip), and (v) the output of the optical neural network used to predict molecular properties such as enthalpy, free energy, and internal energy. The chip processes input molecular data by encoding it into optical signals and manipulating them through a series of Mach-Zehnder interferometers to implement complex-valued transformations.

image_title: 光学神经芯片的封装与微结构
description: 该图片展示了光学神经芯片的封装和内部微结构。左侧（b）部分显示了芯片的封装细节，包括电路板上的焊点和连接区域，尺寸标注为1 mm。右侧（c）部分是芯片内部的微结构图，展示了波导网络和集成加热器的布局，所有三层结构（输入层、可训练变换矩阵层和输出层）都集成在单个芯片上。芯片包含8条波导和56个相位调制器（PS），用于处理多达8个复数输入或16个实数输入。这些相位调制器通过集成的钛氮化物（TiN）加热器进行热调控，实现对光信号的幅度和相位的精确控制。

image_title: 光子神经网络芯片的架构与功能分解
description: 该图片展示了光子神经网络芯片的分层结构及其功能模块。图中分为三个主要部分：编码层、计算层和输出层。编码层负责将输入信号通过一系列MZI（马赫-曾德尔干涉仪）进行相位和幅度调制，从而将输入数据编码到光波导中。计算层由多个MZI组成，用于实现可训练的变换矩阵，执行复杂的光学操作以处理输入数据。输出层包含光子探测器，用于检测每个输出波导中的光强度，从而实现非线性激活函数。整体设计体现了光子神经网络在分子属性预测中的应用，包括焓、自由能和内能等参数的预测。

image_title: 训练过程中成本函数值的演变
description: 该图展示了在训练过程中，随着迭代次数的增加，成本函数值的变化情况。横轴表示训练迭代次数（即遗传算法中的世代数），纵轴表示成本函数值。图中显示了平均成本函数值随迭代次数的变化趋势，表明模型在训练过程中逐渐优化，成本函数值从初始较高值迅速下降，并在后续迭代中趋于稳定，接近最优解。

image_title: 遗传算法训练过程的可视化
description: 该图展示了基于遗传算法的光子芯片训练过程。x轴表示训练迭代次数（即遗传算法中的代数），y轴表示每一代中的个体数量。图中不同颜色代表不同的成本函数值，蓝色表示较小的成本值，黄色表示较大的成本值。图中可以看到随着训练迭代的增加，个体的成本函数值逐渐优化，反映了芯片配置性能的进化过程。

image_title: 训练过程中最佳成本函数值的变化
description: 该图展示了在训练迭代过程中，最佳成本函数值的演变情况。横轴表示训练迭代次数（即遗传算法中的世代数），纵轴表示成本函数值。图中显示，随着训练迭代的进行，最佳成本函数值逐渐下降并趋于稳定，表明模型在优化过程中逐步收敛。

image_title: 训练与测试样本的回归曲线
description: 该图展示了在训练和测试样本上，经过训练的模型的回归性能。蓝色数据点代表100个训练实例，橙色数据点代表30个测试实例。训练集上的R²得分为0.9411，测试集上的R²得分为0.9325，表明模型具有良好的拟合度和泛化能力。图中还包含了一条对角线（y=x），用于比较理论结果与实验结果的一致性。

image_title: 光子芯片多任务学习的实验结果
description: 该图片展示了使用光子芯片进行分子属性预测的多任务学习实验结果。图a展示了单个多任务模型与三个独立的单任务模型在光子芯片上的等效性，涉及焓、自由能和内能三种热力学属性。图b、c、d分别显示了焓、自由能和内能的回归曲线，理论结果与实验结果之间的良好相关性通过R²值（训练集和测试集）进行了量化。图e可视化了训练过程，显示了成本函数随训练迭代次数的变化趋势，以及个体参数集合的收敛情况。图f提供了每轮训练中参数集合的五数总结（最小值、第一四分位数、中位数、第三四分位数和最大值），进一步说明了成本函数值的收敛性和个体变化的稳定性。

image_title: 不同特征值数量对焓预测RMSE的影响
description: 该图展示了在机器学习模型中使用不同数量的特征值时，焓预测的均方根误差（RMSE）的变化情况。横轴表示使用的特征值数量，纵轴表示RMSE值。随着特征值数量的增加，RMSE迅速下降，但在达到一定数量后趋于平稳，表明使用较少的特征值（如16个）即可捕获大部分系统细节，而进一步增加特征值对结果的改善不显著。

image_title: RMSE vs Number of Eigenvalues for Internal Energy Prediction
description: This graph illustrates the relationship between the number of eigenvalues used in machine learning and the Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) for predicting internal energy. The x-axis represents the number of eigenvalues used, while the y-axis shows the RMSE values. The plot demonstrates that as the number of eigenvalues increases, the RMSE initially decreases sharply but then stabilizes, indicating that using more than a certain number of eigenvalues does not significantly improve prediction accuracy.

image_title: RMSE vs Number of Eigenvalues Used for Free Energy Prediction
description: This graph illustrates the relationship between the Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) and the number of eigenvalues used in a machine learning model for predicting free energy. The x-axis represents the number of eigenvalues used, ranging from 0 to 30, while the y-axis shows the RMSE values. The plot demonstrates that as the number of eigenvalues increases, the RMSE initially decreases sharply but then levels off, indicating diminishing returns beyond a certain point. This suggests that using more than 16 eigenvalues does not significantly improve the model's performance, providing confidence in the accuracy achieved with the limited input capacity of the experimental chip.

image_title: Coherent vs. Intensity Detection in Optical Neural Networks
description: This image compares the architectures and performance of optical neural networks using coherent detection versus intensity detection for both triangle and rectangular structures. It illustrates the number of Mach-Zehnder Interferometers (MZIs), the number of measurements required, and the performance metrics such as Mean Absolute Error (MAE) and R². Coherent detection requires more MZIs and double the number of measurements but achieves better performance compared to intensity detection, which is simpler to implement experimentally.

image_title: FIG. S3: The fabrication process of the integrated silicon photonic chip
description: This image illustrates the step-by-step fabrication process of an integrated silicon photonic chip. It includes eight stages, starting from a Silicon-on-Insulator (SOI) wafer and progressing through various patterning, deposition, and etching steps to create waveguides, rib structures, and other components. Key steps include grating coupler patterning, hard mask deposition, waveguide patterning, rib patterning, cladding oxide deposition with TiN heater patterning, top oxide deposition with via and metal contact patterning, and trench patterning with Al2O3 deposition. The diagram uses color-coded layers to represent different materials such as device Si, substrate Si, bottom SiO2, photoresist, hard mask SiO2, TiN, metal, and cladding SiO2.

image_title: Hybrid Neural Network Training Flow
description: This image illustrates the training flow of a hybrid neural network consisting of an optical chip layer and a digital readout layer. The forward propagation process involves passing input through the optical chip, which encodes molecular features into light intensities. The output from the optical chip is then processed by the digital readout layer to produce predictions (Ypredict). These predictions are compared against target values (Ytarget) using a cost function. The feedback training phase employs evolutionary optimization techniques, including mutation, crossover, and selection, to adjust the free parameters of both the optical chip's weight matrix and the readout layer, optimizing the network's performance.

image_title: MPS 线性分类器模型的张量网络图形表示
description: 该图展示了基于矩阵乘积态（MPS）的线性分类器模型，通过张量网络图形化表示。图中包含三个部分：(a) 显示了通过在 MPS 结构的一个键上引入标签张量 P 来构建线性模型 MPS 分类器；(b) 描述了 MPS 分类器波函数与测试波函数 |ψ_test⟩ 的重叠，定义了一个指示函数 f_ℓ(|ψ_test⟩)，用于优化分类性能；(c) 解释了线性 MPS 模型的作用，即将测试状态信息编码到键空间中，形成一个操作符 M(|ψ_test⟩)，然后使用指示张量进行分类，最终通过 argmax Tr(P^† M(|ψ_test⟩)) 实现分类。

image_title: 张量网络分类器架构图
description: 该图展示了用于量子数据分类的张量网络分类器架构。从左到右，操作顺序如下：首先，运算符 \hat{U}_R 从真空态开始，在 log_2 χ 维度的键量子比特上创建初始状态。接着，通过运算符 \hat{U}_G 将键状态与物理量子比特耦合，并丢弃和重置物理量子比特 N_b 次，从而生成一个可以解释为密度矩阵特征空间表示的键状态（通过追踪无限系统的一半获得）。然后，通过运算符 \hat{U}_D 将输入状态 |x⟩ 逐个量子比特地与键状态结合，并在每次应用后测量并重新初始化物理量子比特。最后，对受状态 |x⟩ 条件化的键自由度进行操作，使用运算符 \hat{U}_C，测量其中 log_2 N_C 个量子比特以定义预测类标签的二进制表示。此架构适用于任何存储在 L-量子比特寄存器中的输入状态，包括纠缠态。

image_title: 量子分类器的张量网络架构
description: 该图片展示了用于量子数据分类的张量网络架构，包括多个模块化组件和参数化的量子门序列。图中包含四个部分：(a) 展示了分类器的基本结构，由重复的 G、D 和 C 模块组成；(b) 描述了初始化和参数化量子门序列（如 \hat{U}_R、\hat{U}_G、\hat{U}_D 和 \hat{U}_C）的流程；(c) 细化了 \hat{U}_G 的具体实现，使用了多个参数化的旋转门 R_x 和 R_y；(d) 展示了带有优化参数 \theta_{opt} 的完整分类器架构，强调了不同模块的迭代应用和参数化过程。此架构适用于在量子计算机上对量子数据进行分类的任务。

image_title: 量子态分类的张量网络判别器架构
description: 该图展示了用于量子数据分类的张量网络判别器架构。上半部分表示判别器电路，使用了单位算符 \hat{U}_R、\hat{U}_G、\hat{U}_D 和 \hat{U}_C 来生成特征空间的半无限密度矩阵。下半部分表示测试状态生成器，使用单位算符 \hat{U}_{R'} 和 \hat{U}_{G'} 来生成测试状态的半无限密度矩阵。测试状态生成器逐个生成单个量子比特，并将其输入到判别器中以条件化其键寄存器，然后重置物理量子比特。在生成 L 个量子比特后，测试状态的键量子比特被丢弃，判别器的键量子比特被输入到分类器电路 \hat{U}_C 中，最终通过测量分类寄存器量子比特来定义预测的类标签。

image_title: 单次成功概率与键维数的依赖关系
description: 该图展示了在训练集上，不同键维数（χ = 2、4、8）对应的单次正确分类概率 P_SS 的直方图。随着键维数的增加，平均正确分类的概率也相应提高。图中显示了三个键维数下的分布情况，表明更高的键维数有助于提升模型的性能和单次执行时返回正确标签的概率。

image_title: 预测相位与横场强度的关系（产品态输入数据）
description: 该图展示了不同量子分类器和经典基准（随机森林，RF）在预测 PM 相态的概率时的表现。横轴表示横场强度 h，纵轴表示预测为 PM 相态的样本比例。图中显示了三种不同 bond dimension（χ = 2、4、8）的量子分类器以及随机森林分类器的结果。随着 bond dimension 的增加，分类器在预测 PM 相态方面的性能有所提升。此外，图中的插图聚焦于相变点附近（h = 1），表明所有分类器在确定相变点时都表现出较小的偏差，且均接近真实值，尽管它们是在远离相变点的数据上训练的。

image_title: 不同bond dimension下的PM类预测概率
description: 该图展示了在不同transverse field强度h下，使用不同bond dimension（χ）的张量网络分类器对输入数据进行分类时，预测为PM类的概率。横轴表示transverse field强度h，纵轴表示预测为PM类的概率。图中不同颜色和标记的曲线分别对应不同的bond dimension组合，例如χ=2, χi=4；χ=4, χi=4等。随着bond dimension的增加，分类器在单次运行中正确分类的概率也有所提高，表明更高的bond dimension有助于提升模型性能。

image_title: χ = 2 模型在纠缠数据上的性能
description: 该图展示了 χ = 2 的张量网络分类器在纠缠 iMPS 输入数据（χ_i = 4）上的预测结果。上图显示了实验结果的平均值（橙色三角形，来自 H1 机器）和无硬件噪声情况下的电路模拟结果（蓝色圆圈）。所有点对应于 100 次运行，误差棒为 90% Wilson 置信区间。下图是过渡点附近的放大视图，并包含线性回归模型，预测过渡点发生在 h = 0.962 处。

image_title: χ = 4 模型在纠缠数据上的性能
description: 该图展示了 χ = 4 的张量网络分类器在纠缠 iMPS 输入数据（χ_i = 4）上的预测结果。上半部分显示了实验结果的平均值（橙色三角形，对应于 Quantinuum H1 量子计算机上的实验数据）和无噪声模拟的结果（蓝色圆圈，对应于电路执行的模拟，未考虑硬件噪声）。所有点均基于 100 次运行，误差棒为 90% Wilson 置信区间。下半部分是对过渡点附近的放大视图，同时包含线性回归模型的拟合，预测在 h = 0.994 处发生相变。

image_title: χ = 4 模型在纠缠数据上的性能
description: 该图展示了 χ = 4 的张量网络分类器在纠缠 iMPS 输入数据（χ_i = 4）上的预测结果。上半部分显示了实验结果的平均值（橙色三角形，对应于 H1 机器上的实验数据）和无硬件噪声情况下的电路执行模拟结果（蓝色圆圈）。所有点均基于 100 次运行，误差棒为 90% Wilson 置信区间。下半部分是对过渡点的放大视图，并包含线性回归模型，预测在 h = 0.994 处发生过渡。

image_title: 不同模型在PM相中分类准确率随横向场变化
description:
该图展示了在PM相中，不同模型的分类准确率（以分数形式表示）随横向场 $ h $ 的变化情况。图中有三条曲线：
1. 实验线性回归（黑色虚线），代表实验数据的线性拟合。
2. 无噪声模拟（蓝色圆点），代表理想条件下（无硬件噪声）的模拟结果。
3. H1实验（橙色三角形），代表在Quantinuum的H1量子计算机上进行的实际实验结果。
每条曲线上的误差棒表示90%的Wilson置信区间，反映了由于有限次数的测量（shots）带来的不确定性。图中显示了随着横向场 $ h $ 的增加，分类准确率的变化趋势，以及实验与模拟结果之间的对比。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000000_20246ba5fdaa256408d720e9f38d1faf80ed7c87c310c575aefdd58324ebed68.png
image_title: Toric Code Ground State: Parity Values and Preparation Circuit
description: The image illustrates the toric code ground state, showing experimentally-measured parity values for a 31-qubit lattice. Part (A) displays the Z parity (blue tiles) and X parity (purple tiles) values on a standard toric code lattice, with qubits represented as circles. The mean parity is reported as 0.92 ± 0.06. Part (B) shows the quantum circuit used to prepare the ground state |G⟩, with Hadamard (H) and CNOT gates compiled into CZ gates, superimposed on the measured parity values after each step of the circuit.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000001_ae5400bbe08b2cc7e660dbe6315f540cf1e431f52690a30f457c4239c02d3d75.png
image_title: Topological Entanglement Entropy Measurements
description: This figure illustrates the measurement of topological entanglement entropy in a toric code system. Panel A shows schematic diagrams of subsystems (A, B, C) used to measure topological entanglement entropy on 4-, 6-, and 9-qubit systems within the toric code lattice. Panel B provides an illustration identifying the expected entanglement entropy for groups of qubits, with red perimeters around each group and counts of star operators crossed by the perimeter. Panel C displays experimental second Rényi entropy distributions measured on a 31-qubit toric code ground state, with histograms for different subsystem shapes (2×2, 2×3, 3×3). Panel D presents the computed topological entanglement entropy S_topo / ln 2 from the entropies in Panel C, showing mean values and standard deviations for different qubit arrays. The results provide evidence for the non-trivial topological nature of the state, closely approaching the ideal value of S_topo = -ln 2.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000002_82d39770510c6d6167a867cceb2abe0d431ebca53355835afbf2202215864d3f.png
image_title: Extracting Braiding Statistics Using Ramsey Interferometry
description: This image illustrates the process of extracting braiding statistics using Ramsey interferometry in a toric code system. It includes multiple panels demonstrating different aspects of the procedure: (A) Visualizing braiding with a toric code excited state, showing snapshots of experimentally-measured parity values for 'electric' (e) and 'magnetic' (m) excitations; (B) Quantum circuits with unitary operations and an eigenstate, highlighting the use of an auxiliary qubit to extract phases; (C) Illustration of Ramsey interferometry for braiding e and m excitations; (D) Extracting mutual statistics for e and m excitations using controlled Pauli strings; (E) Extracting exchange statistics for two identical ψ excitations; and (F) Measured mutual and exchange phases with braiding diagrams, showing the accumulated phase θ from tomography on the auxiliary qubit.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000003_546d65d484a5b1d56e4a7c353927831c76215290cd2fc2263b275b6714ce5f2c.png
image_title: Surface Code Logical Qubit States and Error Correction
description: This image illustrates the properties of surface code logical qubits, including their states, error correction mechanisms, and resilience to local errors. Panel A shows measured parity values for surface code logical qubit states on 5×5 and 3×3 qubit arrays, with logical operators Z_L and X_L spanning across each array. Panel B demonstrates logical measurement with error correction, where bitstrings are measured in the X or Z basis, and local parities are evaluated to detect and correct errors. Panel C presents experimental logical qubit tomography immediately after state injection, plotted in the Bloch sphere, showing ideal states lying on specific planes. Panel D compares raw and corrected logical measurements over time for different logical states, highlighting the effectiveness of error correction and dynamical decoupling techniques.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000004_e9e9823c91777c2ae253afca46530e95bee8f91aac4936d372df267e0b0808f0.png
image_title: Toric Code Plaquette Configurations
description: This image illustrates the possible configurations of a plaquette in a toric code lattice, where each plaquette is represented as a 2x2 grid. The yellow squares represent the presence of a '1' (corresponding to the operator B_p), while white squares represent '0' (corresponding to the identity operator I). These configurations demonstrate all possible states for a single plaquette, which are used to construct the ground state of the toric code by applying commuting projectors across the entire lattice.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000005_71fb354b579e2cfd38531019c66a566c2b345fa140477200a5baa105655a3d12.png
image_title: 12-qubit State Preparation and Wavefunction Evolution
description: This image illustrates the process of preparing a specific quantum state for a 12-qubit system, matching boundary conditions. It includes four stages: (A) A schematic of the 12-qubit system with four plaquettes (purple), similar to Fig. 1A. (B) A quantum circuit transforming |0⟩⊗12 → |G⟩, similar to Fig. 1B. (C) The wavefunction after applying four Hadamard gates, resulting in a uniform superposition of 2^4 = 16 bitstrings. Each Hadamard is associated with a plaquette, and portions of each plaquette are darkened based on the '1's contributed by its associated Hadamard. (D) The final wavefunction |G⟩ after completing the entire circuit. This visualization demonstrates the evolution of the quantum state through the application of Hadamard gates and CNOT operations.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000006_ba5f50d9f81a57aae0d876ccee9d23d9c724a7734e9a5045de765cde253b87a5.png
image_title: 9-qubit State Preparation with Mixed Boundary: |0_L⟩
description:
This figure illustrates the state preparation process for a 9-qubit system with a mixed boundary, resulting in the logical state |0_L⟩. The schematic is divided into several parts:
- **(A)**: A 3×3 logical qubit system with four plaquettes (purple), similar to Fig. 4A.
- **(B)**: A quantum circuit that transforms the initial state |0⟩^⊗9 into |0_L⟩ while maintaining Z_L = +1. The circuit includes Hadamard gates and CNOT gates.
- **(C)**: The wavefunction after applying the first Hadamard gate, showing a uniform superposition of 2^4 = 16 bitstrings. Each Hadamard is associated with a plaquette, and portions of each plaquette are darkened based on the 1's contributed by the associated Hadamard.
- **(D)**: The final wavefunction |0_L⟩ after completing the entire circuit, which is a superposition of all 16 bitstrings, each eigenstate of all plaquettes B_p. This state can also be expressed in the Z basis as (|0_L⟩ + X_L|0_L⟩)/√2.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000007_664e609bcb43ed12e428316ee2ed4248ddb67b583d1be22fa82a2aa8420e5ed3.png
image_title: 9-qubit State Preparation for |+L⟩
description: This image illustrates the quantum circuit and wavefunction evolution for preparing a logical state |+L⟩ using 9 qubits. The process involves transforming the initial state |0⟩⊗9 into |+L⟩ through a series of gates: (1) Hadamard (H), (2-4) CNOT gates, and (5) a transversal logical Hadamard. Part B shows the wavefunction after applying four Hadamard gates, resulting in a uniform superposition of 16 bitstrings, each associated with a star pattern. Part C depicts the final wavefunction |+L⟩ after the complete circuit, which is an eigenstate of all plaquettes and stars in the X basis, rotated by 90 degrees compared to |0L⟩.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000008_7c4382798d4e2e4a44cfb0002a27692d35f0b2a8fa4f5502bfb439deb27f8ad3.png
image_title: 量子电路示意图：Hadamard门和CNOT门的组合
description: 该图片展示了量子电路的结构，分为两部分（A和B）。在部分A中，展示了5个步骤的量子电路操作，包括应用Hadamard门（H）和多个CNOT门。每个步骤中的Hadamard门用紫色菱形表示，而CNOT门则通过控制点和目标点之间的连线表示。在部分B中，进一步详细说明了特定量子比特上的操作，包括Hadamard门和CNOT门的组合，以及对某些量子比特状态的标记（如红色圆点）。整体上，这张图描述了量子态的制备过程，涉及多量子比特的纠缠和变换。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000009_4ff0220e491945c2c8d308030722315b7c3aead199fa388b6eef46039cb911ad.png
image_title: 量子电路优化示例
description:
该图片展示了量子电路的优化过程，具体包括以下几个步骤：
A. 示例10量子比特系统，具有匹配边界。
B. 准备态|G⟩的电路，与图1B类似但旋转了90度。
C. CNOT门分解为CZ和Hadamard门。
D. 使用C将B中的CNOT门转换为CZ和Hadamard门，保持CNOT层结构。
E. 延迟H门以使量子比特尽可能长时间处于|0⟩状态。
F. 在量子比特闲置时插入X门（回声），并在最后一步使用X、√Y和恒等操作来纠正单元操作。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000010_0acbc57242d27735caf829a985d6e7aad9fef161858f1e732118ab9fa7299e47.png
image_title: Parity Data with and without Readout Correction
description: This image illustrates the comparison of parity data before and after applying iterative Bayesian unfolding for readout error correction. The figure is divided into two parts: (A) shows the corrected probability distributions using iterative Bayesian unfolding, while (B) displays the raw measured probability distributions without any correction. The color-coded circles represent different parity values, with blue indicating Z parity and purple indicating X parity. The numerical values within the circles quantify the probabilities associated with each parity measurement. This visualization highlights the effectiveness of error mitigation techniques in reducing bias and improving the accuracy of entropy estimation.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000011_0bab1131f7fb786abed8716e677f847aa4d4c5fac01523febf84f2d5b9d98e14.png
image_title: Topological Entanglement Entropy Distribution
description: This image displays a distribution of topological entanglement entropy (S_topo) values for various subsystems, likely obtained from experimental measurements on a quantum processor. The data points are represented in a grid format, with each cell showing the S_topo value for a specific subsystem configuration. The color gradient indicates the magnitude of S_topo, ranging from lower to higher values. This visualization helps assess the consistency and reliability of the measured entanglement entropy across different subsystems, providing insights into the quality of the prepared quantum states.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000013_11a8fc2ad629694d1647b6a1c398ae3861b3acc0e72fd4238b6bfc8402534f94.png
image_title: Measured Response Matrix for a 2x3 Subsystem
description: This image displays the measured response matrix for a 2x3 subsystem in a quantum processor. The matrix is visualized in a log-scale color map, where the colors represent the probability of different qubit states. The diagonal patterns and off-diagonal elements highlight the uncorrelated noise pattern in the response matrices. This visualization aids in extracting effective uncorrelated error rates from the data.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000014_43d7feb47dbbac6bd89dfdafcc9b3850c489516827216a026f48d5cc8fd0236f.png
image_title: 3x3 子系统响应矩阵的测量结果
description: 该图片展示了在误差缓解校准实验中获得的典型响应矩阵，以对数尺度显示颜色。图中呈现了 3x3 子系统的测量响应矩阵，其中颜色表示概率值（对数尺度）。通过分析这些矩阵，提取了有效的不相关错误率：e0 = 0.018 和 e1 = 0.048。此外，图片还包含了一个绿色虚线框，用于对比一个具有不相关噪声和错误率 e0 = 0.02 和 e1 = 0.05 的精确响应矩阵。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000015_1b0c0cfc8bf5d9e74d8ff530ea42c6270f5bbce95cd9dccf813664c95def1d1a.png
image_title: Exact Uncorrelated Response Matrix
description: This image displays a heatmap of an exact uncorrelated response matrix in log-scale, visualizing the probability distribution across qubit states. The colors represent the probability values on a logarithmic scale, with darker shades indicating lower probabilities and lighter shades indicating higher probabilities. This visualization highlights the uncorrelated noise pattern in the response matrices, which is crucial for error mitigation calibration experiments in quantum systems.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000017_4672e75fafc4736b2947af6d376b5570e92c0d88b183d49611f076d1472c6d79.png
image_title: 2x3 子系统上的错误缓解模拟
description: 该图展示了在 2x3 子系统上进行的错误缓解模拟结果。横轴表示重复测量次数（N_rep），纵轴表示纠缠熵估计值。图中包含四种不同的方法：'Exact'（精确值）、'Propagated IBU'（传播的不相关比特翻转误差）、'Non-propagated IBU'（非传播的不相关比特翻转误差）和 'No mitigation'（无缓解）。随着重复测量次数的增加，不同方法的纠缠熵估计值趋于稳定，其中 'Exact' 方法提供了基准值，而其他方法则展示了不同程度的误差缓解效果。小图进一步放大了低重复测量次数区域，显示了不同方法在初始阶段的差异。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000018_dc3f58f1668595bacdf2a7ef45597a8a1b239bfb3d7a766f6b97741fa1838389.png
image_title: 量子处理器上拓扑有序态的实现：第二Rényi熵随时间演化
description: 该图片展示了在量子处理器中，一个31-qubit系统从初始状态（所有qubit处于|0⟩状态）到最终目标态（标记为|G⟩）的过程中，第二Rényi熵随时间演化的可视化。图中分为两行，上行为系统结构和操作步骤，下行为对应的第二Rényi熵值的热力图。第一列显示了初始状态的31-qubit阵列，随后通过一系列操作（如Hadamard门和CZ门）逐步演化，最终达到目标态。热力图中的颜色表示不同子系统的第二Rényi熵值，蓝色代表较低的熵值，深色区域则表示较高的熵值。此图用于说明在制备拓扑有序态过程中，系统熵的变化情况，以及如何通过测量和控制来实现期望的量子态。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000019_020467e0fc72f78b91f21a281c52d55cb0767c386122341eeb44a085fa3edccc.png
image_title: 不同子系统形状的拓扑熵测量系统
description: 该图展示了用于拓扑熵（S_topo）测量的不同子系统形状，包括2×2、2×3和3×3的量子比特阵列。图中分别用蓝色、红色和浅蓝色表示不同的子系统配置：(A) 14个2×2子系统，(B) 20个2×3子系统（分为两组以示清晰），以及(C) 3个3×3子系统。这些系统被用于在31量子比特的托里码基态中测量熵数据，如文中所述。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000020_34d3b7ae11fb25039b702623b5c3657a232f8a6aac6dd28e0817f9841aeccee8.png
image_title: 不同子系统中拓扑纠缠熵的估计
description: 该图展示了在不同子系统中使用随机测量和量子态层析技术估计的拓扑纠缠熵（TEE）值。图分为三个部分，分别对应不同的子系统大小：2×2、2×3 和更大的子系统。每个部分显示了 TEE 的估计值及其误差范围，单位为自然对数底数 ln 2。图中的数据点通过条形图表示，带有误差棒，展示了不同子系统中 TEE 的分布情况。此外，虚线表示理论预测的 TEE 值，用于与实验结果进行对比。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000021_d3d4673e9a945c90aa819865c941b37390c6a72b039ed8e4ff5d8bf7b5ccd441.png
image_title: 2x2 子系统熵比较
description: 该图片展示了在 2x2 子系统中，使用随机化测量和量子态层析（tomo）方法估计的拓扑纠缠熵。图中比较了三种熵的分布：2nd Rényi 熵、Von Neumann 熵以及通过量子态层析获得的 2nd Rényi 熵。横轴表示拓扑熵的估计值，纵轴表示计数（Counts）。不同颜色的柱状图分别对应不同的熵类型：蓝色代表 2nd Rényi 熵，橙色代表 Von Neumann 熵，绿色代表通过量子态层析获得的 2nd Rényi 熵。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000022_83773d6b2e979f47496fa41953e07ec1e21c667d1f500775789ffb572203f44e.png
image_title: 熵比较：Rényi 熵与 Von Neumann 熵
description: 该图展示了不同熵度量方法在量子系统中的比较，包括第二阶 Rényi 熵、Von Neumann 熵以及通过量子态层析（tomo）计算的第二阶 Rényi 熵。横轴表示熵的估计值，纵轴表示计数（频率）。图中使用了三种颜色分别代表不同的熵度量方法：蓝色代表第二阶 Rényi 熵，橙色代表 Von Neumann 熵，绿色代表通过量子态层析计算的第二阶 Rényi 熵。数据分布显示了不同熵度量方法在相同系统下的统计结果，有助于评估这些熵度量方法的一致性和差异性。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000023_c23f6ecb9a60d2e35b28db1b48d32ce9c52b54854b3631b204c893d90cd54f61.png
image_title: 密度矩阵和保真度直方图
description: 该图片展示了4-qubit和6-qubit量子态的密度矩阵（实部和虚部）以及对应的保真度直方图。左上角和左下角分别显示了4-qubit和6-qubit密度矩阵的实部和虚部，使用三维网格图表示。右上角和右下角的直方图分别展示了4-qubit和6-qubit状态的保真度分布，其中平均保真度分别为94%和88%，并标注了不确定性范围。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000024_1095b59b2014586c568debbf7672b1072bfa20d146a85b6e13b595fdcd00f0a7.png
image_title: 量子电路分解与拓扑码操作示意图
description: 该图片展示了量子电路的分解过程以及拓扑码操作的示意图。图中包含多个部分：A、B、C 部分展示了不同拓扑码结构的分解，使用了绿色和灰色的符号表示不同的操作步骤；D 部分详细说明了特定量子门（如 Z、H、X、Y）的分解方式；E 部分通过彩色网格图展示了拓扑码的状态变化，其中不同颜色代表不同的量子态或操作结果；F 部分进一步解释了某些操作的简化形式。整体上，这张图片用于说明如何通过量子电路分解实现拓扑码操作，并展示其在理论上的效果。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000025_1d6c7086112116a57e65e13e6f38faeb8224d33735f11645aa0ed627ccdcf1a0.png
image_title: 量子态的拓扑操作示意图
description: 该图片展示了在量子处理器上实现拓扑有序状态时，不同类型的量子态（包括相互作用态和交换态）在执行特定控制操作前后的变化。图中使用了网格表示量子比特的布局，并通过颜色和符号标记来表示量子态的变化。具体来说，每个子图（A-J）展示了不同类型的量子态（如互斥态、交换态等）在执行特定控制操作（如受控XXXX或ZZZZ操作）前后的对比。这些操作旨在研究量子态的拓扑性质及其对量子计算的影响。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000026_396b93f6b3aeb6c924b0c2400d126af398071b656243a936c302a5d6c18a9c35.png
image_title: Bloch Sphere Projections for Randomized Compiling Instances
description: This image illustrates the projections of Bloch vectors in the XY plane for randomized compiling instances. It shows three panels (A, B, and C) representing different experimental setups or conditions. Each panel contains a circular plot with concentric circles indicating Bloch vector magnitudes and axes labeled X and Y. The smaller light green points represent individual Bloch vector projections for each instance, while the larger dark green point indicates the average Bloch vector over all instances. This visualization is used to determine the phase of qubit states and assess measurement errors in quantum experiments.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000027_3954cac9a31b0314967afb82070b08214a22b26cb14a2617a8084d9cf25aec58.png
image_title: CZ Decomposition for X^{1/2}_L
description: This image illustrates the decomposition of the operator X^{1/2}_L = (I - iX_L) / √2 into a sequence of quantum gates, specifically CZ, H, and S (Z^{1/2}) gates. The decomposition is shown for two different qubit array sizes: (A) a 3 × 3 qubit array and (B) a 5 × 5 qubit array. This operator is useful for logical tomography as it maps |+i_L⟩ to |0_L⟩. The circuit diagrams demonstrate how the operator is broken down into simpler gate sequences, with optimizations applied as discussed in the context.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000028_fb3308cb117cb87dbff2c252665d2266328f38951f7a69976543302d4d336222.png
image_title: 逻辑错误率与等待时间的关系
description: 该图展示了不同形状（3x3 和 5x5）和状态（|0⟩, |1⟩, |+⟩, |-⟩）的量子系统在不同等待时间下的逻辑错误概率。图中使用了不同的颜色和标记来区分各种状态和处理方式，包括原始数据、校正后的数据以及校正并解耦的数据。横轴表示等待时间（单位为纳秒），纵轴表示逻辑错误的概率。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000029_68a867e2ff5fd516b06952bd0d4969efbfe9f730c150834f5a49c4093cfa933b.png
image_title: 逻辑错误随等待时间的变化
description: 该图展示了在不同等待时间下，逻辑错误概率的变化。图中包含了3x3和5x5两种量子阵列的原始数据、校正后的数据以及解耦处理后的数据。颜色分别代表不同的量子态（|0⟩, |1⟩, |+⟩, |-⟩），形状则表示不同的处理方式（Raw、Corrected、Corrected & Decoupled）。随着等待时间的增加，逻辑错误概率逐渐上升，反映了量子系统在长时间操作中的稳定性问题。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000030_f0615e8519871ef9f108d0b3f6a9ae460dbec0447dfc65b9fb2626a10254bb40.png
image_title: 逻辑量子态的拓扑编码
description: 该图片展示了不同逻辑量子态（如 |0_L⟩, |1_L⟩, |+_L⟩, |-_L⟩, |+i_L⟩, |-i_L⟩ 和 |T_L⟩）在拓扑编码中的表示。每个逻辑量子态通过颜色编码的格子图案来可视化，其中红色和黄色分别代表 Z 奇偶校验 (A) 和 X 奇偶校验 (B) 的值，范围从 -1 到 1。这些图案反映了逻辑量子态在拓扑有序系统中的具体实现方式，用于描述量子信息的存储和保护机制。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000031_a7fc2c2f6060766bab2b84c32a50a619559d05ed5df1eaedf3d8ce81165b1f10.png
image_title: Bloch Sphere Representation of Logical Qubits
description: This image illustrates the Bloch sphere representation for logical qubits in both a 5x5 and a 3x3 quantum system. The Bloch sphere is used to visualize the state of a qubit, with points on the surface representing pure states and points inside representing mixed states. In this context, the Bloch vectors for logical qubits are shown, highlighting their orientation and distribution in the Bloch sphere. The left panel corresponds to the 5x5 system, while the right panel corresponds to the 3x3 system. The axes (X_L, Y_L, Z_L) represent the logical basis directions for these systems. The colored points and ellipses indicate the spread and coherence of the logical qubit states, providing insight into their stability and entanglement properties.

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000032_294d8a2c7827afc5a63d996db3863e8e5340192bd5a257327dc99676720805ee.png
image_title: 读出误差分析
description: 该图展示了量子处理器中不同配置下的读出误差情况。左侧子图显示了单个量子比特的孤立读出误差，中间和右侧子图分别展示了5×5和3×3量子比特阵列的同时读出误差。每个子图中的热力图表示了不同行和列的量子比特在读出过程中的误差值（以百分比形式放大100倍）。颜色越深，表示误差越大。

url: /root/autodl-tmp/markitdown/all_scratch_without_annotation/scratch_dlc/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor_images/Realizing topologically ordered states on a quantum processor-with-image-refs_artifacts/image_000033_f714c7c4324ef564c1c6b6e1df98ece2ad25342afcc3d5fd8da211e55558accf.png
image_title: 量子比特性能指标热图
description:
该图片展示了三个关键的量子比特性能指标：量子比特寿命（T1）、单量子比特XEB Pauli误差以及双量子比特CZ门每周期的Pauli误差。每个指标以热图形式呈现，分别对应不同的颜色梯度，用于直观展示不同位置量子比特的性能差异。具体包括：
1. 左侧热图显示了量子比特在空闲频率下的寿命（T1），单位为微秒。
2. 中间热图展示了单量子比特XEB实验中的Pauli误差，误差值乘以100后以热图形式表示。
3. 右侧热图则展示了双量子比特CZ门操作中每周期的Pauli误差，误差值乘以100后同样以热图形式表示。
每个热图的行和列分别对应量子处理器中的不同量子比特位置，通过颜色深浅反映误差或寿命的大小，便于分析量子处理器的整体性能和局部差异。

image_title: S&P 500 Sector Composition and Bands
description: This bar chart illustrates the optimal portfolio composition for sectors within the S&P 500, as determined by a portfolio optimization model. The blue bars represent the optimal allocation percentages for each sector, while the red lines indicate the minimum and maximum allowable investment bands per sector. The sectors include Industrials, Healthcare, Technology, Communication Services, Consumer Defensive, Consumer Cyclical, Utilities, Financial Services, Basic Materials, Real Estate, and Energy. The chart demonstrates how the model adheres to specified constraints, ensuring diversification and compliance with predefined investment limits.

image_title: 带有全局约束的组合权重分布
description: 该图展示了在S&P 500指数中，资产组合权重与当前比率（Current Ratio）之间的关系。蓝色柱状图表示不同当前比率下的资产组合权重总和，红色垂直线标记了平均当前比率值为2.084。此图体现了全局约束的效果，即允许某些资产的当前比率低于2，只要整个组合的加权平均当前比率大于2。

image_title: S&P 500 Current Ratio Distribution
description: This image displays the distribution of current ratios for assets in the S&P 500 index. The x-axis represents the current ratio, while the y-axis shows the annualized return percentage. The data points are scattered across the graph, indicating a range of current ratios and corresponding returns. A red horizontal line at the bottom highlights a threshold or constraint applied to the current ratio, likely representing a minimum acceptable level for inclusion in the portfolio.

image_title: 模型比较：不同约束条件下的年化回报与波动率
description: 该图展示了在不同模型（CPLEX、BQM、CQM 和 CQM-目标波动率）下，年化回报与年化波动率之间的关系。横轴表示年化波动率，纵轴表示年化回报。图中显示了四种模型的性能对比，其中 CPLEX 模型在低波动率时表现最优，而 BQM 模型在高波动率时表现更好。交叉点出现在 q=25 处，表明在此点之后，BQM 在处理更高二次项系数时表现更佳，能够找到更高的回报率。此外，CQM-目标波动率模型在某些情况下表现不如标准 CQM 模型，且结果不够一致。

image_title: Plain Σ-Protocol Communication Pattern
description: This image illustrates the communication pattern of a plain Σ-protocol, which is a three-round public-coin interactive proof. The protocol involves two parties: a prover (P) and a verifier (V). In the first round, P sends a message 'a' to V. In the second round, V responds with a random challenge 'c'. In the third round, P sends a response 'z' based on the challenge. The verifier V then decides whether to accept or reject the proof based on the transcript (inst, a, c, z). This diagram visually represents the flow of messages in the protocol.

image_title: Commit-and-Open Σ-Protocol Communication Diagram
description: This diagram illustrates the communication pattern of a Commit-and-Open Σ-protocol (C&O protocol). It shows three rounds of interaction between a prover (P) and a verifier (V). In the first round, the prover sends commitments y and an additional string a_◦ to the verifier. In the second round, the verifier sends a random challenge c chosen from the challenge space C ⊆ 2^[ℓ]. In the third round, the prover responds with m_c, which is a subset of messages corresponding to the indices in c. The verifier accepts if all commitments are valid (H(m_i) = y_i for all i ∈ c) and the predicate V(inst, c, m_c, a_◦) is satisfied.

image_title: Merkle树与Octopus示意图
description: 该图片展示了一个基于Merkle树的结构，其中根节点标记为y，表示Merkle树的根哈希值。叶子节点分别标记为H(m1)至H(m8)，代表消息m1至m8的哈希值。黄色标记的节点表示在打开特定承诺（如m1）时揭示的Octopus路径，这些路径包括了除被打开的消息对应的叶子节点外的所有相关认证路径。此图用于说明Merkle树在Commit-and-Open协议中的应用，特别是如何通过Octopus机制高效地验证和打开承诺。

image_title: Merkle树基础的Commit-and-Open协议流程图
description: 该图片展示了一个基于Merkle树的Commit-and-Open (C&O) 协议的交互流程。协议中，证明者（Prover, P）首先发送一个根哈希值y = MRoot_H(m)，作为对消息m的承诺。验证者（Verifier, V）随后选择一个挑战集c ⊆ [ℓ]，并将其发送给证明者。证明者根据挑战集c，提供响应z，包括被挑战的消息m_c和对应的octopus结构O = MOcto_H(c, m)。最后，验证者使用OctoVerify_H(c, y, m_c, O)函数验证响应是否正确，并检查是否满足谓词V(inst, c, m_c, a_o)。此流程图清晰地展示了C&O协议在Merkle树框架下的交互步骤和验证逻辑。

image_title: Merkle Tree with Labeling
description: The image depicts a Merkle tree structure, where nodes are labeled with specific values. The root node is labeled as 'y', and the tree branches into two subtrees. The left subtree has leaf nodes labeled with '⊥' (indicating null or undefined values). The right subtree contains internal nodes labeled with 'D(m_5)' and 'D(m_6)', which represent data associated with messages m_5 and m_6, respectively. The leaves of this subtree are also labeled with '⊥'. The tree illustrates how data is organized and hashed in a Merkle tree commitment scheme, which is relevant to cryptographic protocols discussed in the context.

image_title: 不同涡旋数的物理量分布
description: 该图展示了在不同涡旋数（s=1, 2, 3）下，Bose-Einstein凝聚体中各种物理量随η的变化情况。具体包括：(a) 场的分布f(η)，(b) 规范化的涡度密度|∇×j|，(c) 规范化的经典动能密度(1/2)mρ|v|^2，(d) 规范化的与量子压力相关的能量密度(1/2)mρ|K|^2。图中使用了黑色实线、红色虚线和蓝色点划线分别表示s=1、s=2和s=3的情况。这些曲线揭示了涡旋中心附近的物理量分布特征，以及涡旋数对这些物理量的影响。

image_title: 初始时刻的场配置示意图
description: 该图展示了一个旋转玻色-爱因斯坦凝聚体（BEC）在初始时刻的场配置，以满足周期边界条件。图中粉色和蓝色点分别代表具有正负旋绕数的涡旋或反涡旋，位于各自块的中心。红色实线表示模拟区域的边界，在此区域内波函数被迭代计算。每个块中的涡旋或反涡旋携带局部角动量，其旋绕数在相邻块之间符号相反但绝对值相同，由不同颜色表示。整体配置对称，确保了周期边界条件的满足。

image_title: 旋转玻色-爱因斯坦凝聚体中密度分布的时间演化
description: 该图展示了在不同初始条件和涡旋绕数（s = 1, 2, 3）下，旋转玻色-爱因斯坦凝聚体（BEC）的密度分布随时间演化的快照。上排面板（a, b, c）对应于初始密度较高的情况，而下排面板（d, e, f）对应于初始密度较低的情况。左、中、右三列分别对应涡旋绕数 s = 1、s = 2 和 s = 3 的结果。红色虚线表示初始密度分布，黑色实线表示静态解，绿色短虚线、蓝色点划线和黑色点线则代表了从初始状态向静态解过渡过程中的中间时刻的密度分布。随着时间的推移，无论初始密度如何，密度分布都会迅速接近其对应的静态极限，这一过程发生在约 ħ/µ 的时间尺度内。

image_title: s = 3 旋涡衰变为三个初级旋涡的密度分布随时间演化
description: 该图片展示了在不同时间点（以 ħ/µ 的单位表示）上，一个具有 s = 3 风绕数的旋涡衰变为三个初级旋涡的过程。上半部分显示了密度分布的变化，随着时间的推移，初始的单个旋涡逐渐分裂为三个新的旋涡，这些新旋涡围绕母旋涡中心旋转。下半部分则展示了相应的相位分布，反映了旋涡结构的动态变化。从 t = 0 到 t = 6000，可以看到旋涡从单一结构逐步分解并稳定为三个独立的初级旋涡，最终形成一个旋转三角形的排列。

image_title: s = 3 旋涡衰变过程中的涡度密度演化
description: 该图片展示了在 s = 3 旋涡衰变成三个初级旋涡的过程中，涡度密度 (M_03 = (∇ × j)_z) 的时间演化。涡度密度被重新缩放为无量纲值，以便与图 1 的结果直接比较。初始阶段，旋涡的环状结构保持不变，直到 t = 1500 /ℏµ 时受到扰动并破裂。随后，形成了三个新的旋涡，它们围绕母旋涡的中心旋转，如涡度分布所示。随着时间的推移，这些新形成的旋涡逐渐解耦并彼此分离，最终形成一个旋转的三角形结构。

image_title: 衰变过程中动能密度和涡度密度最大值的时间演化
description: 该图展示了在s=3涡旋衰变为三个初级涡旋的过程中，重新标度后的动能密度和涡度密度最大值随时间的演化。横轴表示时间（单位为ℏ/µ），纵轴表示最大值。红色曲线代表动能密度的最大值，绿色曲线代表涡度密度的最大值。在早期阶段（t < 1000），最大值保持稳定，对应于母涡旋的状态。在中间阶段（1000 < t < 1800），最大值开始增加，表明形成了三个耦合的初级涡旋，它们沿一条线旋转并围绕母涡旋的中心。在后期阶段（t > 1800），背景中的波动变得明显，当涡旋开始解耦时，这些波动被认为是声波的结果。

image_title: 衰变过程中动能密度和涡度密度最大值的时间演化
description: 该图展示了在s=2的涡旋衰变过程中，重新标度后的动能密度和涡度密度最大值随时间的变化。横轴表示时间（单位为ℏ/µ），纵轴表示最大值。图中显示了三个不同的曲线，分别对应不同物理量的最大值随时间的演化。在早期阶段（t < 1000），最大值保持稳定，与母涡旋相关；在中间阶段（1000 < t < 1800），最大值开始增加，表明形成了三个耦合的一级涡旋；在后期阶段（t > 1800），背景中的波动变得明显，涡旋开始解耦，这些波动被认为是声波的结果。

image_title: 密度分布随时间的演化
description: 该图展示了在不同时间点（t=0, t=15, t=30, t=45, t=60）下，Bose-Einstein凝聚体中粒子数密度分布随半径r的变化。纵坐标表示归一化的密度ρ(r,t)/ρ₀，横坐标表示以恢复长度ξ为单位的半径r。随着时间的推移，初始的高密度区域逐渐向外扩展，中心密度降低，反映了系统由于量子压力和自相互作用而发生的膨胀过程。

image_title: 密度分布随时间的演化
description: 该图展示了在非中心碰撞中，两个波包碰撞后密度分布随时间的变化。横轴表示距离（以恢复长度 ξ 为单位），纵轴表示归一化后的密度 ρ(r, t)/ρ₀。不同颜色的曲线分别对应不同的时间点：t = 0、t = 15、t = 30、t = 45 和 t = 60（单位为 ℏ/µ）。随着时间的推移，初始的高密度区域逐渐向外扩展，密度峰值降低，表明系统由于量子压力和自相互作用而发生膨胀。

image_title: 非中心碰撞中波包的密度分布随时间演化
description: 该图片展示了两个波包在非中心碰撞过程中，密度分布随时间演化的动态过程。上行显示的是归一化后的密度分布 ρ(x, y, t)/ρ₀，坐标以恢复长度 ξ 为单位，时间以 ℏ/µ 为单位。第一列（t = 0）表示初始状态，两个波包尚未发生碰撞；随着时间推进（t = 16、32、48、64），波包开始相互干涉，形成螺旋状的干涉条纹，并逐渐合并形成一个旋转区域，最终在中心区域形成一个稳定的涡旋结构。下行和第三行分别展示了不同条件下（有无相互作用、有无初速度）的密度分布变化，揭示了相互作用和初速度对涡旋形成的影响。

image_title: 非中心碰撞中波包密度分布随时间的演化
description: 该图片展示了两个波包在非中心碰撞过程中，密度分布 ρ(x, y, t)/ρ₀ 随时间演化的序列图。坐标以恢复长度 ξ 为单位，时间以 ℏ/µ̅ 为单位。图片分为五个子图，分别对应 t = 0、t = 12、t = 24、t = 36 和 t = 48 的时刻。可以看到，随着时间的推移，波包之间的干涉条纹逐渐螺旋并向对称中心汇聚，最终形成一个旋转区域。破坏性干涉条纹在对角方向分解成几个密度较低的点，这些点在旋转环境中最终成为主要涡旋。此外，图片中的紫色圆圈标记了对称中心处的缺陷位置，其绕数始终为 -1，即使周围密度发生剧烈变化。

image_title: 能量密度和涡度密度的时间演化
description: 该图片展示了在非中心碰撞过程中，波包相互作用时的能量密度和涡度密度随时间演化的分布。上半部分显示了无量纲化后的能量密度 H/(λρ₀²)，下半部分显示了 z-分量的无量纲化涡度密度 ih̵[∇ψ × ∇ψ*]z/(4mλρ₀²/h̵)。随着时间 t 的增加（从 t=0 到 t=48），可以看到能量密度和涡度密度逐渐集中到对称中心，表明涡旋的形成过程。在 t=48 时，涡旋的形成几乎完成，其能量和涡度密度分布与理论预测的涡旋解一致。

image_title: 平均密度、角动量和缠绕数随时间的演化
description: 该图展示了在特定区域内，粒子数密度、角动量密度以及缠绕数随时间演化的趋势。图中包含四条曲线：黑色虚线表示平均粒子数密度与初始密度的比值 <ρ>/ρ₀；蓝色点线表示平均角动量密度与初始密度的比值 <L_z>/ρ₀；红色实线表示平均角动量密度与平均粒子数密度的比值 <L_z>/<ρ>；绿色长虚线表示平均缠绕数 <S>_D。这些曲线反映了系统内部集体运动的动态过程，特别是涡旋形成的过程。随着时间的推移，粒子数密度先增加后饱和再缓慢下降，而角动量密度则表现出指数增长并在一定时间后趋于稳定。平均缠绕数和平均角动量密度的变化趋势相似，均指示了涡旋形成的集体行为。

image_title: Vortex-Antivortex Pair Formation and Evolution
description: This image illustrates the dynamical process of vortex-antivortex pair formation and their subsequent evolution in a Bose-Einstein condensate (BEC) system. The top panel shows the density distribution ρ(x, y, t)/ρ₀ as a function of coordinates at different times (t = 48, 52, 56, 60, 64), highlighting the production region of the vortex-antivortex pair with red squares. The middle panel depicts the phase function θ(x, y, t) within the red squares, showing the cut line where the phase discontinuity occurs. The lower panel presents the z-component of the rescaled vorticity density, emphasizing the concentration positions of vorticity density at the ends of the cut line, marked by red points. This sequence demonstrates how the initial asymmetry in particle inflow leads to the formation of vortices and antivortices, which then evolve over time. The color gradients indicate changes in density, phase, and vorticity, providing insights into the collective motion and interference patterns responsible for vortex formation.

image_title: Fermi Superfluid Vortices with Inertial Mass
description: The image illustrates the dynamics of vortices in a Fermi superfluid, highlighting the effect of inertial mass on their motion. Part (a) shows a pictorial representation of an effectively 2D superfluid (blue) confined in a disk-like trap, hosting an off-centered vortex whose core is filled by some normal component (orange). The arrows indicate the swirling superfluid flow around the vortex. Part (b) compares the trajectories of a massless vortex (gray dashed line) and a massive vortex (solid blue line). While the massless vortex travels along a uniform circular orbit, the massive vortex exhibits small-amplitude radial oscillations, leading to a characteristic 'cyclotron' motion. This behavior demonstrates the impact of the vortex's finite inertial mass on its dynamic properties.

image_title: Fermi Superfluid Vortex Dynamics and Density Profiles
description: This image illustrates the dynamics of a quantum vortex in a Fermi superfluid, as well as the spatial distributions of the superfluid and normal components. The top row shows the time evolution of the radial position fluctuations (δr₀(t)) for three different values of the interaction parameter k_Fa: -0.70, -0.85, and -1.50. Regular oscillations are observed for weaker interactions (left panels), while irregular and smaller-amplitude oscillations appear for stronger interactions (right panel). The second and third rows depict the superfluid density ρ_s (top) and normal density ρ_n (bottom) distributions for the same interaction parameters. The superfluid density exhibits a suppressed core region, indicating the presence of the vortex, while the normal density shows a corresponding peak, suggesting that the vortex core is filled with the normal component. This analysis highlights how the vortex dynamics and core structure change with varying interaction strengths.

image_title: Vortex Mass and Normal-to-Superfluid Ratio as a Function of Interaction Parameter
description: The image shows a plot illustrating the relationship between the vortex mass (m) and the ratio of normal to superfluid components (N_n/N_s) as a function of the inverse interaction parameter (1/k_Fa). The plot includes two datasets: one derived from dynamic simulations (blue dots) and another from static calculations (red dots). The inset highlights the behavior at higher values of 1/k_Fa. The x-axis represents 1/k_Fa, while the y-axis shows m in percentage and N_n/N_s. The plot is divided into regions labeled 'BCS' (Bardeen-Cooper-Schrieffer regime) and 'UFG' (Unitary Fermi Gas regime), indicating different interaction strengths. The dashed line represents a fitted theoretical curve for the vortex mass based on Eq. (7). This figure demonstrates how the vortex mass and the normal-to-superfluid ratio vary across different interaction regimes, providing insights into the dynamics and structure of vortices in Fermi superfluids.

image_title: 费米超流体中涡旋动力学特征的分析
description: 该图片展示了费米超流体中涡旋动力学特性的多个方面，具体包括：(b) 涡旋径向振荡的幅度随时间的变化，显示了不同初始角速度（Ω）对振荡幅度的影响；(c) 不同初始条件下的涡旋轨迹示意图，说明了涡旋在旋转参考系中的运动状态；(d) 离心力与角动量量子数的关系，揭示了涡旋核心态的能量分布；(e) 正常分量密度（ρ_n）、CdGM核心态密度（ρ_CdGM）和总密度（ρ）的空间分布对比，表明正常分量密度并非仅由CdGM核心态贡献。这些结果共同支持了涡旋质量的动态特征及其与核心正常成分之间的关系。

image_title: 温度依赖的涡旋质量与动力学行为
description: 该图展示了涡旋质量随温度变化的关系，以及涡旋在不同温度下的动力学行为。图(a)显示了涡旋质量（以超流体密度的百分比表示）与归一化温度 $T/T_c$ 的关系，其中蓝色圆点代表从振荡频率提取的质量，红色圆点代表从粒子数比 $N_n/N_s$ 提取的质量。插图展示了振荡频率 $\omega_T$ 随温度的变化。图(b)描绘了涡旋径向位置随时间的演化，显示了在较高温度下振荡频率降低且振幅增大的现象。图(c)展示了正常分量密度 $\rho_n$ 在涡旋核心和背景中的分布，随着温度升高，正常分量首先在涡旋核心中增强，随后在足够高的温度下也出现在背景中。

image_title: Vortex Position Tracking Benchmark
description: The image consists of two panels. The left panel shows a 3D surface plot representing the magnitude and phase of a synthetic state (denoted as \( |\tilde{\Delta}_1|/|\tilde{\Delta}_1(0,0)| \)) in a disk-like region with coordinates normalized by the radius \( R \). The color bar indicates the phase \( \arg(\tilde{\Delta}) \) ranging from -3 to 3. The right panel is a time series plot comparing the radial position fluctuations of a vortex extracted from DFT simulations (red line) and synthetic states (blue line). The red line exhibits regular oscillations significantly larger than the irregular fluctuations of the blue line, which are associated with numerical noise. This benchmark demonstrates the reliability of the vortex-tracking algorithm used to extract vortex positions from DFT simulations.

image_title: 不同网格尺寸下涡旋径向位置的时间演化
description: 该图展示了在两种不同空间网格（128×128 和 192×192，对应的格点间距分别为 k_F^{-1} 和 (2/3)k_F^{-1}）下，涡旋径向位置随时间的演化。图中显示了两个网格尺寸下的涡旋径向位置波动（以 δr_0/R 表示），并表明即使在粗化网格的情况下，涡旋轨迹的性质也几乎不受影响，验证了模拟结果的可靠性和准确性。

image_title: Vortex-Antivortex Pair Trajectories in a Disk-like Trap
description: The image shows the trajectories of a vortex-antivortex pair confined within a disk-like trap of radius R. The left panel illustrates the overall trajectories, with boxes highlighting specific portions that are zoomed and compared in detail. The right panel provides a comparison between the upper and mirrored version of the lower box, demonstrating nearly perfect symmetry of the transverse oscillations of the two vortices with respect to the horizontal axis. This symmetry further confirms the reliability of the vortex-tracking algorithm and rules out numerical artifacts.

image_title: Controlled R_y Gate Decomposition
description: This image illustrates the decomposition of a controlled R_y gate into simpler quantum gates. It shows three cases: (a) The general case where the controlled R_y rotation is expressed using two CNOT gates and two R_y gates. (b) A special case when θ = π, where the controlled R_y gate can be decomposed into single-qubit gates (R_Z and R_X). (c) Another special case when θ = -π, which also results in a decomposition into single-qubit gates (R_Z and R_X). This figure highlights how controlled R_y gates can be mapped to elementary gates under specific parameter values.

image_title: Adaptive Circuit Compression Building Blocks
description: The image illustrates the building blocks used in the adaptive circuit compression algorithm for quantum gate decomposition. Part (a) shows a two-qubit building block consisting of two U3 single-qubit rotation gates acting on individual qubits and a controlled Ry rotation gate connecting them. Part (b) depicts a 4-qubit unit cell constructed from multiple such two-qubit building blocks, forming the initial structure for approximating the target unitary U. This unit cell is designed to be periodically repeated to construct the initial quantum circuit, which is then subjected to compression cycles.

image_title: 4-qubit Unitary Decomposition Error vs. CNOT Gate Count
description: This figure presents the decomposition error (f) as a function of the number of CNOT gates for the synthesis of a 4-qubit unitary labeled 'adder-q4'. The data points are color-coded to represent results from three different quantum circuit synthesis tools: SQUANDER (blue squares), QFAST (red crosses), and LEAP (green plus signs). The plot illustrates how the decomposition error varies with the number of CNOT gates used in the synthesized circuits, highlighting the trade-off between circuit complexity and approximation accuracy across the different tools.

image_title: 6 CNOT Approximation of the 3-Qubit Gate ham_3_102
description: This image depicts a quantum circuit synthesized using the SQUANDER package to approximate the 3-qubit gate labeled as ham_3_102 from an online database. The circuit consists of 6 CNOT gates and multiple U3 gates, with specific parameter values for each gate. The error of this approximation is extremely low, at f = 4 × 10^-12, indicating high precision in the decomposition. This example demonstrates the effectiveness of the adaptive decomposition algorithm implemented in SQUANDER for compressing quantum circuits while maintaining accuracy.

image_title: 神经网络的示意图
description: 这张图片展示了一个典型的神经网络结构，其中包含多个层和节点。每个节点代表一个神经元，通过连接线表示神经元之间的权重关系。图中显示了输入层、隐藏层和输出层，以及各层之间的全连接（即每个节点与下一层的所有节点相连）。这种结构是深度学习模型的基础，用于解决回归和分类任务。

image_title: 激活函数的多项式逼近
description: 该图片展示了几种激活函数及其对应的多项式逼近。上半部分显示了ReLU函数（蓝色）与两个不同的多项式逼近（绿色和红色），其中绿色曲线为$x/2 + 3x^2/4 - x^4/4$，红色曲线为$(1+x)^2/4$。下半部分则展示了sigmoid函数（蓝色）与一个多项式逼近（绿色），其中绿色曲线为$1/2 + 3x/4 - x^3/4$。这些图示说明了如何使用多项式来近似常见的激活函数，这对于将神经网络的损失函数转换为Ising模型哈密顿量的过程至关重要。

image_title: 量子神经网络嵌入所需的物理量子比特数
description: 该图展示了在不同抽象自旋数量下，将量子神经网络嵌入到量子退火器中所需的物理量子比特数。横轴表示抽象自旋的数量，纵轴表示所需的物理量子比特数。数据点显示了随着抽象自旋数量的增加，所需物理量子比特数呈上升趋势，反映了量子神经网络编码对连接性和资源需求的依赖性。

image_title: 量子神经网络嵌入所需的物理量子比特数
description: 该图展示了在不同特征数量 $N_f$ 的情况下，隐藏层单元数量 $N_h$ 与所需物理量子比特数之间的关系。图中有三条曲线分别对应 $N_f = 2$（蓝色）、$N_f = 3$（绿色）和 $N_f = 4$（红色）。随着 $N_h$ 的增加，所需物理量子比特数呈指数增长，表明量子神经网络的复杂度随隐藏层单元数量的增加而迅速上升。

image_title: 量子神经网络的决策边界
description: 该图展示了使用量子神经网络（Quantum Neural Network, QNN）在不同数据集上获得的决策边界。图中红色点和蓝色点分别代表不同的类别，而黑色圆圈内的区域表示由QNN预测为某一类别的区域。这表明了QNN在分类任务中的表现，特别是其在处理复杂数据分布时的能力。

image_title: 量子神经网络的决策边界
description: 该图片展示了使用量子神经网络（Quantum Neural Network, QNN）在不同数据集上获得的决策边界。图中包含四个子图，每个子图代表一个不同的数据集，红色和蓝色点分别表示两类数据点。决策边界（Y(x) = 0）通过这些点的分布清晰地划分了两类数据，表明量子神经网络在处理这些数据集时的分类能力。

image_title: Quantum Neural Network Decision Boundary
description: The image shows a scatter plot of data points with two distinct clusters, one in red and one in blue. A decision boundary line is drawn through the data, separating the two clusters. This visual representation illustrates the decision boundary obtained using a quantum neural network for a specific dataset, demonstrating its ability to classify data points effectively.

image_title: 量子神经网络的决策边界
description: 该图展示了使用量子神经网络（Quantum Neural Network, QNN）在不同数据集上获得的决策边界。图中，红色和蓝色点分别代表两类数据点，黑色曲线表示决策边界 Y(x) = 0。这表明了量子神经网络在分类任务中的表现，能够区分不同类别的数据点。

image_title: Loss Function Landscape with Quantum and Classical Training
description: The image depicts a loss function landscape illustrating the differences between quantum and classical training methods. The x-axis represents weights and biases, while the y-axis represents the loss. The blue curve shows the loss trajectory of classical training, which can get trapped in local minima (indicated by red dots). In contrast, the green dot represents the global minimum that quantum training can reach by tunneling through barriers in the loss function, as indicated by the black arrow.

image_title: 量子神经网络与约束经典训练的性能比较
description: 该图展示了量子神经网络（quantum）和约束经典训练（constrained classical）在四个不同数据集（circles、quadrants、bands、ttbar）上的性能对比。每个条形图表示10次训练运行的中位数，误差棒显示了第20和第80百分位的范围。结果显示，量子神经网络在所有数据集上都表现出更高的性能，且结果更加一致，而约束经典训练则由于陷入不同的局部最小值，导致结果的方差较大。

image_title: 实验装置与合成双色场分布
description: 该图展示了用于阿秒控制的高次谐波产生和孤立阿秒脉冲生成的实验装置，以及合成双色光场的分布。图A显示了实验装置的布局，包括相位稳定的双色激光器、XUV光谱仪、MgO晶体等组件。图B描绘了合成双色场的电场分布，其中蓝色实线表示合成场，红色实线和绿色虚线分别代表800 nm和2000 nm的光场。在中心位置出现了一个显著增强的场峰值（橙色阴影区域），而相邻的800 nm场峰值（约±1/3周期）被抑制（绿色圆圈标记）。此外，图中还展示了不同时间延迟下的场分布细节，突出了两个光场相互作用产生的干涉效应。

image_title: Attosecond-Controlled Harmonic Spectra
description: This figure illustrates the experimental results of attosecond-controlled harmonic spectra generated using a synthesized two-color field. Panel A shows the measured harmonic intensity as a function of two-color delay from -120 fs to 120 fs, revealing a tilted stripe-like pattern with a slope of approximately 6.5 fs/eV. Panel B compares the harmonic intensity for the 800 nm pulse (orange) and the synthesized two-color field (blue) at a 0.5 fs delay, highlighting the spectral interference effects. Panel C displays the spectral intensity at 15.5 eV as a function of two-color delay, showing a periodic modulation with a period of 6.6 fs. Panel D presents the harmonic intensity in the Fourier time domain as a function of delay, corresponding to the data in Panel A, providing insights into the temporal structure of the attosecond pulses.

image_title: Attosecond Pulses and Spectral Interference in MgO
description:
This image presents a comprehensive comparison of numerical simulations and experimental results related to attosecond pulse generation in MgO using a synthesized two-color field. The figure includes multiple panels (A, B, C, D, E, F) that illustrate different aspects of the process:
- Panel A shows the harmonic intensity as a function of two-color delay for the semiconductor Bloch equations (SBE) simulation, with a logarithmic scale. It highlights three local maxima within each 6.6 fs period, indicated by dashed circles.
- Panel B displays the corresponding experimental results, matching the simulation with similar spectral interference patterns and periodicity.
- Panel C depicts the real-time distribution of attosecond pulses as a function of two-color delay, showing periodic intensity peaks and their evolution over time.
- Panel D compares the formation of attosecond pulse trains and isolated attosecond pulses (IAPs) at specific delays (-165 fs and 0 fs), illustrating the transition between these states.
- Panel E shows the squared electric field strength distribution as a function of two-color delay, revealing local maxima that correlate with the generation of attosecond pulses.
- Panel F provides a detailed view of the synthetic field strength square distribution at zero delay, emphasizing its temporal structure.
The overall image underscores the precise control over attosecond pulse generation through manipulation of the two-color field delay, demonstrating the theoretical and experimental validation of the process.

image_title: MgO Band Structure and Transition Dipole Moment
description: This image illustrates the band structure of MgO in the Γ-X orientation. The bottom curve represents the valence band, while the upper two curves represent the first and second conduction bands, respectively. The energy levels are plotted against the wave vector k/k_c. Additionally, the corresponding transition dipole moments (TDMs) are shown in atomic units (a.u.), highlighting the energy differences between the bands, such as 7.5 eV and 16.5 eV.

image_title: MgO 的能带结构和跃迁偶极矩
description: 该图展示了 MgO 晶体在 Γ-𝑋 方向上的能带结构及其对应的跃迁偶极矩（TDM）。图中，底部曲线代表价带，上方两条曲线分别代表第一和第二导带。此外，图中还显示了不同能带间的跃迁偶极矩随波矢 k 的变化情况，以原子单位（a.u.）表示。

image_title: Harmonic Intensity in Spectral and Fourier Time Domain
description: This figure presents the harmonic intensity distribution as a function of energy and delay time, as well as in the Fourier time domain. Panel A shows the harmonic spectrum as a function of two-color delay from -120 fs to 120 fs, calculated using Semiconductor Bloch Equations (SBEs). The white dashed line has a slope of 6.5 fs/eV, indicating the relationship between energy and delay. Panel B displays the harmonic intensity in the Fourier time domain as a function of delay, corresponding to the data in Panel A. This visualization helps analyze the temporal and spectral characteristics of high-harmonic generation processes.

image_title: Gabor Transformation of Interband and Intraband Currents at τ = 0 fs
description: This image shows the Gabor transformation result for interband and intraband currents at a two-color delay time (τ) of 0 fs. The plot is a heatmap in the energy-time domain, where the x-axis represents time in femtoseconds (fs), the y-axis represents energy in electron volts (eV), and the color scale indicates the intensity of the harmonic generation. The peak intensity is centered around 16 eV and 0 fs, indicating the generation of an isolated attosecond pulse with minimal attochirp.

image_title: Attosecond Pulse Generation with Two-Color Delay
description: The image shows the generation of attosecond pulses as a function of time and delay. The top panel displays the intensity of the electric field squared, |E(t)|^2, at a specific delay (labeled -0.9 fs). The bottom panel is a color-coded contour plot showing the intensity distribution over time and delay, highlighting the formation of isolated attosecond pulses. The color bar indicates the intensity scale, ranging from low (blue) to high (red) values.

image_title: Harmonic Intensity as a Function of Energy and Delay
description: This image presents the harmonic intensity distribution in the frequency domain as a function of energy (in electron volts, eV) and delay (in femtoseconds, fs). The plot is divided into two panels: Panel A shows the intensity for a smaller delay range from -20 fs to 20 fs, while Panel B displays the intensity over a broader delay range from -100 fs to 100 fs. The color scale indicates the intensity level, with higher intensities represented by warmer colors (e.g., red and orange) and lower intensities by cooler colors (e.g., blue). This visualization helps analyze how the harmonic intensity varies with both energy and delay, providing insights into the dynamics of high-harmonic generation processes.

image_title: MCP Quantum Efficiency
description: This figure shows the estimated quantum efficiency of the micro-channel plate (MCP) detector as a function of photon energy. The graph depicts a steep increase in quantum efficiency at lower energies, followed by a plateau at higher energies, indicating the detector's performance across different photon energy ranges.

image_title: Interband and Intraband Harmonic Spectra Comparison
description: This figure compares the harmonic spectra generated by interband and intraband currents in response to a single-color 800 nm pump with a peak intensity of 15 TW cm⁻². The x-axis represents energy (eV), while the y-axis shows counts on a logarithmic scale. Interband contributions are depicted in blue, and intraband contributions are shown in orange. The interband spectrum exhibits significantly higher harmonic intensities compared to the intraband spectrum, highlighting the dominant role of interband transitions in high-harmonic generation.

image_title: Flow-based vs. HMC Sampling in the Schwinger Model
description: The image compares the performance of flow-based sampling and Hybrid Monte Carlo (HMC) methods for estimating a key observable in the Schwinger model at criticality. The top panel shows the expectation value of the observable as a function of sample size N, with error bars indicating uncertainties. Flow-based sampling (blue dots) provides stable estimates across all sample sizes, while HMC (gray dashed lines for one stream and red dashed lines for six streams) exhibits biased results and underestimated uncertainties at larger sample sizes due to insufficient exploration of different topological sectors. The bottom panel illustrates the relative uncertainty δ(⟨ψ¯ψ⟩), showing that flow-based sampling maintains reliable uncertainties even at large sample sizes, whereas HMC's uncertainties become unreliable.

image_title: Monte Carlo History of Q and σ for Augmented HMC
description: This figure displays the Monte Carlo history of the topological charge (Q) and a related quantity (σ) over Markov Chain steps using augmented Hybrid Monte Carlo (HMC). The plot shows rapid fluctuations in both quantities, with Q exhibiting values around ±2.5 and σ showing an asymmetric distribution along positive and negative values. This behavior is characteristic of the flow model and reflects the higher total weight of even topological sectors.

image_title: Topological Susceptibility Comparison: Flow vs. HMC
description: This image compares the topological susceptibility (χ_Q) computed using the flow-based approach and the Hybrid Monte Carlo (HMC) method. The plot shows two panels: the upper panel displays χ_Q as a function of the number of configurations (N), with error bars indicating uncertainties. Three methods are compared: the flow-based approach, one HMC stream, and six HMC streams. The lower panel shows the relative uncertainty (δχ_Q) in χ_Q for the same methods. The results highlight that the flow-based approach provides more stable estimates of χ_Q compared to HMC, especially at higher statistics, where HMC exhibits larger fluctuations and underestimation of uncertainties.

image_title: Graph-Based Diagonalization Circuit
description: This image illustrates a graph-based diagonalization circuit used to simultaneously diagonalize a set of commuting Pauli operators. The circuit consists of two main steps: (1) A layer of single-qubit Clifford gates (denoted as U_1, U_2, ..., U_n in red) that rotate the input Pauli operators P_1, P_2, ..., P_m into a form suitable for diagonalization. (2) A subsequent step involving Hadamard gates (H) and controlled-Z (cz) gates, which uncompute the graph state vector |Γ⟩ (green), effectively diagonalizing the operators into the computational basis (±Z^{k_1}, ±Z^{k_2}, ..., ±Z^{k_m} shown in blue). This circuit is designed to be hardware-tailored (HT), meaning it avoids Swap gates by ensuring the graph Γ is a subgraph of the connectivity graph of the quantum device.

image_title: 量子电路构造中的解空间图示
description: 该图片展示了在固定图 Γ 下，方程 (6) 的解空间 L（黄色点表示）。背景是 d 维的零空间，由二进制矩阵 M 定义。L 是三个二次超曲面 L1（红色）、L2（绿色）和 L3（蓝色）的交集。每个超曲面 Li 是四个不相交仿射子空间 Ai、Bi、Ci 和 Di（平行线）的并集，这些子空间通过方程 (15)-(18) 定义。此图直观地说明了如何通过求解这些几何结构的交点来构建 HT 对角化电路。

image_title: 实验中HT读出电路的拍数减少
description: 该图展示了使用HT（Hadamard Transform）读出电路与传统TPB（Two-Quadrant Basis）读出电路在估计可观测量期望值时的误差和拍数效率。图(a)显示了实验和模拟中的误差ε随总拍数N_shots的变化，其中蓝色圆点代表TPB的实验结果，绿色菱形代表HT的实验结果，对应的虚线表示理想模拟结果。图(b)则展示了为了达到相同误差ε，TPB所需的拍数与HT所需的拍数之比N_shots_TPB/N_shots_HT。结果显示，在低拍数预算下，HT读出电路显著减少了所需的拍数，特别是在非常低的预算（几百次拍数）时，实验数据与模拟结果完全一致，表明抽样误差占主导地位。此外，HT方法在低拍数下的误差表现优于TPB，这对于实际应用具有重要意义。

image_title: 不同Pauli分组方法的估计采样减少比随原子间距变化
description: 该图展示了在测量氢链哈密顿量能量⟨O⟩时，不同Pauli分组方法（包括GC、HT和TPB）的估计采样减少比（ˆR）随氢原子间距离d的变化情况。图中显示了两种情况：一是固定分组复用（reused），二是针对每个d值重新计算分组（recomputed）。对于固定的Pauli分组，ˆR连续依赖于d，表明其可重复使用性；而对于重新计算分组的情况，ˆR表现出分段连续性，其中跳跃点揭示了Sorted Insertion算法输出发生变化的d值。此外，图中还比较了HT与TPB方法在低采样预算下的性能差异，强调了HT方法在实际应用中的优势。

image_title: Hardware-Tailored Pauli Grouping Algorithm Performance
description: This figure evaluates the performance of a greedy Pauli grouping algorithm using various solvers for constructing Hardware-Tailored (HT) readout circuits. It is divided into three main sections, each focusing on different classes of Hamiltonians: Hydrogen Chains, Random Hamiltonians, and the Hubbard Model. The top row (a-c) shows the estimated shot reduction ratio \(\hat{R}_{HT}/\hat{R}_{TPB}\) for HT readout circuits compared to Two-Pauli Basis (TPB) circuits across increasing qubit numbers \(n\). Different curves represent different solvers, including exhaustive and restricted solvers, with varying numbers of Pauli operators \(M\) in the observable \(O\).
